Remigia is busy with her sari-sari store (a home-based store) in her village as an additional source of income while her husband William is managing their one hectare farm. She wants to buy more stocks for her store. In order to do this she would like to borrow 5,000 pesos as her capital. She has been operating her business for about eight years and she wants to keep it because it supports their family financially. She is hoping that she can expand her store into a grocery store someday.

Remigia and her husband have two children: Wilson, 9 years old, in grade four and Willy Boy, 6 years old, in grade one. Sometimes Remigia gets upset because of the problems they are facing, but she is glad that she still manages to handle things well with the support of her husband. She hopes that her children will someday finish their studies and live a progressive life.

loans.use: Additional business capital to support her store.

loans.name: Febita

texts.en:
Febita chooses to engage in a village store business in assisting her husband with their financial needs. Due to lack of capital, she is now requesting a loan of 4,000 pesos to sustain her small business. Through the loan, she can purchase additional items such as canned goods, soft drinks, basic commodities and toiletries that are looked for by her customers. She is hoping that her current weekly income of 1,500 pesos (about $31 USD) will increase so she can provide the needs of their family and schooling of their children by working hard.

Febita is married to Eduardo, a farmer in the village. They have five children: Eduardo Jr., 23 years old; Alex, 20 years old, a college graduate and now working as a security guard; Avel, 18 years old, a college student; Arnel, 14 years old, a high school student; and their youngest is 12 years old, in grade IV.

loans.use: To sustain her village store.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a village store owner in Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela.  She started her general store business so she could help her husband, a farmer, better provide for their family and their children's education.  She is requesting a loan so she can purchase more stock to improve her store and to buy two piglets to begin a hog-raising business.   

Their four children are all studying in the primary level of education.  Her family is happily living in the agricultural village where corn and tobacco are the main products.  Most of the people are thankful that their village is rich in livelihood resources. They have a wide farm lots and a river where residents can fish.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for general store and two piglets for hog-raising

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda T. is a Smart Electronic load retailer in her village.  Glenda was the first load retailer in her village and began this business because her family's farming income did not meet their daily needs and did not cover her children's education. Her business is doing well because there are no landlines in her village and most of the residents use cellular phone as their means of communication.  She retails Globe and Smart loads.  She is requesting a loan to expand her business to meet increased customer demands.  “Just try and try until I become successful,” says Glenda.

She and her family lives in a rural and flat area in Paragu, Tumauini, Isabela where agriculture is the main livelihood of the village. Aside from electronic loading, they also have a motorcycle which is operated by her husband.  She is married to Jeremiah and they have two children: Jerlene, 10 years old, and Jennyl, 9 years old, who are in elementary grades three and four.

loans.use: To increase business capital

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus M. is engaged in a village store business.  He is thankful that his business is generating a monthly income of PHP 10,000 that supports their daily needs of their family and weekly allowance of his daughter.  His store serves as their sole source of income, thus he wanted to improve it and he is now asking for financial assistance of PHP 10,000.  This amount will enable him to purchase different stocks such as soft drinks, biscuits and canned goods.  He also plans to buy some vegetables and meat for additional income.  Jesus is doing his best for the welfare of his family.  He also shared that through patience and hard work; someday he will achieve his goals. He was thankful that through the lenders, he can have a chance assistance to develop his business.  

Jesus is 44 years old and married to Cynthia, his business partner.  They were blessed with three children: Ricky – 22 years old, a vocational course graduate in electronics; Richard – 19 years old, a graduate of a two years course and Diana Rose – 17 years old, college student.  They have a good relationship in the family and he was glad that two of their children are already working.  He hopes that his daughter will also finish her college education.

loans.use: To purchase additonal stocks

loans.name: Khafiz

texts.en: Khafiz M. is a hard-working man who strives every day to provide for his wife and four children. He manages a grocery store where he sells many staples such as bread, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods. He started this business ten years ago with less than $100, Khafiz has attracted a strong base of customers who are impressed by his efforts to travel to neighboring cities to purchase valuable items. In order to purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory, Khafiz is requesting a loan of $1200 USD.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Benigno

texts.en:
Benigno G. Jr. is engaged in a business operating a passenger tricycle. He is 34-years-old and is married to Rema-Joy, a housewife who takes care of their two children, Joana Marie,7, who is an elementary school student and Benigno III, an active one-year-old. His family is living happily in Barangay San Vicente, Tumauini, Isabela, despite the hardships that they are currently experiencing.

Benigno has been operating a passenger tricycle for almost five years. He usually travels from their village to the public market in Tuamuini where his passengers usually go to shop or work. Most of the time, he generates a weekly income of PHP500.00 which is just enough to meet the daily needs of his family. He is now requesting a loan of $150 (PHP 6000.00). He intends to use his loan to buy some spare parts for his motorcycle to insure its smooth operation and to avoid accidents. He hopes that this loan, will give him the opportunity to improve their living situation and provide a good education for their children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his tricycle

loans.name: Purisima

texts.en:
Purisima is a fish vendor in the public market of Tumauini, Isabela. She has been in this business for ten years and still hopes to improve her business through growth. She would like to borrow a loan of $150 (PHP6,000.00) that she will use to increase her inventory of fish. Through the support of her family, Purisima was always inspired in her business undertakings though sometimes, sales were not good.

She is married to Benito, a farmer and a councilor in their village. Ybanag dialect is the common language in the area. They were blessed with six children: Junior, 37; Francisca, 34; Gil, 31; Romy, 30; Jocelyn, 28; Julie, 26. Five of them were high school graduates but only their youngest, Julie, completed her college degree.

loans.use: Increase her fish inventory for resale at the market

loans.name: Sodikjon

texts.ru:
Дододжонов Содикджон Махмуджонович, 1983 года рождения. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность он  начала в 2004 году, с продажи хозтоваров. Он торгует на магазине «Детский мир», отдел парфюмерий города Вахдат. Содикджон хорошо разбирается в одеколонах, при покупке его товаров он рекомендует своим клиентам при выборе. У него много клиентов, особенно в предпраздничные дни как День Влюбленных-14 февраля,  день Национальной Армии-23 февраля, Международный Женский день-8 марта. В его ассортименте имеются  духи,  одеколоны, шампуни, косметички, лак для ногтей и волос, мусс и  т.д.
Свой товар Содикджон закупает у оптовиков. В момент праздничных сезонов ему необходимы дополнительные средства для покупки подарочного набора духов для женщин и мужчин. Для этого он хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони.
texts.en:
Sodikjon D. was born in 1983. He has been in business of selling perfumes and cosmetics since 2004. Sodikjon is an expert vendor and often recommends specific products to his many customers. Sodikjon's sales peak on holidays such as Valentine's Day (February 14), National Army Day (February 23), and International Women's Day (March 8). Sodikjon needs this loan to purchase additional inventory of gift sets for the holidays.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfume gift sets

loans.name: Diorita

texts.en:
Diorita M. lives in Barangay Paragu, one of the agricultural areas in Tumauini, Isabela. She is married to Hipolito, who manages their corn and tobacco farming. Their only daughter, Melanie, is 35-years-old and already married.

She has been managing a village store business for almost 30 years. Diorita was glad that she was able to make it despite the problems that they have encountered during the past few years. She opens her store at 5AM in the morning and stays open until 8PM, seven days a week. She is earning a net income of PHP100.00 which is a great help in meeting their daily needs.

Diorita hopes to buy more stock in order to improve her store. Thus, she wanted to ask for a loan of $125 (PHP5,000.00) that she can use for the continuous operation of her store.

loans.use: To increase inventory in the store

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie lives in Barangay San Vicente located in the municipality of Tumauini, Isabela.  She describes their place as peaceful and farming is the major source of income by most of the residents.  She is 31 years old and married to Rodolfo, a farmer.  They have two children: Shaina – 10 years old, elementary student and Harvie – 6 years old, already in pre-school.  According to her, they maintain a happy family. With her responsible husband, she is able to meet the basic needs of their family and send their children to school through his farming and her hog raising business. 

Due to the prevailing price increases in commodities and the growing needs of their family, Analie wants to borrow a loan of PHP15,000 that she will use to maintain her hog raising business.  With her business, she can help her husband in their financial needs especially in sending their children to school.  She has been in this business for ten years since she got married and she want to keep it for her family.

loans.use: Maintenance of hog raising business

loans.name: Jonard

texts.en:
Jonard,30, is a fish vendor in his village in San Vicente Tumauini, Isabela. It is located six kilometers from the town proper where he buys the fish at wholesale prices and then sells them in his village at retail prices. Jonard and his wife are hoping to sustain their fish vending business and to venture into another type of business to meet the growing needs of their family. They have been in the vending business for three years and earn a weekly income of PHP 1,000.00. He wants the best for their business. That is why he is requesting a loan of $150 (PHP 6,000.00) to increase his capital and hopefully start another business. Jonard said that together with his wife, they will work hand-in-hand to overcome every struggle they may encounter in their business.

He is married to Jocelyn and they have a two-year-old daughter named Cristel. The couple always prays for good health so they can work and do their best as responsible parents.

loans.use: Increase in capital to open a new business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is engaged in the hog raising business. She and her children are living in the rural village of Pilitan in Tuamuini, Isabela where farming is the main source of income by the people and their main products are corn and tobacco.

Her husband Carlos is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) and she was left temporarily with their four children: Boyet, 23, a high school graduate; Arlene, 21, is already married and a graduate of computer technology classes. Two of their children are still studying, one in college and one is taking vocational courses. Ofelia said that they have a relatively good family situation and they are facing every challenge without complaints, as God is always there for her.

Through the remittance of her husband, Ofelia was able to start hog raising business. This is her way of helping her husband in providing the educational needs of their children and household needs. Ofelia and her children dislike being away from her husband and this is her reason for having a small business--to keep her busy and at the same time assist in their financial needs. She is now requesting for a loan of $75 (PHP 3,000.00) to purchase feed for her hogs. Her business is really helping her in supporting their needs and she hopes that she can become successful with her endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase feed fo rhogs

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is requesting a loan amounting to $150 (PHP 6,000.00) for the repair of their passenger tricycle which is being operated by her two children. Their children rent her tricycle and give her a daily income of PHP120.00 as their rental fee. If there is extra money after repairing their tricycle, she is planning to use it to start a vending business. Leticia is hoping the progress of her current and future business will benefit her family.

Leticia is married to Danilo, a simple farmer in the community. They have four children: Mary Ann, 30, Leonila, 28, both who are elementary school graduates; Dominador, 27, Danilo, 25, both who were high school graduates. The parents were not able to send their children to school because of their poor living conditions.

loans.use: Tricycle Repair

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina manages a typical village store business in Barangay Paragu, Tumauini, Isabela. Agriculture is the main livelihood of the residents and their main crops are corn and tobacco. She 42-years-old and is married to Ismael and they are happy though they do not have a child.

She has been in the vending business for four years. Her store opens at 6AM and closes at 8PM. To minimize transportation expenses, Martina asks her neighbors do the marketing for her in buying the necessary merchandise for her store and she is thankful that they are so kind to her. She wants to improve her business and is requesting a loan of $100 (PHP 4,000.00) that she can use to finance her store. Martina hopes that with the loan, her business will prosper to support her family.

loans.use: Financial Assistance for store improvement

loans.name: Abbasali

texts.en: Abbasali Z. is a 25-year-old, single man. Abbasali has a food store where he sells different kind of goods such as candies, cookies, tea, macaronis, washing powder, matches and other goods. He proudly states that he has been in this line of business for two years. The income he is able to generate from his business allows him to support his family (he is the sole breadwinner for his parents). Abbasali purchases his goods from a neighboring city. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1200 USD over a 15-month term, the proceeds of which will be used to expand his inventory of goods (i.e., he plans to purchase additional confectionaries). Abbasali thanks everyone for their support, and he promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Jolita

texts.en:
A hard working woman from Barangay Pilitan, Tumauini Isabela is Jolita B.. She is 56-years-old and is married to Sotero. The couple has three children: Marilyn, 22, is a college graduate and now works as a salesperson; Rodel, 27, is a high school graduate; and Lutterson, 33, only graduated from primary school. The two grandchildren inspired them in their farming activities.

Due to financial problems that they are experiencing, Jolita was encouraged to join ASKI – the MFI providing the loan. She is now asking for a loan of $100 (PHP4,000.00) that she will use to maintain her vegetable production and vending business that supports her family. She hopes that her family will overcome the hardships through wise use of business capital and be able to improve her vending business. She is also planning to buy a piglet for hog raising for additional income. She believes that God is always there supporting her and her family.

loans.use: Vegetable business maintenance and purchase a piglet

loans.name: Orzugul

texts.ru:
Саидмуродова Орзугул Самаровна 1976 года рождения, замужем, у нее 2 детей. Занимается продажей детской обуви, на рынке "Станция" города Вахдат. Предпринимательскую деятельность начала в 2004 году с продажи детской одежды. В данный момент у нее детские зимние обуви (ботинки, сапоги и галоши). Товары для продажи привозит с оптового рынка «Корвон» города Душанбе. 
Ассортимент продаваемых ею товаров она хочет пополнить разновидностями спортивных обувей. Орзугул хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 1500 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев для закупа сезонных товаров.
texts.en:
Orzugul S. is married and has 2 children. Orzugul sells shoes for children at "Station" market in Vakhdat. She has been in business since 2004. At present, Orzugul sells mainly winter shoes, which she purchases at a wholesale market in Dushanbe. Orzugul will use this loan to add sports shoe models to her inventory. She will repay this loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sports shoes inventory

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
“I hope to give my children their desired education someday”, Mercedes said. An industrious wife and mother to her three children, Mercedes is into the poultry business. She came up with this kind as her way of helping her husband in providing the daily needs of their family.

Mercedes is 38-years-old and always has always hoped that despite their poor living conditions, they may able to send all her children to school so they have the opportunity to become successful. Her husband, Nicholas, is working as a part-time carpenter. Their children are: Micheal Nick, 5, who is already in kindergarten; Beverly, 13, is a sophomore in high school; and Shane Janeth,16, is a senior in high school.

Mercedes is requesting a loan for $100 (PHP 4,000.00). This is the simplest way for Mercedes to raise additional capital for her small business. She will use the amount to purchase additional chicks and some products like “balot” and vegetables to sell in their village. This amount will greatly help her in maintaining her vending business and in assisting her husband generate income for their family. Her goal in life is to work hard and be patient despite the difficulties that life may bring. She believes that in the end, something good will happen.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks

loans.name: Melito

texts.en:
A diligent businessman at 46, Melito works as an ice candy vendor. Together with his family, they live in Barangay San Vicente in Tumauini, Isabela. His wife, Nimfa, takes care of their three children: Arlene, 20, a high school graduate and now working as a saleslady; Aries,18, also a high school graduate and Angeline, 8, an elementary student studying at a public school in their village.

Melito has been in this business for almost a year. Using his single motorcycle with the ice box attached in the back, he sells his products in schools and most of his customers are students. He sells his ice candy for PHP5.00 each and he is thankful that he can earn at least PHP1,000.00 a week. His income is carefully budgeted for the daily needs of his family and allows for an allowance for their youngest child.

The business is quite good, however, it is seasonal and only has a demand during the summer. Because of this, Melito came up with the idea to venture to another business as an alternative source of income. Melito is now asking for a loan of $150 (PHP 6,000.00) that he can use for business expansion.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Shamim Aslam Masih Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil V. is 44-year-old barber who has his own barber shop in Imishli city. He started his business four years ago and during this short amount of time he became a very famous barber in his city. Kamil is married and has three children who are in school. Kamil`s business brings stable income to his family, but it is their only source of income, and he is requesting a loan to improve his shop and buy new barber tools. Kamil believes these improvements will help him attract more clients.

loans.use: To purchase new barber tools

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun T. is a married woman who runs a family business with her husband in Baganuur, a little town located 130 km outside the capital. She has two little daughters, both who are in preschool. Her husband's name is Sainbileg, and he works as an electrician. In 1999 they opened a little repairing business and began fixing electronics. Sainbileg has many repeat clients who come to get their electronics fixed. He fixes vehicle electronics, TVs, radios, cellular phones, etc. Oyun usually goes to Ulaanbaatar to collect supplies.

Oyun and Sainbileg's dream is to eventually buy their own office instead of running the business from their home. Sainbileg would like a loan to purchase repairing supplies.

loans.use: To buy electronic supplies for the family business

loans.name: Seema Sardar Masih Group
loans.use: To buy wood to sell.

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en: Ganna sells women's clothing at the city market. She has been in this business 7 years. She knows and runs it well. Ganna and her husband Mykola lost their only daughter in a car accident. Though it was very difficult for them to go on after this event, they made it and continued to live and run the business. Now Ganna wants to continue her business and develop it further. Ganna would like to receive a loan of 6,500 UAH to increase her inventories.

loans.use: to increase her inventories to sell.

loans.name: Alfiya

texts.en:
Alfiya is married with two children. She and her family live in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Alfiya sells nice quality fabrics for national dresses at a large local market. Her family is actively helping her with her business, which she started about 4 years ago. Alfiya would like to ask for a loan of $1200 USD to increase her inventory, which will keep her supplied until the spring season. She believes this timely investment will help generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Alfiya’s responsibility and strong character will assist her with the current loan repayment.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new fabrics to increase the variety of goods for sale.

loans.name: Naseem Munir Masih Group
loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop.

loans.name: Shiimaa

texts.en:
Shiimaa T. is a 63-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and son. Together with her husband and son, she runs several types of micro businesses which include sewing, selling goods from a general store, making and selling summer hats and making winter hats. Her husband and son make the hats and the son sells them at Narantuul, Mongolia's largest outdoor market. 

They make 30-50 hats per day at a cost of MNT 950 each (US $1.00 is equal to MNT 1,550.00) and sell them to a retailer for MNT 3500. The retailer sells them each for MNT 5000. Shiimaa works at her own stall to sell several types of clothes and her family's hats. Shiimaa's son aspires to have his own stall at Narantuul one day.

Shiimaa has been taking loans from XacBank since 2002, and would like to take out her 13th loan. Her family's business capital is MNT 2.0 million. She has bought a car for her family business needs and expanded her house where the hat production takes place. She would like to take out a loan to buy cotton and wool materials for making hats.

loans.use: To buy cotton and wool material for making hats

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat is single. She lives with her parents. Malohat launched her enterprise a year ago with the assistance of her parents. Today she is still selling fabrics for national dresses at the famous market in her city. Malohat has about $2,000 invested in merchandise, and her net profit is about $300 each month. Her affordable pricing policy causes good turnover of her inventory and brings Malohat high profits.

Malohat is seeking an $800 loan to increase her turnover and sales rates. Malohat started this business when she couldn't find any other way to support herself and her family, so this venture is just like her baby, and she is very excited to see it expand and become sustainable. Malohat is hoping to make good money in business and eventually do some repairs to her family's house.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged its already weak economy. 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable--conditions that have resulted in high levels of unemployment and forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new fabrics to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Farzana Sabir Masih Group
loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Khabib

texts.en:
Khabib Q. is 60 years old. He is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foods such as sweets, preserved foods, soft drinks, sugar, tea, juices, and other items in his grocery store. Khabib is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales.

Khabib has 6 years of experience in this field, his politeness has helped him grow and expand his business. Currently Khabib is requesting a loan $1200 USD with a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
A. Ismoil is a very responsible and optimistic person, and he has four children and a wife whom he has to support. Ismoil wishes to develop his business. This business consists of raising cattle in his village because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers and especially from customers who come from enclosed towns. Ismoil is helped by his wife, who is pictured. 

Ismoil is currently faced with many problems because his children are growing, and accordingly, their expenses are growing too. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in business, so we hope that his capabilities and the services provided by Imon International will help him improve his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle

loans.name: Bazar

texts.en:
A. Bazar is a 38-year-old married man who lives with his wife and three children. All of his children go to elementary school. He sells beef and sheep meat at the "Huchit shonhor" food market. He buys whole animals once a day from the wholeseller and then sells individual cuts of meat. A. lives in the ger (mongolian nomadic housing similar to a yurt).

Currently he is building a house in his yard which is about 90% completed. His wife helps him by selling meat at the market stall during the summer. In the winter time she takes care of her children at home. Their dream is to complete their house and leave it for their children. After A. turns 50 he would like to move to the country with his wife and start a farm. The picture is of A. in one of XacBank's branches. XacBank is one of Kiva's MFI partners from Mongolia.

loans.use: To buy beef and sheep meats

loans.name: Otabek

texts.en:
A livestock breeder for five years, B. Otabek was born in 1978 in Shahrituz district. He is married and responsible for four people, including his wife and three children. Very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his herd and repair his enclosure so as to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and its neighborhood, who buy animals from more than 20 km from his village. With this goal in mind, Otabek is requesting a loan that will serve as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and also make some investments.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged its already weak economy. 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable--conditions that have resulted in high levels of unemployment and forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Buy cattle and repair the enclosure

loans.name: Juma

texts.ru:
Ганиев Джума 1969 года рождения. Он женат, имеет 2 дочерей и 2 сына. Джума три года дома держит скот, у него есть 2 коровы и бычок. А  также он со своей женой пекут самсы (национальные мясные пирожки)на базаре. Они пекут в тандыре (национальная глиняная печь)утром и после обеда, тесто делает жена, дочери помогают готовить фарш и лепить самсы. По вечерам дочери и жена вышивают бисером на тканях, это тоже является доходом. 
Дома он построил бассейн для содержания воды, так как все лето вода в трубе высыхает, и эту воду дает коровам. На кредит он купит еще несколько голов скота. Через 5-6 месяцев, когда коровы  будут готовы на продажу, он их продаст и купит молодых и по низкой цене.
texts.en:
Juma G. was born in 1969. He is married and has 2 daughters and 2 sons. For 3 years, Juma has been farming cattle. He has 2 cows and a bull. During the summer, the central water supply dries up, so Juma built a water reservoir at home to have a reliable source of water at all times. Juma will use this loan to purchase several cows. He will raise the animals for 5-6 months and then sell them at a profit.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Bushra M.jamil Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji, 25, of Arifwala, Pakistan, is the wife of M. Jamil, who has operated a spare parts business for the past 25 years. The mother of a son and daughter, neither yet of school age, Bushra baji operates an embroidery business, charging $3 per dress. She has a good customer base mainly consisting of her neighbors. Having repaid her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), she is requesting a new one to buy more spare parts to expand her husband’s business.

She is a group leader of four other women in her locality. Shabana baji, Shazia baji Sugran baji, and Parveen baji are each requesting a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for their vegetable-selling businesses.

The funds for this group loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if a one does not repay, the others are responsible.

loans.use: To buy vehicular spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en: Altanchimeg Tsedendamda is a middle-aged, married woman with three children who lives with her relatives. Her husband is a plumber who works mainly in the summer and only a little during the winter. Altanchimeg's has a 15-year-old daughter (Tsetsegsuren) and an 8-year-old son (Batzorig) who both go to school. Altanchimeg works at a clothing business in Narantuul, Mongolia's largest outdoor market. The money she earns goes to pay for housing and for her children's education. She says "I want my children to contribute to Mongolia's development in the future." She is one of XacBank's many repeat borrowers who maintains a strong credit history.  Altanchimeg would like to take out a loan to buy more used clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Fakhridin

texts.en:
K. Fakhridin is a humble farmer. He is married and has four children. His job as a farmer is the only source of income for his family. He works on a land of 0.8 hectares and he is awaiting harvest season at the moment.

The main problem Fakhridin is facing in farming is a lack of capital to enable him to buy high quality seeds and fertilizer. Therefore he is applying for a loan from IMON International. He will use the loan money to buy high quality seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. He hopes to be able to improve the quality of his harvest by having all of those. With this better harvest, his revenue will increase and he will be able to finance his children's education to a higher level and better meet his family's daily needs.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged its already weak economy. 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable--conditions that have resulted in high levels of unemployment and forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 25 years old, and he lives in his parent's house with his wife. Rashid is a farmer, and since his marriage he has demonstrated that, in spite of his youth, he can support his family with hard work and dedication. Because of this, he is always in the fields, growing potatoes, onions and carrots. Rashid leaves early in the morning to water the fields, and then fertilizes and fumigates the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables Rashid to purchase goods for his home.

However the most trying feature of this work is dealing with the changes in climate, which can damage the crops. Because of this, farmers like Rashid must buy products that help protect the crops from shifts in the weather. Rashid is motivated by his desire to offer his family a better quality of life. He would like to invest in the purchase of supplies to protect his crops, so as to have a better harvest and sell his crops outside of his hometown.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir M. is a 61 year old retired accountant who lives with his wife and their 5 children.  

He is a man who, from an early age, was characterized as a hard-worker who is very dedicated to his agricultural work of raising cattle.  He saw this as an activity that would enable him to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. The challenge is to improve the breed, but in order to do so he has to feed them properly. 

Zakir has the best intentions for his children and this allows him to continue improving as a father and farmer.  This farmer yearns to expand his business so that he will be able to improve his family's standard of living.  In order to do so, he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy animals of a better breed in order to improve the quality of his herd.

loans.use: Purchase two cattle

loans.name: Dilmurat

texts.en:
K. Dilmurat is 39 years old. He is married with 7 children. He raises and sells cattle at the market. This is a very profitable business especially during the season of the celebrations. He has been in this business since 1999. He purchases his cattle at a local market called “Vahdat”. Dilmurat has a friendly family who always help each other, as you can see at the photo. He has naver made a loan with IMON International and is requesting his first one in order to purchase two more cows. This is especially important for his commerce since right now as the prices for cattle has declined. With your help Dilmurat can improve his family’s living condition. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase young cattle for develope business

loans.name: Sherbek

texts.en:
K. Sherbek is from the Shahrituz district, where he works in livestock and agriculture by raising cattle and planting vegetables. Later he reaps the benefits of this, thereby surviving with his family, which includes his wife and five children. It should be mentioned that this young man is a hard worker and has now redoubled his efforts because he wants to have better income to fulfill the needs of his family. Therefore, Sherbek has asked for the support of Kiva partner IMON International and a loan that will allow him to buy materials for planting his crops as well as to invest in purchasing and raising cattle in his area.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle and farming materials

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
S. Anvar is 27 years old. He is married with three children. He is a strong and brave man who finished secondary school but was not able to continue his education, so he dedicated himself to working. For five years now, his business has been the purchase and sale of livestock, which he offers at the Sunday market where he takes his animals. He has always liked the countryside, and being close to nature is very gratifying for him.

The difficulty arises in transporting his livestock, but Anvar isn’t discouraged by this and works very hard to fulfill his dreams. He wants financial stability so he can educate all his children. With this loan he hopes to acquire more heads of cattle to help generate additional income. With that income, he would like to start another business; he is still analyzing and deciding exactly what business that will be.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase additional cattle

loans.name: Mekhriban

texts.en:
Mekhriban A. comes from a humble family who worked very hard to get her ahead in life.  She is 41 years old, married and has three sons. 

For 6 years, Mekhriban has dedicated herself to raising and selling sheep - a job that brings economic stability to her family.  It is for her family that she works and struggles day in and day out.  Her sons help her with the business. 

She’s asking for a loan of $1200 to invest in her business and buy more sheep.  A successful business will allow her to save enough money to pay for her sons' education.  

Mekhriban is committed to responsibly repaying the loan within 15 months.  With your help, Mekhriban can accomplish her dream very soon.

loans.use: Purchase ten sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Gulmurat

texts.en:
T. Gulmurat is 37 years old. He is married and has three children who are studying at school. The gentleman is a vegetable producer with more than 10 years of experience. He works all day on the plantations and he is involved in the whole production process, including post-harvest tasks and selling the vegetables.

It is relevant to explain that the production of vegetables requires adequate fertilizer to generate the expected harvest. Nutrients and chemical fertilizers are needed throughout the process. Currently Gulmurat is having difficulties getting into the market with his product because he doesn't have enough organic matter to incorporate into the soil. There isn’t enough fertilizer and the soils are poor in nutrients. It is for these reasons that his harvests aren’t going well. He lacks the capital to be able to correctly prepare the plantations and thereby achieve a successful harvest. He is hoping for your generosity and is very thankful to all of you.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to improve his harvest

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru:
Абдусалом Тошбеков 1963 года рождения, женат имеет 6 детей. Его жена домохозяйка, она и дети помогают Абдусалому ухаживать за скотом, когда он уезжает на заработки в город. Шесть лет назад он начал куплю продажу скота.Работы нет в кишлаках, основная работа это фермерство- работа в полях выращивание сельской хозяйственной культуры. 
Семья продает молоко и молочные изделия,  а также продажа мяса от забоя скота.
Абдусалом в основном продает скот после откорма, в город приезжает на заработки  мастероа ремонтных услуг. Кредит получает на приобретение скота.
texts.en:
Abdusalom T. -- born in 1963, married, has 6 children. His wife is a homemaker. She and children help Abdusalom to tend the cattle farm, when Abdusalom leaves to work in the city. Abdusalom has been farming for 6 years. There are no other jobs left in the villages, except farming. Abdusalom's family sells milk, milk products, and meat. This provides the main source of income for Abdusalom's family. Sometimes, Abdusalom goes to the city where he makes some money working as a repairman. This loan Abdusalom will use to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Tayfa

texts.en:
Tayfa A. is a 49 year old widow with one daughter.  She is a very active woman.  

Thirteen years ago, she started her business of raising sheep.  She now has 6 sheep.  She sells the animals to the local market and local restaurants after fattening them.  With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her daughter. 

Despite her recent success, since the business is still quite small it doesn't generate enough income for the whole family.  Tayfa would like to request a loan so she can expand her business and, thereby, increase her family's income.  She will use the profit generated from the business to repay the loan on time. 

She is asking for a loan of $1200 for the term of 15 months.  She will use the loan to buy more sheep, which she will sell when they are fully grown.  The well being of Tayfa’s family and her business is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchase 10 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Jamily

texts.ru:
Джамиля предприниматель с 5–и летним стажем. Ей 24 года. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды на рынке "Станция" города Вахдат. С связи с тяжелым финансовым положением родителей, решила начать свой бизнес. На сбережения отца арендовала маленькое место на рынке и стала заниматься продажей детской одежды. Получаемый доход стал основным источником в ее семейном бюджете. Закупает она товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» и с поставщиков с Китая. Так как сейчас сезон зимних одежд ее ассортимент товара составляет разные детские юбочки, брюки, пуловер и т.д. 
Джамиле хочет получить займ в сумме 1500 сомони  сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jamily K., 24, has been in business for 5 years. She started the business to relief her family's hard financial situation. Now, Jamily's business is the main source of income for her family. Jamily sells clothing for children at "Station" market in Vakhdat. Now Jamily sells winter clothing. She needs this loan to purchase additional inventory of goods. Jamily will repay this loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for children inventory

loans.name: Shamama

texts.en:
Shamama F. is an enterprising woman.  She is always happy to do good work.  When she was young, she had a big desire for self-improvement.  

For about 10 years, she has been running a sheep-breeding business.  This activity allows her to support her three children, who are the reason for her being.  She has raised them with the help of her husband.  

Her three children are enrolled in school.  Shamama lives with them and with her parents. For this reason, she wants to increase her investment capital to be able to keep supporting them.  

Shamama has recommended her as a client with a good loan history, so AqroInvest trusts her.  With your support, she will be able to buy new animals.  Let's support this mother’s proposal!

loans.use: Purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Achiro

texts.en:
Achiro M., 40, sells bedsheets at the market. Her husband is a mechanic. They have three children who all go to school. Achiro is requesting a loan to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ibadet

texts.en:
Ibadet M. is a hard working person who tries to provide the best for his 3 beloved sons.  He carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his sheep.  

From a very young age, he was dedicated to sheep breeding, thanks to his father who was a farmer.  He has gained experience in the purchase and sale of sheep, which has brought stability to his family. 

He would now like to purchase more sheep, which can create more income for his large family, and is requesting $1200 for the term of 15 months.  Ibadet thanks you very much.

loans.use: Purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret A. is 38 years old. She is divorced and has 2 children. She dropped out of school for lack of financial support when she was a young girl. Currently she lives in Accra with her family. She decided to learn a trade to earn a living. She now runs a clothing stand and has been selling clothing materials of all kinds over the last 3 years in their busy market center. Through this business she has supported one child to complete junior high school, who is about to enter senior high school. She has insufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and a large quantity of assorted clothing materials to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance. Her dream has to do with providing a good quality education for her kids. She belongs to a village bank called Fervent.

loans.use: To purchase good quality and a large quantity of assorted clothing materials

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru:
Абдувохид Ашуров женат ему  45 лет , у него шестеро детей. С детства ухаживал за скотом , помогал родителям  при продажи на рынке участвовал на торгах с отцом,когда  подрос и научился сам  откармливать скот и продавать  рынке. В свободное время работает пастухом, и на несколько дней уходит в горы на пастбище для откорма скота овец и коз, среди чужих овец  есть и его собственные овцы. Во дворе весной сеют огород , сажают овощи, чтобы не покупать из города, потому что до города более 60 километров и большие затраты на дорогу.
Абдувохид благодарен Микроинвест и КИВА   за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abduvohid A. is married, he is 45 years old and has 6 children. He has been taking care of livestock since his childhood while he helped his parents and during trading at the market he participated in bargaining with his father; he grew up and learned to raise livestock on his own and sell it at the market. In his free time Abduvohid works as a shepherd and goes for several days into the mountains to pasture in order to feed sheep and goats, including his own sheep. In the yard, in the spring, the family plants a garden with vegetables in order to not to have to purchase them from the city as it is more then 60 kilometers to the city and the trip is expensive. Abduvohid is grateful to MicroInvest and to KIVA for their support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina R. is currently in the business of selling fresh fish and is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell. Marcelina is twenty years old and single. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Qalamirza

texts.en:
Qalamirza A. is a 62-year old man.  Qalamirza and his wife, who is a housekeeper, have 4 children.  

He has been running his own small business for nine years.  He has a store that sells shampoos, detergents, tooth-paste, brushes and other items.  Qalamirza is very friendly and polite, which attracts clientele. 

He is requesting a loan of $1200 so that he can purchase more goods to sell and increase the range of products for sale.  Qalamirza promises to pay his loan during a 15 month time period and thanks everyone who decides to support him.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell and increase the range of products for sale.

loans.name: Asatillo

texts.en:
G. Asatillo is 37 years old and married with four children. After he received a loan from IMON International, he witnessed an increased harvest for the first time in his life. With the loan, Asatillo expanded his vegetable-growing business. With the additional income from the harvest, Asatillo opened a small kiosk in his house where his family sells different foodstuff. Accordingly, his family’s standard of living has improved.

Now he is seeking a loan of 2500 Somoni ($675 USD) to expand his farming operations, which will enable him to meet his targets for the coming season and, in turn, to generate additional income.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud N. is a farmer  and has been mastering farming techniques for the past 7 years. He always makes good agricultural harvests, especially when climatic conditions are favorable. The good yield is generally due to the seeds he uses. His current seeds have been used for 3 years and are beginning to lose their productivity. He needs to renew or replace the seeds.  However, the lack of investment capital is a current problem.  Mahmud is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy selected seeds and fertilizers to revitalize his business. The improvement of his yield will give him financial means to meet the needs of his family.

He is married with four children and lives in Shahrituz district. He was born in 1967. 


Tajikistan Background 

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including, Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization dating back to the 4th millennium BC.  Today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet and Western culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Soliboy

texts.ru:
Солибой  1963 года рождения имеет 3 детей, женат.  Его основная деятельность и всех остальных односельчан откорм скота зимой он отправляет  скот на пастбище вместе с другим скотом до зимы, зимой скот пасется недалеко от дома или во дворе, потому что есть зелень и чем кормиться. Семья помогает тем что продает часть  шерсти, оставшуюся шерсть продают через 3-4 месяца, через пол года опять стригут коз и продают на рынке. Солибой выбрал мелко рогатый скот так как этот тип скота быыстро растет (откармливается) можно продавать каждый месяц по 2-3 голов скота и взамен приобретать молодняк. Зимой скот худой и дешевый , ему необходимо купить потому что появиться зелень и можно откармливать и продавать по дороже.
Для этого Солибой обратился в Микроинвест за кредитом и купил несколько голов скота.
texts.en:
Soliboy was born in 1963, he is married with three children. His main business and all of the villagers is growing cattle in the winter. He sends his cattle to the pastures with others until winter, During the winter the cattle grazes nearby the house or in the yard because there is green grass and fodder. The family helps him by selling part of the fur and the remaining part sell after three or four month. After six month they trim the goats' fur again and sell on the market. Siloboy chose a smaller cattle because this type of cattle grows faster and he can sell every month two or three heads of cattle and get young ones in return. In the winter the cattle is not fat and cheap. He needs to buy now because grass will grow soon and he can feed the cattle and sell for a higher price. For this Soliboy came to MicroInvest for a loan to buy several heads of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase several heads of cattle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace P. is currently in the business of selling Irish potatoes, cassava, and sweet potatoes and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Grace is 44 years old and married. Her husband is an IT officer. She has four children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her house rent and her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana Osei-B. is 26 years old. She is not yet married but has given birth to one child, a boy who is currently crawling. According to Susana, the man deceived her that he would marry her, and after putting her in the family way, deserted her. She is now living with her mom and younger siblings in an old family house in a small town called Simpa, a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.

Susana trades in ripped bananas and roasted groundnuts. She buys unripe bananas from wholesalers in the nearby markets, stores them until they're ripe, and then sells them with roasted groundnuts. She sells at a junction in her community. Ripped bananas and roasted groundnuts are a delicacy many people purchase in the afternoons. Susana has been in business for 3 years. It has been her desire to make enough savings to support herself and her son. She wants a loan to procure bananas in bulk so she can maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure bananas in bulk

texts.en:

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla O. is forty years old. She is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. The boy is currently in junior high school, and the girl is in primary school. Priscilla lives with her family in a house at Simpa, a farming community a few kilometers from Tarkwa in western Ghana. Her husband is a mason by profession in Takoradi, the regional capital.

Priscilla is a food vendor. She cooks rice and beans and sometimes serves soup. She cooks the food at home and sells it on the street in front of her house. Priscilla procures bags of rice and other ingredients she needs from nearby markets. She has been in this business for over thirteen years. She hopes to help her husband give their children the best education possible. Priscilla would use the loan to buy rice in bulk.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk

texts.en:
Rabiyya A. is 50 years old and married with with 2 sons.  She runs a business selling foods products such as juices, sugar, salt, spices, etc. 

She started her business 8 years ago and, since that time, has gained respect among customers thanks to her politeness and friendly attitude.  Rabiyya is not alone in her business - her husband helps her while she is at her work.  

Rabiyya also works as a school teacher, but her salary at school is so low, which is why she focused more on expanding her store business.

Rabiyya has a dream of providing excellent education to her two sons.  For this purpose, she applied for a loan of $1200 to diversify and purchase more food stuffs for her store.  Let's do our best to help this brave and hardworking woman.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia K. is thirty-five years old. She is divorced but provides for her three children, two girls and a boy. One has completed junior high school and the others are still in school. She lives with her youngest child in the farming community of Simpa, in western Ghana. The two older children live with their grandmother. 

Emilia is a seamstress by profession. She finished her apprenticeship some years ago and has been running her own business. She makes and sells clothing for school children. She buys fabric from wholesalers in the nearby big towns and offers a variety of designs for children. She also does custom work for clients who come in with their own fabrics and patterns. She owns the shop in which she works. She would use this loan to buy fabric, such as cotton, linen, and polyester, and other sewing accessories, such as linings and pins. Emilia's goal is to work hard and save enough money to acquire a bigger and better workshop.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en:
Elkhan Q. is a 27 year old man who owns his own store where he rents and sells DVDs.  He started his business in 1998 when his father retired and passed the business on to him. 

Elkhan is a very polite and friendly young man who is always ready to satisfy his clients needs, which is why his store is so popular and always full of customers. 

Elkhan is also a photographer and he would like to open, in the same store, a photography studio and combine both DVD selling and photo making in one store.  He needs $1200 to continue his efforts.

loans.use: Open a photography studio and increase the number of DVDs

texts.en:
Rebbecca A. is currently in the business of selling beads at the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Rebbecca is 25 years old and married. Her husband is a peasant. She has two children, who both go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jeannette Akuwa

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, madame Jeannette Akuwa D. est née à Kpalimé au Togo et est agée de 35 ans. Elle vit actuellement à Aného avec son époux et ses deux enfants. Commerçante de charbons de bois depuis cinq ans (05), elle a actuellement des difficultés pour trouver des fonds nécessaires afin de relancer son activité. Son atout principal est qu’elle maîtrise très bien son activité. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s'approvisionner en gros. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter son bénéfice et faire face à l’éducation de ces enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Jeannette Akuwa D. was born in Kpalimé in Togo and is 35 years old. She married, the mother of two, and currently lives in Aného with her spouse and two children. A charcoal merchant for five years, she presently has difficulty finding the funds necessary for revitalizing her business. Her main advantage is that she has quite the mastery of her work. She is requesting this loan for supplies in bulk, which will enable her to increase her profit and to address the education of these children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell charcoal

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward E. is currently in the business of selling honey at the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Edward is 41 years old and married. Her husband is a fisherman. She has three children, who all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina O. has been selling drinks and clothes for the past five years. She sells to people in her community. She needs the loan amount of 100,000 naira to purchase more drinks and clothes to sell.

Paulina is 43 years old and married with seven children. Her husband is a distributor of drinks. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen D. is twenty-six years old. He is married and has two kids, a boy and a girl. Both of his children are in primary school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in the farming community of Simpa, in western Ghana.

Stephen is a hard-working young man. He operates a hand truck. He uses his truck to help market vendors convey their goods to and from the market and the lorry station. Among the goods he transports are food stuffs and firewood. His fee for this service varies according to the distance traveled and the size and weight of the goods. Stephen has been in this business for a year now. He would use this loan to repair and maintain his hand truck and to acquire more trucks that he would rent out to others.

loans.use: To repair and maintain a handtruck

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane J. is currently in the business of selling cocks and hens at the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Jane is 24 years old and married. Her husband is a butcher. She has two children, who both go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Allakhyar

texts.en:
Allakhyar T. is 55 years old.  He is married with three children.  

He is an entrepreneur who has been selling various kinds of home products for the last 6 years.  Currently, Allakhyar has about $500 in inventory.  His monthly net profit is about $100. 

Today Allakhyar is requesting a loan of $1200 for the term of 15 months to increase his stock.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goals and become a successful entrepreneur. 

One of his dreams is that his children might progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his very best.  We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase various kinds of home products

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya A. is an entrepreneur in Tanzania. He is married and he runs a bakery at Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam. He bakes loaf bread and cakes of different sizes and designs. He has both wholesale and retail customers. He has been in the business for six years. 

Yahaya wants to expand his production but he lacks the funds to do so, so he is requesting a loan of TSH 1,200,000 ($925 USD) to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is 50 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a commercial driver while Christiana sells local gin to people in her community. The demands for her local gin are high and she tries to meet the demands of her customers. She needs a loan of 50,000 naira to purchase more local gin to sell.

Christiana says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena N. is twenty-seven years old. She is married and currently has no children. Abena lives with her husband in a rented apartment in the small town of Simpa, a farming community a few kilometers from Tarkwa in western Ghana. Her husband is a "galamsey" (independent gold miner prohibited from working land granted to mining companies).

Abena trades in game meat such as deer, grasscutter (or greater cane rat, a 20-pound rodent that lives by riverbeds and feeds on reeds),  etc. She buys the meat from the hunters in her own and nearby communities. She sells to customers in the local market and also to food vendors in her community. Abena has been in business for eight years. Her hope is to save enough to supplement her husband's small earnings. She would use the loan to buy game meat in bulk and sell it in nearby markets.

loans.use: To buy game meat

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena G. is currently in the business of selling hoes, pangas, cieasaw, and other items at the market. Jena is 35 years old and married. Her husband is a driver. She has three children, who all go to school. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand and diversify her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.use: To expand and diversify her business.

loans.name: Confort

texts.fr: Madame Confort M. est née le 24/06/1970 à Accra au Ghana. Elle vit avec son époux et leurs deux (02) enfants dans la ville d’aného où elle fait le commerce des vêtements pour hommes  et du parfum. Pour développer son commerce et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants, elle sollicite un crédit. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Confort M. was born on June 24, 1970 in Accra, Ghana. She lives with her husband and their two children in the city Aného, where she does commerce in men’s clothing and in perfumes. To develop her commerce and to ensure her children’s education, she is requesting a loan. This will enable her to increase her sales figures and her profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell clothing and perfume

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia O. sells bags of garri. The demand for her garri is high and she hopes to meet the needs of all of her customers. 

Lydia is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She now needs a loan for N50,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. 

She says thank you to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Albertha

texts.en:
Albertha N. is forty years old. She is married and has three children, two boys and a girl. Her oldest child is in junior high school, and the others are in primary school. Albertha lives with her family in a house in Simpa, a farming community a few kilometers from Tarkwa, in western Ghana. Her husband is a cocoa farmer. 

She trades in dried tilapia and other dried fish to supplement the family income. Albertha buys fresh fish directly from the fishermen in nearby communities, salts the fish, and dries them in the sun. She sells to food vendors and retailers. She also sells from a table top in the local market. She has been in business for a long time and has a lot of experience. She hopes to increase the family income so that she and her husband can give their children the best education possible. Albertha would use the loan to buy fresh fish in bulk.

loans.use: To buy fresh tilapia for salting and resale

loans.name: Madhu Maliti

texts.en:
Madhu Maliti M. lives in Khokhana, which is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. She lives with father-in-law, husband, and two children. Her husband, Mr. Gan Bahadur, works in a government office in a lower post. She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is in grade 12 and her son is in grade 9.

Mrs. M. is a farmer who grows seasonal vegetables, especially green vegetables. She sells her vegetables in the  local market in the morning and evening daily.

Mrs. M. is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 ($400 USD) to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Saada

texts.en: Saada S. Nganila  is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. A business woman who buys and sells scrap by the ton as industrial raw material. Her business is licensed. She works in collaboration with her husband. They have two purchasing stations. One that she runs and the other is run by her husband. They buy and sell more than four tons of scrap to industries per month. The business is located at Vingunguti and Matumbi in Dar es Salaam and have been in operation for ten years. Their business is profitable and also helps to keep the environment clean. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,500,000 to increase her monthly purchases and sales.

loans.use: To increase business by buying more scrape

loans.name: Idiale

texts.en: Idiale E. is 25 years old and single. She sells clothes and sarongs by hawking, carrying her goods on her head from street to street. Idiale believes that this is the best way to advertise her goods. Now Idiale has applied for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell. She says thank you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Elmik

texts.en:
Elmik H. is 53 years old and married with 2 children.  He runs his own store where he sells confectioneries such as candies, cookies and other food stuffs. 

Elmik is an agronomist, but since this profession is not in demand, he decided to open his own business in 1996.  His main purpose of living is to provide excellent education to his children and improve their lives.  This is why he tries very hard to keep his business running well. 

To increase his income, Elmik applied for $1200.  This loan will be used for purchasing more food stuffs.  Elmik is counting on your helping hand.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Achille

texts.fr: Mr Achille M. est né le 12/05/1974 à Aného. Il est marié et a cinq (05) personnes à charges. Il vit actuellement dans la ville de sa naissance avec sa famille. Il est mécanicien à deux roues. Mais avec la crise économique que traverse notre pays, son activité ne lui permet plus de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il veut associer à son ancienne activité le commerce de pétrole lampant qu'il achète à la pompe et le revend en détail.
