Ce commerce marche dans la préfecture à cause du délestage dont souffre particulièrement cette partie du pays. Les revenus qui découleront de l’exercice de cette activité lui permettront de rembourser son crédit et de faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Achille M. was born on May 5, 1974 in Aného. He is married and supports five people. Currently he lives in the city of his birth with his family and is a motorbike mechanic. But with the economic crisis cutting across our country, his business no longer allows him to provide for his family. He wants to add to his previous business by including commerce in lamp fuel, which he buys at the pump and resells. This commerce works in the prefecture because of the cuts in electricity from which this particular region of the country suffers. The income derived from this business will enable him to repay the loan and to cope with the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell kerosene

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Bimala D. is a farmer in Khokhana, Nepal. She mostly grows green vegetables on her land and depends on seasonal farming due to the lack of modern tools and technology.  She sells her vegetables at the local market in the morning and evening every day. She is requesting a loan for Rs30000.00 loans to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm.

Mrs. D. lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and grand daughter. Her husband Mr. Raju D. is a carpenter and works in a furniture shop. Her son went abroad to work and her grand son is studying in grade 1.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Chandeshsori

texts.en:
Mrs. Chandeshsori M. and her husband Mr. Keran M. are farmers in Khokhana, Nepal. They prefer to grow seasonal vegetables on their land because they do not have an irrigation system. They sell their vegetables in local markets in the morning and in the evening. Mrs. M. requests a loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

Mrs. Chandeshsori M. lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and two children in a village called Khokhana.  She has a son whose attending primary school and a daughter who is studying in grade 4.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Purna Maiya

texts.en:
Purna Maiya M. is the resident of KhoKhana. Khokhana is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in agriculture. Mrs. M. lives in a single family dwelling with her husband and three children. Her husband is Bekha Narayan M., a farmer. She has two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is now studying in grade 7. Her older son is studying in grade 3, and the younger son is just 9 months old.

Mrs. M. is a grocery shopkeeper in Khokhana. She opened her grocery shop 10 years ago to upgrade the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop like rice, maize, paddy, noodles and so on. All her children help her in her shop. Now Mrs. M. is requesting a loan to expand her business a little more so that she could earn more for her husband and the family.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr: Mme Lydia T. est née le 24/04/1961 à Aného. Elle  est mariée et a quatre (04) personnes à charges. Elle réside actuellement à Aného avec sa famille. Cela fait déjà six (06) ans qu’elle exerce le commerce des produits alimentaires. Voulant transformer son commerce de produits alimentaires en un minimarket, elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’approvisionner en quantité enfin de pouvoir remplir la boutique qu’elle a prise soin de louer déjà. Des revenus qui découleront de l’exercice de cette activité lui permettront de rembourser son crédit et faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lydia T. was born on April 24, 1961 in Aného. She is marrried and responsible for 4 persons. She is living in Aného with her family. For six years already, she has been selling foodstuffs. Wishing to change her little foodstuffs business into a mini-market, she is requesting this loan to stock up in greater quantity, so as to fill the little store that she has already rented. The income from her business will permit her to reimburse the loan and support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Remi

texts.en: Remi S. S.  is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur businessman. He runs a café and bar at Mbagala Ward in Dar ers Salaam. He sells a variety of soft drinks and hot (alcoholic) drinks and his café sells varieties of food, including pork, goat, chicken and cow meat. His wife is a business manager. He has been running this business for the past six years. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 to expand his business

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en:
Jafar M. is 46 years old.  He is married with three sons.  He is an entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as sweets, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store. 

Jafar is not alone in this business.  His whole family actively helps him with sales.  Jafar's additional source of income is teaching. 

Jafar applied for a $1200 loan to grow and expand his business.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and a while to achieve his goals and become a successful entrepreneur.  We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila G. has two daughters. Her older daughter is in grade 8 and her younger daughter is in grade 7. Her husband, Mr. Dadi Ram, is engaged in agricultural work 

Sushila already owns two cows and she has been selling milk in her area. In Nepal, pure and fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for human nutrition.

Sushila lives in a growing neighborhood and, in that area, the demand for milk is constantly increasing. She carries her milk containers and sells door-to-door each day in the morning and evening.  Because of the rising demand for milk, she wants to buy another cow to increase the production of milk. She is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00. Sushila plans to purchase a young milking cow.

loans.use: To buy young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: Mme Afiavi S. est née 15/05/1981 à Agoégan. Elle  est mariée et a un enfant à charge. Elle réside actuellement à Aného avec son mari. Elle fait le commerce des produits alimentaires depuis plus de cinq (05)ans. Voulant transformer son commerce de produits alimentaires en un minimarket, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en quantité enfin de pouvoir remplir la boutique. Cela lui permettra d'augmenter ses bénéfices et de mieux faire face aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mme Afiavi S. was born on May 15, 1981 in Agoégan. She is married and raising one child. She is living in Aného with her husband. She has been selling foodstuffs for more than 5 years. Wishing to change her foodstuffs business into a mini-market, she is requesting a loan so as to buy greater quantities to fill up her store. This will permit her to increase her earnings and better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara A. sells charcoal in the Vituka Ward in Dar es Salaam. She is a Tanzanian married woman with three school-aged children. She has been with YOSEFO Services for six years. She managed to build her own house from  the income that she earned in her business. 

She purchases the charcoal bags directly from the wholesale producers and sells them to retail customers. Charcoal is the main source of power in most developing countries due to the high cost of electricity. 

She is requesting a loan of  Tshs 1,500.000 to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman A. is a 47 year old farmer, not only devoted to his work but also to being the father of a family consisting of his wife, 3 children and elderly parents. 

He works hard in the raising of cattle, which he has taken out to graze in the early mornings since his young age.  Without a doubt, it is not an easy task, but the love for his family gives his work reason and meaning. 

Currently, Ilham wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of his cattle, which, in the long run, will provide better financial income.  For this purpose, he applied for $1200 to purchase two calves.  If you support him, he will be forever grateful.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose V. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and business woman. She sells traditional clothes (Vitenge and Kanga) at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam. She also transports her clothes to various Tanzanian regions to sell. She purchases the commodities wholesales from Mnazi Mmoja traditional wholesale clothes shops. She has been in this business for six years. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000. to buy more business items.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Ghislain

texts.fr: Mr A. Ghislain est né à Goumoukopé le 07/10/1977. Résidant à Kpémé, il est marié et père de quatre 04 enfants. En plus de ces derniers il à quatre 04 personnes à charge. M Ghyslain fait le commerce  de produits de premières nécessités depuis neuf (09) ans. Il dispose lui même d'une boutique et sa clientèle ne cesse d'augmenter. Pour faire face à la demande grandissante de sa clientèle, il sollicite un financement. Les revenus tirés de ce projet l’aideront à améliorer sa  situation familiale.
texts.en:
Mr Ghislain A. was born in Goumoukopé on October 7, 1977. Residing in Kpémé, he is married and the father of 4 children. Besides these, he has four other dependents as well. Ghislain has been selling staple goods for 9 years. He owns his own shop and his clientele is continuing to grow. To cope with the increasing demand from his customers, he is requesting a loan. The income from this increased capital will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of staples

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase of seafoods and woodland products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a new motor for his taxi

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Madame A. Rose est une veuve avec quatre (04) enfants. Née en 1950 à Kpémé, cette brave femme s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits vivriers notamment les céreales, activité qu’elle maîtrise bien après trente (30) années d’exercice. En effet, elle va de marché en marché pour acheter de céréales qu’elle stocke et revend à ses nombreux clients. N’ayant plus suffisamment de moyens financiers pour satisfaire la demande de ses clients et augmenter ses revenus en baisse, elle sollicite donc un crédit pour renforcer son commerce et avoir un fonds de roulement solide et surtout maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Ms. Rose A. is a widow with four children. Born in 1950 in Kpémé, this good and honest woman got started in the commerce of staple foods, notably grains. This is a business she has mastered after working thirty years at it. She actually goes from marketplace to marketplace to buy grain, which she stocks up and then resells to her numerous customers.

No longer having sufficient financial means for satisfying the demands of her customers and for increasing her dropping revenues, she is requesting a loan, so as to boost her commerce and to have solid working capital and especially to maximize her profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An inventory of grain for resale

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El señor Oscar Danilo P. tiene la edad de 35 años, habita en el Kilómetro. 13 Carretera a Masaya, junto a su esposa e hijas, la esposa de él trabaja como domestica para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar ya que ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijas mujeres las cuales tiene  10 y 12 años de edad y necesitan la educación adecuada para que sean dos profesionales y no trabajen tan duro como yo,  los planes de don Oscar es poder terminar su casa ya que le hace falta materiales de construcción para poder realizar sus sueños ; el trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una casa privada. Con esta solicitud va invertir en infraestructura para hacer las mejoras y gozar de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo P. is 35 and lives on Carretera a Masaya with his wife and daughters. His wife works as a housekeeper to help out with the household expenses, as they have two daughters, 10 and 12, who need to get a good education so they can become professionals and not have to work as hard as their parents. Oscar would like to be able to finish his house, but lacks the construction materials he needs to realize his dream. He works as a security guard in private home. He plans to invest his loan in infrastructure for his home improvements so he can enjoy a decent house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make improvements on his house

loans.name: Dios Verdadero 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
The 10 group members of the Dios Verdadero (True God) Bank of Hope live in San Pedro D. Macoris in the southeastern Dominican Republic. Groups 1 and 2 from this bank are participating in this loan.

Juana T. is the Group 1 Coordinator  She has a 14-year old child and runs a small variety store in her house where she sells a variety of products, specializing in accessories. Juana will use this loan to buy new merchandise to sell so she has more variety to offer her clients. Her dream is to own a boutique some day. 

Most of the other group members are engaged in diverse retail activities, from selling undergarments to bread and fish. Some others have repair shops or cafeterias. They are all looking forward to expanding their businesses to keep providing their children and families with an improved quality of life.
 
On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy new merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Koumassifio   T.

texts.fr: Né le 22/11/1962 à Aného, M D. T. Koumassifio est marié et père de quatre enfants. Très entreprenant, il sollicite un financement pour acheter un petit frigo pour la vente des produits congelés. Sa femme étant alitée depuis 3 ans, il est seul à s’occuper de la famille. Ce fonds de roulement lui permettra de   dégager des bénéfices qui pourront l’aider dans l’éducation de ses enfants et le traitement de sa femme.
texts.en:
Born on November 22, 1962 in Aného, Mr. T. Koumassifio D. is married and the father of four. A very enterprising man, he is requesting financing to buy a small refrigerator for selling frozen products. Because his wife has been bedridden for three years, he alone takes care of his family. As working capital, these funds will enable him to clear a profit that will help in educating his children and in providing treatment for his wife.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a small refrigerator for selling frozen goods

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is thirty-two years old. She is married and has three children, a boy and two girls. Two of her children are in primary school. Her youngest is not of school age yet. Elizabeth lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the small town of Simpa, a farming community a few kilometers from Tarkwa, in western  Ghana. Her husband is a cocoa farmer, and she is a food vendor.

Elizabeth prepares "rice kenkey" (a fermented dumpling that is partially cooked and then steamed) and distributes to retailers in her community. She uses local rice to prepare the kenkey. She prepares rice kenkey by pounding the rice, mixing it with salt, wrapping balls of the meal in plantain leaves, and then cooking. Elizabeth also sells in the local market in addition to distributing to retailers. She has been in this business for seven years. Her hope is to save enough to supplement the family income so that she and her husband can take good care of the family. She would use the loan to buy local rice in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Gutu

texts.en: This is Gutu M. she lives in Stefan Voda district and she is willing to start her own business, namely in grain and vegetable growing. She wishes to launch this business because she has the possibility to buy new clothes with a very low price so she can earn very good profit in the future. She is 59 years old but she is a mother of two children that are pupils in the middle school in Copceac village. She decided to borrow a loan from MicroInvest to start her business namely to increase working capital for agriculture. Her future plan is to build a green house in her garden to have a rich harvest all year around.

loans.use: increases working capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “03 D. Mayo”, del Barrio Progreso, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 76 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (primer grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, se dedica a la comercialización D. abarrote al por menor.
Su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, etc.) 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, monto que será pagado en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mercaderías para su negocio (arroz por sacos, azúcar pos saco, aceite por galones, golosinas, etc.), ella desea auto sostenerse, por ello todas sus ganancias las invierte en ella, debido a su edad, puesto que sus hijos tienen su familia y se encuentran lejos D. ella.  
Ella agradece a Manuela Ramos, por brindarle su ayuda y poder acceder a estas facilidades para poder seguir trabando.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of Banco Comunal "03 D. Mayo." She lives in the Progreso neighborhood, within the Collao province and Ilave district, insiD. the department of Puno. She's 76 years old (with a first-graD. education), widowed, and has 4 children. She's worked with the Manuela Ramos MFI for 4 years, during which time she has dedicated herself to the retail sale of groceries. Her first loan (300 soles) was used to purchase merchandise (rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc.) for her business. With this second loan for 1500 soles ($475 dollars), which she will repay in 5 monthly installments, she will be able to purchase additional merchandise (sacks of rice and sugar, gallon containers of cooking oils, candies, etc.) She hopes to become fully self-sustainable, which is why she always re-invests her additional profits back into her business (she can afford to do this due both to her age and to the fact that her children now live far away with their own families). Rosa is extremely thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her to be able to continue to work.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her business (rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.)

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Agé de 29 ans, Monsieur B. Koffi est marié et a 4 personnes à charge. Grâce à l’activité de conduite de taxi moto qu’il a entrepris depuis plus de 10 ans, il parvient à répondre aux besoins essentiels de ses enfants. Mais aujourd’hui face à l’augmentation sans cesse croissante des charges du ménage, il se trouve obligé d’accroître son revenu afin de continuer d’assurer les conditions de vie meilleures à ses enfants. Pour ce faire, il décide de s’acheter une nouvelle taxi moto et de confier l’ancienne à une autre personne. N’ayant pas de fonds propres pour réaliser son projet, il sollicite un crédit pour arriver à ses fins.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi B., age 29, is married and support four people. Thanks to his work driving a motorbike taxi that he undertook ten years ago, he has been able to respond to the essential needs of his children. But today, faced with the ever-growing rise in household expenses, he finds himself compelled to increase his income to continue to ensure the best living conditions for his children. To do so, he decided to buy a new moto taxi and to entrust the old one to someone else. Lacking the working capital to realize his project, he is requesting a loan to reach his goals.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina sells fruit and vegetables at “Covered Market” in Belaya Tserkov, central Ukraine. She currently has a vending location at a huge outdoor market where hundreds of vendors sell all sorts of different items. Valentina started her business about 6 years ago. She has an entrepreneurial mind and has worked hard to develop her business. Some of Valentina’s personal goals are: fix the roof in her kitchen and generate sufficient income to pay college fee for her kids. 

Valentina has requested a loan of 5,000 Ukrainian Grivnas to purchase additional merchandise for her vending kiosk. With assorted inventory, she will be able to increase her sales and continue working to make a better life for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Nidia Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Nidia es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, de Santa Bárbara, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijos a su cargo y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, su negocio es la venta de calzados (zapatillas). Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (zapatillas). 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mas mercadería, es decir más zapatillas, que piensa venderlos en los mercados de Puno y Arequipa, uno de sus mayor sueños es abrir su propia tienda de artículos deportivos con lo cual podrá garantizar la educación de sus hijos y una buena calidad de vida para toda su familia. 
 
Ella piensa que es importante el apoyo a las mujeres con créditos, para mejorar sus negocios y esta agradecida a Manuela Ramos por ese apoyo
texts.en:
Nidia is a member of Banco Comunal "3 de Mayo." She lives in Santa Barbara, within the Ilave district and El Collao province, inside the department of Puno. She's 22 years old (with a secondary school education), has one child, and lives with her partner. She's worked with the Manuela Ramos institution for 3 years, during which time she has dedicated herself to selling shoes. She used her first loan of 300 soles to purchase merchandise (shoes) for her business. With this loan of 1000 soles ($325 dollars), that she will repay in 5 monthly installments, she will be able to purchase additional merchandise that she will sell in the markets of Puno and Arequipa. Her dreams include owning a sporting goods store, which will help ensure a proper education for her child, and a good quality of life for her whole family. She believes that providing credit to women (so they can improve their businesses) is very important, and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise (shoes) for her business.

loans.name: Mihailovici

texts.en: I. is 36 years old and she is a very responsible person with great intentions in business. Her business is cattle growing for sale of cow meat. Meat prices have increased and she just wants to raise the number of cows in order to earn more profit for the work she does so she decided to borrow a loan from MicroInvest for a period of one year in which she is sure that she will return the money without any problems. Her future plan is to raise pigs also because pork prices are also reasonable for a business.

loans.use: increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children - a boy and a girl. She says both of them are currently in the basic school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa, a farming community which is a few kilometers away from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.

The majority of the inhabitants are farmers or merchants. Grace works hard to help her husband take care of the family. Her husband is a cocoa/cassava farmer. Grace sells foodstuffs such as yams, cassava, plantains, cocoyams, etc. in the local market square. She buys the goods from farmers in the community.

She has been in business for about four years. She also distributes to food vendors in her community. Grace wants a loan to buy foodstuffs in bulk. She hopes to help her husband send their children all the way through school.

loans.use: To procure foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Dios Es Amor 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
These two groups belonging to the Dios es Amor (God is Love) Bank of Hope, in La Romana, Dominican Republic, are receiving their first loan with Esperanza International. This vibrant group of entrepreneurs is very excited and hopeful about the course their businesses will take with this new capital injection. Neganis A. is one of the group coordinators. She is married and has 6 children. Her business consists of personal sales of beauty products and undergarments. She sells in her home, and to her own neighbors. Some of the other members' businesses include colmados (small convenience stores) and new/used clothing sales. Since Neganis has to go sell and collect payments from her clients, she dreams of having her own store one day, so she can stay there and customers will come to her instead. She also thinks this will allow her to spend more time with her young children. 
On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: purchase new merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Né le 1er janvier 1966 à Aklakou, Monsieur M. Komla s’est spécialisé dans le transport en commun depuis plus de quinze (15) ans. Grâce à son salaire mensuel, il a réalisé un minimum d’économie. Aujourd’hui, il cherche un complément d’argent pour s’acheter une voiture de transport pour être autonome et dégager une importante marge bénéficiaire. Ceci lui permettra d’assurer de meilleures conditions de vie à son futur ménage et de créer une entreprise de transport en commun.
texts.en:
Born on January 1, 1966 in Aklakou, Mr. Komla M. has been specializing in public transportation for fifteen years. Due to his monthly salary, he has minimal savings. Today, he is looking for additional money to buy a vehicle, so as to be autonomous and to make a good profit margin. This will enable him to ensure the best living conditions for his future family and home, as well as to establish a public transport enterprise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle for providing public transportation

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with a daughter. She sells women’s clothing in several markets of Kahovka and the Kherson region. Valentina started this business five years ago. Currently, she has over 13,500 Grivnas in turnover capital. Her net profit is about 2,500 Grivnas a month. 

Valentina would like to increase the assorted inventory in her kiosk and improve her sales as well. Today she is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to obtain a stable source of income and continue developing her business. A committed wife and mother, Valentina works tirelessly to improve the quality of life for her family. We are hoping that her eye for market trends and customer needs will help her maintain consistent growth in her business and reach success.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her business

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, de Santa Bárbara, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios de primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, posee un negocio de venta de calzados (zapatillas), relojes y joyas en el mercado de Puno; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (zapatillas). 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mas mercadería (zapatillas y relojes), que piensa venderlos en los mercados de Puno y Juliaca, con ello piensa ayudar en su calidad de vida y apoyo en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a member of Banco Comunal "3 de Mayo." She's 50 years old (with an elementary school education), married, and has 4 children. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos institution for three years, and she owns her own business selling shoes, watches, and jewelry inside the Puno market. She used her first loan of 300 soles to purchase merchandise (shoes) for her business. With this loan for 1500 soles ($475 dollars), that she will repay in 5 monthly installments, she will be able to purchase additional merchandise (shoes and watches) which she will sell in the Puno and Juliaca markets. Being able to grow her business will allow her to further support her children's education and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tu purchase additional merchandise (shoes and watches) for her business.

loans.name: Yuryi's Group

texts.en:
Yuryi is a married father with a 5-year-old. His family lives in Tavryisk. Yuryi offers ceremonial services and sells ceremonial inventory in his home town. He has been in this business for 4 years. His turnover capital is about 13,000 Grivnas and net profit exceeds 3,000 Grivnas a month. One of the specific characteristics of his business is high turn-around of inventory.

Yuryi is very focused and determined. He is grateful for the loans he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” which have helped the expansion of his business. Today, Yuryi is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to purchase additional raw materials to manufacture funeral wreaths, e.g. sham flowers, wire and ribbons. The loan will be beneficial for Yuryi’s business by keeping it competitive and promoting further growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for him and his family.

loans.use: Ceremonial inventory and services

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana inició el negocio cuando se  divorcio y sus hijos se quedaron bajo su responsabilidad, aunque su ex-esposo les ayuda mucho a veces no era suficiente, para cubrir todas las necesidades del hogar; por lo que  comenzó el negocio en Agosto de 1993, por consejo de una amiga ya que ella le comentaba que el producto dejaba muy buenas ganancias por lo que se animo a seguir su consejo y empezó realizando un pequeño pedido el cual pudo vender entre sus amistades muy rápido para sorpresa suya y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien. 

Ella ha visto el progreso de su negocio con el paso de los años ya que comenzó prácticamente con  cero clientas a la actualidad que ya cuento con un buen número de clientas lo cual le ha permitido también agregar la venta de lencería aprovechando sus clientas y eso también me ha redituado ganancias

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $5000 que pagara en 8 catocenas lo que le permitirá surtir pedidos pendientes tanto de productos de belleza como de lencería para tener un mejor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes
texts.en:
Juana started a cosmetics business in August of 1993 following her divorce (at which time she took full custody of her children). Even though her ex-husband supported them as much as he could, she took the advice of a friend and started her own business (selling mostly to her acquaintances), and used her profits to cover her household expenses. Her business has continued to flourish through the years from zero clients at its inception to a large number of clients nowadays. This increase in clients has allowed her to expand her business to include the sale of underwear (which has also resulted in increased profits). This loan of $350 dollars (which she will repay in 8 installments) will allow her to both fulfill all of her current orders for beauty products and underwear, and to increase the product selection that she can offer to all of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (beauty products and underwear) for her business

loans.name: Yawovi

texts.fr: Agé de 53 ans, Monsieur A. Yawovi est marié et père de 05 enfants à charge. Il  mène l’activité de stockage et de vente de céréales depuis 20 ans. C’est une activité très rentable dans la mesure où le maïs qui est le principal produit d’aliment de base devient une denrée rare en temps de soudure. Malgré l’importance des stockes de Monsieur A., il ne parvient pas à satisfaire à la forte demande de la population. Il veut augmenter son stock et dégager plus de bénéfices. Une fois les bénéfices réalisés, il pourra améliorer les conditions et niveau de vie de son ménage.
texts.en:
Mr. Yawovi A., age 53, is married and the father of five. For twenty years, his work has involved storing and selling grain. This is a very profitable business to the extent that corn, which is the main staple, becomes a rare item during the off-season. Despite the importance of stocked supplies, he is unable to satisfy the strong demand of the population. He wants to increase his stock and to make more profit. Once the profits are realized, he will be able to improve his household’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Storage and sale of corn

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
La señora Nely es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, ella pose un negocio de artesanías a base de bayeta y lana (bordados); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual adquirió materiales para seguir sus bordados. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1200.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas; podrá adquirir mas materiales para realizar bordados y tejidos a crochet; y llevar sus tejidos a los lugares turísticos de la región puesto que tiene varios pedidos y su mercado va creciendo, su anhelo es comprarse una casa en la ciudad de Ilave para poder estar junto con sus hijos y brindarles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Nely is an associate of the communal bank "03 de Mayo," located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 26 years old, is married, has three children and has completed her elementary education.

She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year, and has a handicraft business selling woolen-embroidered cloth. Her first loan was for 500 soles, with which she purchased materials to continue with her embroidery.

With this loan of 1200 soles, an amount which she undertakes to pay off in five instalments, she will be able to purchase more materials to make embroidery and crocheted fabrics, and to transport her fabrics to the tourist areas of the region, since she has several orders and her business is growing. Her desire is to buy a house in the city of Ilave in order to be able to be together with her children and to offer them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make embroidery and crocheted fabrics, and to transport her fabrics to the tourist areas of the region.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline started her business selling clothes and sarongs in 2008. Now that the demand for her goods is increasing, she hopes to increase her profits as well. She needs a loan for N50,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Roseline is 28 years old and married. Her husband sells motor spare parts. They do not have any children. Roseline says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 55 años y vive con sus 3 hijos en su propia casa. Se dedica a la fabricación de chompas de lana a menor escala, sus tejidos son a mano y a máquina y lo viene haciendo desde hace 10 años por la demanda de estas prendas de vestir que combaten el clima frío de su zona y más todavía en época de invierno. Su forma de trabajo consiste en elaborar ella misma las chompas que requieren casi todo el día de su tiempo, lo bueno es que trabaja en la comodidad de su casa de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana los vende. Debido a la calidad de sus trabajos sus propios vecinos hacen varios pedidos y es así que Delfina tiene proyectos de seguir adelante y de crecer, como tener un local comercial donde pueda exhibir todos sus trabajos. Es la segunda vez que  Delfina solicita un préstamo en MFP, ella está trabajando por la unión de su grupo a la cual ella guarda mucho aprecio por ser un espacio de amistad. El dinero que solicita lo usará en la compra de lana en grandes cantidades, para elaborar chompas delgadas comprará lana delgada valorizada en 20 soles el paquete de 1 kilo y otras variedades con lo que cubrirá la totalidad de lo solicitado.
texts.en:
Delfina is 55 years old and lives with her three children in her own home. She works making wool sweaters by hand and by machine. She has done this for 10 years because there is so much demand for this clothing to combat the her region's cold climate, especially in the wintertime. She works alone making sweaters almost the whole day, but the good part is that she can work in the comfort of her own home Monday to Friday and sell the sweaters on the weekends. Due to the quality of her work her own neighbors make various requests so that Delfina has projects lined up in advance and will be able to grow. She hopes to have a kiosk where she can exhibit her work. This is the second time Delfina has requested a loan through MFP. She is part of the association and she values this group for being a place of friendship. The money she asks for will be used to buy large quantities of wool. For knitting light sweaters she will buy lightweight yarn worth 20 soles (about $6.00 USD) a package and with the remaining money she will buy other varieties of wool.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool for knitting

loans.name: Wayna Ccapac Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal, se llama "WAYNA CAPAC", Este nombre responD. a uno D. los herederos del trono  Inka, quién en su gobierno extendió el imperio D. los Inkas a su máxima expresión, lo llamaron "el granD."; El banco, está ubicado en la provincia D. Urubamba que corresponD. al departamento del Cusco, exsactamente a 1 hora y 30 minutos D. la ciudad, este sector es denominado el valle sagrado D. los Inkas, lugar D. tierras generosas y fértiles permitiendo así la producción D. granos grandes y ricos.

Los socios integrantes D. este banquito D. 09 mujeres y 05 varones, es gente emprendedora deseosa D. que la sociedad les brinD. un mínimo apoyo para poder seguir llevando el sustento a sus hogares y seguir la tradición D. los cultivos como en la época D. los antiguos peruanos, los Inkas. Estos socios se dedican a actividades diversas, en su mayoría son agricultores, ellos producen hortalizas organicas, maíz, habas, cebada, alcachofas, papas, granos secos, entre otros productos, para lo cuál desean invertir sus préstamos en la mejora D. su materia prima que son ls granos y compra D. animales mejorados, ya que también se dedican a criar animales menores como son, pollitos, pavos, patos, cuyes, conejos D. castilla, para finalmente hacer que se procreen y venderlos; otros socios aperturarán algunos pequeños negocios, como abrir un restaurante D. comida rápida, sandwich, jugos, venta D. salchipapas.

Estos socios agradecen la ayuda recibida y se comprometen a devolver el préstamo en el plazo indicado, ellos realmente valoran el apoyo dado, por que en las zonas rurales D. Perú, no se cuenta a menudo con la facilidad D. banca financiera social.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Wayna Capac." This is the name of one of the heirs of the Inca throne, who in his governance extended the Incan empire to its maximum extent; he was called "el granD.." The bank is located in the province of Urubamba, which is part of the department of Cusco, exactly one hour and 30 minutes from the city. This sector is called the sacred valley of the Incas, a place of generous and fertile lands, thus allowing the production of large, rich grains.

The associate members of this small bank of nine women and five men are enterprising people, desiring that the association offer them minimal backing in order to be able to continue supporting their families and to continue the tradition of cultivation as in the time of the ancient Peruvians, the Incas. These associates carry out various activities, the majority of which are agricultural. They produce organic vegetables, corn, beans, barley, artichokes, potatoes and dried grains among other products. For this reason they desire to invest their loans in the improvement of their raw materials, which are the seeds, and in the purchase of better animals, as they also raise small animals such as chickens, turkeys, ducks, guinea-pigs and rabbits in order to ultimately breed and sell them. Other associates will start some small businesses, such as to open a fast food restaurant, selling sandwiches, juices and kebabs.

These associates are thankful for the help received and undertake to repay the loan by the proper date. They truly value the support given, because in the rural areas of Peru, you often can't count on the help of the financial social bank.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase raw materials, small animals and various products.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy started her business selling provisions, drinks and foodstuffs in 2000. She hopes to increase her profits as the demand for her goods is increasing. Joy has applied for a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more merchandise. She is 38 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a police officer. She would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet tiene 24 años, vive con su hijo de 5 años en casa de su madre. Trabaja de manera independiente en la venta de ropa desde hace un año, para ello  viaja cada cierto tiempo a la ciudad de Lima para comprar su mercadería y cada semana viaja a otras ciudades de clima cálido para vender sus prendas, por ello es que sus ganancias se perciben cada semana y aunque a veces los viajes constantes tiene sus riesgos por el tiempo de lluvias excesivas, para Janet es una gran satisfacción poder desarrollar una actividad que le permite crecer económicamente. Actualmente también está empezando a vender sus prendas de vestir entre sus vecinos, lo cual la anima más a seguir adelante. Es la  primera vez que está solicitando un préstamo en MFP, ella es una de las integrantes que impulsa un trabajo en equipo y siempre está presente en las reuniones de su banco comunal. Con esta cantidad podrá adquirir más mercadería, el precio aproximado es de 100 soles por docena de polos para damas, en pantalones un aproximado de 300 soles, comprará por varias docenas hasta cubrir el monto que requiere.
texts.en:
Janet is 24 years old and lives with her 5 year old son in her mother's house. She has sold clothing independently for a year. To do this she travels every so often to Lima to buy her merchandise and every week she travels to other cities with warm climates to sell the clothing. She has weekly earnings even though at times the constant travel has its risks during the excessively rainy season. Janet gets a lot of satisfaction from being able to develop her business that lets her grow economically. She is currently starting to sell her clothing to her neighbors, which has further encouraged her to keep going. This is the first time she has asked for a loan through MFP. She is one of the memebers who promotes teamwrok and she always attends the community bank's meetings. With this amount of money she will be able to acquire more merchandise, at an approximate price of 100 soles (about $30.00 USD) for a dozen ladies' polo shirts, and will use the remaining money to buy serveral dozen pairs of pants at 300 soles ($90.00 USD).

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado D. Chijichalla, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (tercero D. primaria). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06  meses, su negocio es la elaboración, compra y venta D. productos D. la zona (chuño negro, tunta cebada, quinua, etc.); su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería D. la zona para poder venderlo en las ferias D. Arequipa y Puno. 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 3 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir y mantener su mercadería (mas chuño, papa, cebada, etc.), su anhelo es convertirse en mayorista D. los productos que venD.; asimismo quiere dedicarse al engorD. D. ganado mayor (toros) y sostenerse así misma.
texts.en:
Cecilia is an associate of the "Cuidad Blanca" communal bank in the central village of Chijichalla, Ilave district, province of Del Collao, department of Puno. She is 60 years old, is married, has four children and has completed a part of her primary education (up to graD. three). She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six months. Her business is the production, purchase and sale of local products (dehydrated black potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, barley, quinoa, etc.). Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, with which she was able to purchase local goods to sell at the markets in Arequipa and Puno.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, an amount which she undertakes to pay off in three monthly instalments, she will be able to purchase and maintain her merchandise (more dehydrated potatoes, potatoes, barley, etc.). Her desire is to become a wholesaler of the products she sells; likewise she would like to fatten up larger livestock (bulls) and to support herself on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase and maintain her merchandise (more dehydrated potatoes, potatoes, barley, etc.).  Her desire is to become a wholesaler of the products she sells; likewise she would like to fatten up larger livestock (bulls) and to support herself on her own.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Agé de 19 ans, Monsieur T. Kokou est un  célibataire très dynamique et dévoué. Il  subvient aux besoins des trois (03) personnes qui sont à sa charge grâce aux revenus de son activité de photographe, reportage qu’il a entrepris depuis plus de cinq (05) ans. Aujourd’hui, sa vieille caméra ne lui permet plus de fournir un service de qualité à ses clients qui commencent par le quitter. Pour reconquérir ses clients et augmenter son bénéfice afin d’assurer  un minimum vital et de meilleurs conditions et niveau de vie à ses frères dont il a la charge, Monsieur T. se propose de s’acheter un nouveau appareil photo et caméra pour mieux servir ses clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou T., age 19, is unmarried and is a very dynamic and dedicated person. He provides for three people in his care, thanks to the income from his reporting and photographer’s business, which he embarked upon five years ago. Today, his old video camera no longer allows him to provide quality service to his customers, who are starting to walk away. To win over his customers again and to raise his profits, so as to ensure the basic survival and the best standard of living for his brothers dependent on him, he intends to buy a new camera for videos and still shots in order to serve his customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new camera

loans.name: Moh

texts.fr:
Madame Moh B. a accumulé beaucoup d’expériences dans le commerce notammant la vente de crème et d’igname. N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa coépouse. Elle mène son activité dans les differents quartiers de Bougouni.
Elle avait tenté plusieurs activités notamment la vente de chaussures et tissus et cela sans réussite. C’est ainsi qu’elle a décidé d’associer la vente de la crème et d’igname à son activité.
Avec une expérience de 2 ans elle maîtrise bien son activité.
Pour agrandir son entreprise, Moh B. décida  d’intégrer une association  de son quartier.
 Après deux prêts solidaires(prêt de groupe) elle est passée au prêt individuel  où elle est à son quatrième prêt. Tous les prêts précedents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt Moh B. envisage d’acheter par jour, 4 litres de lait frais, 2 kilogrammes de sucre, 2 kilogrammes de mil et 100FCFA de glace. Elle achète aussi 1 sac de 100 kg d’igname dans le mois.  
Elle s’approvisionne dans le grand marché de Bougouni. La vente se fait également à ce niveau et d’une façon  ambulante.
 Madame Moh B. envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000FCFA 
 Avec ce bénéfice elle compte ouvrir un restaurant..
texts.en:
Ms. Moh B. has accumulated a lot of experience in commerce, notably in selling cream and yams. Not having attended school, she learned her work from her co-wife and now operates in different areas of Bougouni. She had tried several kinds of work, notably the sale of shoes and fabrics, though unsuccessfully. This is why she decided to include the sale of cream and yams with her commerce. After two years of experience, she mastered it

To grow her enterprise, she decided to join an association in her district. After two solidarity loans (group loans), she has gone on to individual loans, where she is on her fourth one. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan, she envisions buying each day: 4 liters of fresh milk, 2 kg of sugar, 2 kg of millet, and 100 francs CFA of ice. She also buys one 100-kg sack of yams per month. All supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Bougouni. Sales are also made there and going door-to-door.

She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 55,000 francs that she plans to use to open a restaurant.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet, milk, yams, sugar, ...

loans.name: Bendicion 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
The Bendicion (Blessing) Bank of Hope has 2 groups of five entrepreneurs, with a total of 10 members. They all live in San Pedro D. Macoris, in the southwest Dominican Republic. This is their first loan with Esperanza International.

Celeste D. L. S. is the Group 1 coordinator. She has 6 children, ages 21,18,16,14,11 and 10. The younger three still live with her. She is very concerned about providing well for them and making sure they have the best education possible.

Celeste's business is a small sandwich/coffee shop. She will use her loan money to purchase more sandwich provisions (bread, ham, cheese, tomatoes), in order to serve a larger clientele. She believes this first loan will take her closer to her goal of a larger cafeteria.

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise to restock business

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine sells colourful traditional beads. Traditional beads are worn in Nigeria on special occasions like marriage, naming ceremony, etc. The demand for her traditional beads is high and Josephine needs a loan for N50,000 in order to purchase more beads to sell. Josephine is 55 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more beads to sell

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
Leopoldo inició el negocio  por la necesidad de salir adelante ya que lo liquidaron en una Agencia donde trabajaba y por su edad era muy difícil conseguir empleo así que decidió dedicarse a las ventas y empezar a trabajar por su cuenta para poder sacar adelante a mi familia. Comenzó el negocio en Abril de 2007 manejando un Taxi y no le iba mal pero su hermano vendía ropa y el veía que tenía muchos clientes y sus ganancias eran buenas, entonces platico con él y lo apoyó para que el también se dedicara a vender ropa usada. Comenzó comprando una paca para ver como le iba y la vendió muy rápido, por lo que  en corto tiempo ya tenía muchos clientes. 
Desde que inicio a la actualidad le ha ido bastante bien, tiene muchos clientes y a la vez muchos pedidos y ya esta acondicionando un local que le rentan para poder vender ahí también la ropa además de seguirla ofreciendo a domicilio como siempre lo he hecho.

El necesita un préstamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas que lo ayudará a comprar más pacas de ropa para surtir pedidos y tener una mejor surtido que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leopoldo started his business out of the need to get ahead since being let go from the agency where he used to work and because his age makes it very difficult to find a new job. For these reasons he decided to begin working alone in sales to help his family get ahead. He began a business in April of 2007 driving a taxi, and it didn't go too badly for him. Meanwhile, his brother was selling clothing and he saw that he had many customers and good earnings, so he talked about it with him and his brother helped him get started selling used clothing. He began by buying a bundle of clothing to see how things would go and sold it very quickly. In just a short amount of time he had many customers. From the time he began up until now things have gone pretty well for him. He has a lot of customers and at the same time many orders and is now working out of a rented spot to be able to sell clothing there in addition to selling it door to door as he has always done. He needs a loan of 5,000 MXN ($350 USD) that he will repay in eight installments (within 3 months) that will help him buy more bundles of clothing to meet requests and have a better selection to offer to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of clothing

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 25 años y vive  con sus dos hijos y su esposo en casa de su suegra. Mary tiene un local donde ofrece el servicio de Internet desde hace 3 años, empezó solo con 4 computadoras y hoy tiene más de 10, brinda este servicio a sus vecinos, sobre todo a los escolares que buscan los temas de sus tareas por este medio, por lo que la mejor época de ingresos es durante el año escolar. En tiempo de vacaciones suele bajar la demanda, que sin embargo no es  perjudicial ya que  de todas maneras  compensa  lo invertido. Mary tiene planes de mejorar su negocio y estar a la vanguardia de la tecnología con sus computadoras por la cual está ahorrando sus  ganancias cada vez más. Es la segunda vez que Mary solicita un préstamo en MFP, y tiene muchos deseos de continuar adelante por el bienestar de su banco comunal. La cantidad solicitada es para invertirla en el  mantenimiento y reparación de sus computadoras, además hará el cambio de otras que ya están inservibles.
texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old and lives with her two children and her husband in her mother-in-law's house. Mary has had a business offering internet access for 3 years. She began with only 4 computers and today has more than 10. She offers this service to her neighbors, mainly to the students who use the internet for their assignments. For this reason her highest earnings come during the school year. During the breaks demand is normally down, which is not too harmful since she still makes back what she has invested. Mary has plans to improve her business and has been increasing her savings to have her computers at the cutting edge of technology. This is the second time Mary has asked for a loan through MFP, and she has a strong desire to continue improving for the well-being of her communal bank. The requested money will be invested in computer maintenance and repair, and will provide for the replacement of others that are no longer able to be fixed.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer maintenance and repair

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a tailor and also sells tailoring materials from her shop. She started her business in 2006 and now hopes to expand. In order to do this, Mary has applied for a loan in the amount of N40,000 to purchase more tailoring materials. She is 36 years old and married with four children. Mary says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr:
Agé de 33 ans, Monsieur A. Daniel réside à Tékponou dans la préfecture de Vo. Marié et père de trois enfants, il est spécialisé dans l’agriculture à laquelle il associe l’élevage. Ainsi, la vente de produits agricoles et d’animaux constitue sa source de revenu. 
 
Pour améliorer la capacité de production de ses terres et augmenter la taille de son troupeau, il sollicite un crédit. 

La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra de subvenir valablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel A., age 33, resides in Tékponou, in Vo prefecture. He is married and the father of three, and he specializes in farming, to which he has added the raising of livestock. Therefore, the sale of agricultural and animal products constitutes his source of income.

To improve the production capacity of his lands and to expand his herd, he is requesting a loan. The success of this project will enable him to provide for his family in a sound manner.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise livestock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 38 years old. She is a widow with three children and is saddled with the responsibility of taking care of her children alone. Rose has been in the business of selling provisions and clothes for the past 11 years. She now requires a loan for N100,000 to purchase more merchandise to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and clothes to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señorita Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado de Chijichaya, distrito de Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos a su cargo y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercero de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06  meses, su negocio es la compra y venta de chuño negro y tunta; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir papas y transformarlo en chuño para su venta al por mayor en las ferias locales. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 3 cuotas mensuales; podrá invertir en su negocio y aumentar su capital, quiere comprar mas papas para poder procesar en chuño, así como algunos materiales necesarios (mallas, sacos, etc.), de esta manera piensa llevar a los mercados de Arequipa  y Tacna. Con las ganancias ella quiere comprarse un carro para poder trasportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Community Bank "Ciudad Blanca" in the town of Chijichaya, of the district of Ilave in the province of Del Collao in Puno. She is 19 years old, she is single and she has no children in her care. She has a grade 9 education.

She is involved with the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) organization for the past 6 months. Her business is the buying and selling of dried and frozen potatoes. Her first loan was for S/ 500 nuevos soles, with which she was able to purchase potatoes to prepare for wholesale in the local fairs.

With this loan of S/1000 nuevos soles, sum of which she promises to repay in 3 monthly payments, she will be able to invest in her business and increase her capital. She wants to purchase more potatoes to prepare and few other needed items (fabrics and bags, etc.). Thsi way she hopes to bring her products to the markets in Arequipa and Tacna. With the earnings she wants to purchase a car to be able to transport her products.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes to make her products.

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Mme Kadidia Dembélé est âgée de 28 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille  polygame  avec son mari et leurs  enfants dans le quartier Sogomougou  de la ville  de Koutiala. Kadidia n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école. Très tôt elle  commenca les activités génératrices de revenu notamment l’achat et la vente des condiments alimentaires  il y a 11 ans.  Cette activité lui procure de revenus car elle domine le milieu. 
Pour renforcer sa capacité de vente, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 4 ans.  Après  6 prêts dans le groupe ( prêt solidaire ) tous  remboursés sans difficultés ,  elle est à son 4 ème prêt  individuel dont les 3 précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle compte acheter différentes sortes de condiments alimentaires avec ce prêt, telque les poivres, sels de cuisine, soumbala et autres. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des producteurs et effectue sa vente au comptant à crédit et en détail, au grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle compte sur un revenu mensuel de 90.000FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser  pour  le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et participer aux dépenses familiales. 
Elle ambitionne être grossiste de condiments alimentaires au grand marché de Koutiala.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadidia Dembélé is 28 years old and the mother of four living in a polygamous family with her husband and children in the Sogomougou district of the city of Koutiala. She didn't have the chance to attend school. Very early on, she started earning an income eleven years ago, notably by buying and selling condiments. This work brings in revenues because she dominates the area.

To boost her selling capacity, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After six loans in the group (solidarity loans), all repaid without a problem, she is on her fourth individual loan. The preceding three were correctly repaid.

She plans to buy different sort of condiments with this loan, such as pepper, salt, soumbala (made from pounded and fermented seeds), and more. Supplies are gotten from producers, and sales are made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, to customers compose essentially of women.

She is counting on a monthly income of 90,000 francs CFA that she envisions using to pay the loan interest and to cover family expenses. Her ambition is to be a wholesaler of condiments at the grand marketplace of Koutiala.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some condiments for cooking

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 32 years old and married with five children. She produces and sells cellophane bags. Now she needs a loan for N70,000 in order to purchase more materials to use in making these bags. Tina is a LAPO client. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for making cellophane bags

loans.name: Zlotescu's Group

texts.en:
Zlotescu P. is the coordinator for this group in the village of Cimislia district. The group members all live in the same village.

This group hopes to utilize this loan to further their existing business ventures or create new operations in order to increase their profit levels. They want to buy 15 hectares of land in their native village and they will also need fuel for the tractor that will help them plow the land. Sales will be in the region. P. hopes that his relatives will support him to provide them with the possibility of starting their own businesses.

On behalf of P. and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support.

loans.use: Buy land and tractor fuel

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado de Chijichaya, distrito de Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Ella es socia nueva del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la transformación de la papa en tunta; para lo cual requiere un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 3 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir materia prima (papas) para trasformarlo en tunta y venderlo en las ferias de Puno y Arequipa. 
Ella agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the community bank "Ciudad Blanca" in Chijichaya, district of Ilave, in the province of Del Collao, department of Puno. She is 30 years old, married, and has one son. She completed elementary school. She is a new member of Movimiento Manuela Ramos; she dehydrates potatoes. She needs a loan of 500 soles which she will repay in three months. She will use the loan to buy raw materials - potatoes - and transform them into "tunta" [dehydrated potato] and sell them at the markets of Puno and Arequipa. She thanks Movimiento Manuela Ramos for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes to dehydrate and then sell at market

loans.name: Tétévi

texts.fr:
Né en 1972 à Kpémé Mr  A. Tétévi est marié et père de 04 enfants. La pêche sur mer est son activité principale, activité qu’il exerce depuis 08 ans et qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 

Depuis un certain temps la vétusté  de son matériel de travail ne fait que ralentir son activité  mettant ainsi sa famille en difficulté. Il sollicite un crédit pour l’achat de nouveaux filets de pêche. Il pourra ainsi redémarrer son activité et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Kpémé, Mr. Tétévi A. is married and the father of four. Ocean fishing is his main work, which he has been doing for eight years. It enables him to provide for his family.

For some time now, the worn condition of his equipment does nothing but slow down his work, thus putting his family into difficulty. He is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets. He will then be able to restart his business and to take care of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Martha C. quiere construir un cuarto en su casa ya que nos comenta que solo son dos cuartos (cocina y una recamara). En su vivienda vive ella, su esposo y un hijo lo cual quiere darle privacidad tanto como ella como el. 
También quiere aprovechar ese espacio que tiene de patio para tener su vivienda confortable y amplia.
Para empezar su proyecto  Martha necesita comprar material de construcción como pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta C. would like to add a room to her house. The house has only 2 rooms, a kitchen and a bedroom, and she lives in it with her husband and son. She is hoping the addition, would give all of them some privacy. She wants to use the space, behind her house, to build the room and to make the house more spacious and comfortable. To start this project, Marta needs to buy the building materials and pay for the labor.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials and pay for labor

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 39 years old and married with four children. She started her business making phone calls for people and selling rechargeable phone cards in 2008. Esther has applied for a loan in the amount of N80,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She hopes that this additional stock will help her expand her business. She is an LAPO client. Esther says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 36 years old and married with three children. She has a store where she sells medicine. Beatrice has applied for a loan in the amount of N100,000 which would enable her to purchase more medicines for her shop. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Dios Verdadero 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Groups 3 and 4 of the Dios Verdadero (True God) Bank of Hope are on their second loan cycle. Ramon M. is the Group 3 Coordinator. He has 5 children ages 15, 18, 12, 8 and 4. Ramon owns a colmado, which is a small store where you can buy your daily food and other supplies. Ramon will purchase different products to sell in his colmado with this second loan. He thinks it's important to keep your business well stocked, so that you can meet your customers' demands and keep them happy. His biggest challenge is to work everyday to make a living, so he hopes to make good profits in his business so he can expand its current space.

Some of the other group members have the same type of store; others have smaller vegetable stands or sell a wide variety of products. In this picture, the group members are gathered at one of their homes. On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to restock business

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
La señorita Simona  es socia del banco comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado D. Chijichaya, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D.  56 años D. edad, es casada,  tiene cuatro  hijos y no posee estudios.
Ella es socia nueva con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos tiene un negocio D. compra y venta D. tunta, con este préstamo D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo pagará en 3 cuotas mensuales; le servirá para poder incrementar su mercadería y convertirse en distribuidora mayorista D. este producto. 
 Ella agradece D. sobremanera a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Ms. Simona is a member of the “Ciudad Blanca” community bank in the town of Chijichaya, Ilave District of the Collao Province in the Puno Region. She is 56 years old and married with 4 children. She has no education.

She is a new member of the Manuela Ramos Movement. She has a business buying and selling a dried potato called “tunta”. She will payback the loan of 500.00 nuevos soles in 3 monthly installments. It will enable her to increase her stock and become a wholesale distributor of this product.

She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for her support of women.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more stock and become a wholesale distributor of this product.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a photographer. He also sells rechargeable phone cards to his customers. He now needs a loan for N50,000 in order to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and film. He is 24 years old and single. With the profits he makes from his business, Timothy hopes to further his education. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and film

loans.name: Mencia

texts.es: Mencia tiene 36 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en una casa arrendada. Se dedica a vender comida al paso, un platillo típico de su tierra llamado “anticuchos” que son brochetas de pedazos de corazón de res y papa a la parrilla, y los vende en la puerta de su casa todos los días desde hace 2 años incluyendo los fines de semana. Su horario de trabajo es en horas de la tarde y la noche, para Mencia fue una buena opción de desarrollo que la ayudó en tiempos de necesidad económica y que actualmente la ayuda a sostener a sus hijos. Lo bueno es que siempre termina de vender todas sus porciones, que son alrededor de 50  anticuchos y por esa razón va a  adquirir nuevos implementos que la ayudarán a vender con mayor frecuencia y cantidad sus platillos. Es la primera vez que Mencia tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es nueva integrante de su banco comunal y tuvo esa voluntad de integrarse porque simpatiza con la dinámica de trabajo. El dinero que está solicitando es para invertir en la compra de una parrilla más moderna y nueva.
texts.en:
Mencia is 36 years old. She lives with her 4 children in a rented house. She sells a typical dish called “anticuchos” which is a grilled brocheta of potato and beef heart to people passing by. She has been selling them in the afternoons and evenings, 7 days a week, in front of her house for the last two years. This has been a good option that helped her in difficult times and still helps her to support her children. She is fortunate to sell the 50 “anticuchos” she prepares every day. Mencia would like to purchase new equipment, which would allow her to increase her hours of work and the number of dishes to sell. This is the first time for Mencia to request a loan from MFP. She is a new member of her community bank and wanted to join because she agrees with the work dynamics. The money, she is requesting, is to buy a new and more efficient grill.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new grill

loans.name: Loyda

texts.es: Loyda tiene 46 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en una casa arrendada. Ella tiene un puesto de comida en una zona turística y campestre de su localidad, vende los platos típicos de su tierra a los turistas y visitantes que acuden en busca de la gastronomía típica, es por ello que Loyda ha logrado  tener ventas exitosas que la coronan como una de las mejores cocineras de su región. Este negocio lo realiza los fines de semana, los demás días se dedica en organizar lo que cocinará y comprará para preparar sus comidas y cuando llega el día sábado se va muy temprano con todo lo preparado para  su puesto de ventas. Con esta forma de trabajo Loyda ha obtenido ingresos para su hogar desde hace más de 2 años, y tiene deseos de seguir trabajando, ya que para ella cocinar es una gran recompensa. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a ser parte de su banco comunal al ser conocida por los integrantes que notaron la responsabilidad y compromiso con el que trabaja. El dinero que solicita es para invertir en la compra de cuyes, base de la preparación de uno de los platos más famoso de su zona, con ello podrá cubrir un pedido que le hicieron para un evento social grande.
texts.en:
Loyda is 46 years old and lives with her three children in a rented house. She has a food stand in a touristic, rural town in her area. She sells regional dishes to tourist and visitors looking for local cuisine. She has had good fortune with her sells and has been recognized as one of the best cooks of the area. She works on weekends; during the week she organizes her shopping and makes the preparations for the weekend sells. On Saturdays, she leaves the house very early taking the food with her to the stand. This kind of work is rewarding for her and has provided an income for the last two years, so she would like to continue. This is the first time Loyda requests a loan from MFP. She was invited by her community bank to join, because they see her as a very responsible person with a lot of commitment towards her work. The loan, would allowed her to buy guinea pig meat, the staple ingredient for one of the most popular dishes of the area, for a large social event order entrusted to her.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pig meat to prepare her dishes

loans.name: Kanlévi

texts.fr: D. Kanlévi est une veuve avec quatre enfants qu’elle élève seule. C’est une femme très dynamique qui s’est lancée très tôt dans le commerce de céréales depuis son jeune âge pour survivre car n’ayant pas de qualification professionnelle. Jouant le rôle de père et mère à la fois, elle n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Souffrant du manque de moyens financiers pour élever son activité à un niveau qui lui permettrait de subvenir aux besoins d’éducation de ses enfants, elle sollicite ce crédit pour multiplier son chiffre d’affaires et faire plus de bénéfice qui lui permettra de rembourser son crédit et améliorer la situation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kanlévi D. is a widow with four children she is raising by herself. She is a very energetic woman who, at a very young age and due to having no professional qualifications, got started in the commerce of grain in order to survive. In the simultaneous role of both father and mother, she isn’t able to provide for her children. Suffering from a lack of financial means for enhancing her business to a level that would allow her children an education, she is requesting this loan. She could then increase her sales figures and make more profit. This will enable her to repay her loan and to improve her children’s situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and sell grain

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señorita Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, centro poblado de 02 de mayo, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 24 años de edad, no tiene hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, ella dedica su negocio a la venta de frutas y ropa (chompas, mandiles, blusas, etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (frutas). 

Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales; con el préstamo podrá adquirir mercadería variada, de preferencia ropa (chompas según la época) y fruta (uvas, sandia, etc.), todo ello lo comercializará en las ferias locales de Ilave, su anhelo es tener también una tienda propia con mercadería surtida (ropa frutas, artefactos, etc.), con lo cual podría ayudar a su familia (a sus padres) y ayudarse asimismo en sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the Communal Bank "03 de Mayo," in the El Collao province of Puno. She is 24 years old, has no children, and has completed her secondary level education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos (a Kiva partner) for a year, and her business sells fruit and clothes (sweaters, aprons, blouses, etc.). Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian Soles, with which she purchased merchandise for her business (fruit).

With this loan of 800 Peruvian Soles, which she promises to pay back in 5 monthly installments, she will acquire a variety of merchandise, preferably clothing items (seasonal sweaters) and fruit (grapes, watermelon, etc.), all of which she will sell in the local fairs in Ilave. Her wish is to have her own store with stocked merchandise (clothes, fruits, artifacts, etc.), with which she can support her family (her parents) and help herself in her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as clothing and fruit

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su propia casa.
