She started her business in January 2007 by her own initiative and since she had some money saved, she decided to invest in a small store, setting it up in the front part of their house. She lives in a street corner and there is no other store nearby. Since she started out she has been expanding the business slowly and all the neighbours in the area know of her and she counts on a good number of clients. She is thinking about starting to sell fresh fruit and vegetables.

She requires a loan in the amount of $3000 MXN, which will be repaid in 6 biweekly payments, permitting her to purchase more grocery items to better stock her store and provide better service to her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Ángeles inició el negocio desde joven, aprendió el oficio gracias a su abuela, y lo practicaba solamente con la familia y amigos cercanos, posteriormente una amiga que tenia un salón de belleza, la invito a ofrecer los masajes en su negocio. Comenzó el negocio en Julio del 2002 cuando su amiga le prestó el dinero para iniciar el negocio, el cual lo liquidó en un año, ya que al principio tenía poca clientela, principalmente eran sus familiares y no les cobraba como debía de ser.
Actualmente ya cuenta con dos mesas para aplicar los masajes, un pequeño stand donde tiene sus cremas, vendas, y demás utensilios que necesita, ya que ella misma elabora las cremas; además esta realizando una ampliación en su casa para tener independiente su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir más materia prima para la producción de las cremas y aceites, ya que en estas fechas, (inicio de año), aumenta un poco la clientela, que regularmente es por recomendación, y poner un anuncio en la fachada de su negocio para mayor proyección.
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles started her work when she was young. She learned from her grandmother and she only worked for family and close friends. Later, a friend who owned a beauty salon invited her to offer massages from her business. She started her business in July 2002 when her friend lent her money to open her business, which she repaid in a year as at first she had few clients, most of her customers were friends and she was not charging them enough. Currently she has two massage tables and a small stand for her creams, cloth strips and other tools which she needs. She prepares the creams herself and is also enlarging her house to have a separate area for the business. She needs a MXN $4,000 loan which she will repay in six months in order to acquire the raw materials for preparing the creams and oils as these days, at the start of the year, she gets more customers. Most of her customers learn about her through word of mouth; she will use part of the loan to advertise in the storefront to attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for creams and oils

loans.name: Las Flores 5 And 6 Group

texts.en:
Sonia Maria F. and Luisa Marte are group coordinators for the Las Flores Bank of Hope in Los Alcarrizos. Sonia has 7 children living in her home, and Luisa has 3 children in her home. El Progreso bank members have been participating in the Esperanza loan program for up to a year. Sonia will be using her loan to buy food products and inventory for her fried food stand and her variety store. For her variety store, Sonia will be specifically investing in buying bedding products.

Luisa's micro business is clothing sales. She purchases her wares in Santo Domingo, and brings them back to her community. Previous to taking out microloans, these women could not run their own sustainable businesses. Sonia was employed as a domestic worker, and Lusia in a factory. Neither women saw much of a future in either of those employment activities, and agree that working for themselves shows much more promise and more profit.

In the future, Sonia mentions that she would like to grow her business and upgraD. her home with cement block installation. Lusia would like to make similar improvements to her home, and perhaps expand her business venture into a cafeteria.

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise for resale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señorita Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado de Chijichaya, distrito de Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos a su cargo y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (primero de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06  meses, su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado (engorde) y artesanías (tejido a punto); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir materiales para sus tejidos 
Con este préstamo de S/ 900.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 3 cuotas mensuales; podrá aumentar su capital y comprarse mas toros para engorde y luego venderlos en las ferias de Ilave y Pilcuyo, su anhelo es ser mayorista en tejidos artesanales (compra y venta) en los diferentes lugares turísticos de la región y del País, para lo cual viene ahorrando sus ganancias y ayudar a su familia con buena calidad de vida para toda su familia. 
Ella esta agradecida a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Miss Elsa is a member of the “Ciudad Blanca” Communal Bank in the township of Chijichaya, Ilave District, Province of Collao, Department of Puno. She is 28 years old and single. She does not have children and holds an incomplete degree in secondary education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 6 months. Her business is the purchase and sale of fattened livestock and handicrafts such as knitting. Her first loan was for 500 soles, with which she purchased materials for knitting.

With this loan of 900 soles, which she is committed to paying back in 3 payments, she will be able to increase her capital and buy more livestock, fatten them and sell them at the Ilave and Pilcuyo fairs.

Miss Elsa’s greatest wish is to become a wholesaler in knitted handicrafts in the different tourists areas of the region and of the country. For this she continues to save her earnings and helps her entire family to sustain a good quality of life. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the help.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her capital of livestock

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 53 años de edad, es casado hace más de 10 años, tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales con 5 de ellos viven en su casa. Tras el fallecimiento de su padre Daniel heredó sus chacras donde en todo este tiempo ha venido sembrando plátanos y café, pero en los últimos años las hojas de sus plantas se están tornando de color amarillo, debido a ello su producción baja y sus cosechas no son buenas, en consecuencia tampoco le pagan un precio considerable, por ello la preocupación de Daniel que está buscando insecticidas o funguicidas que contrarresten este mal en sus plantas. Mientras tanto él y su esposa trabajan desde las 6.00am, él en la chacra y su esposa prepara el desayuno y el almuerzo, y a eso de la 8.00am regresa a su casa para desayunar, mientras que su esposa prepara con prisa las viandas a cargar; después ambos retornan a sus chacras para proseguir con los trabajos agrícolas. Daniel dice estar muy contento con su trabajo, solo le preocupa las hojas amarillas de sus plantas que están mermando su producción; ahora su esperanza es la  cosecha de café con la que espera ganar bien para comprar fertilizantes y demás remedios. Daniel es una persona callada y no participa de todas las actividades de su banco comunal, pero  realiza sus pagos puntualmente. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP con quien está muy agradecido porque le permitirle trabajar. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de funguicidas para combatir las hojas amarillas de sus plantas de plátanos y si le alcanza también comprará fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 53-year-old man who has been married for over 10 years and has 8 children—5 of whom live at home with him. After the passing of his father, Daniel inherited his farms in which he has been planting bananas and coffee beans. However, over the past few years, his plants have been turning yellow. Because of that, production has decreased and his crops are not good quality. As a consequence, he does not earn good profits either. Daniel is concerned with finding pesticides and fungicide that will thwart this problem with his plants. Meanwhile, he and his wife work since 6:00 am, he in the farm and his wife prepares breakfast and lunch. At 8:00 am, he returns home to have breakfast, while his wife quickly prepares his lunch box. Afterwards, they both return to the farms to continue with their agricultural duties. Daniel says that he is very happy with his job, but he is worried about the yellow leaves that are affecting his plants and reducing production. He now sets his sights on his coffee bean harvest, which he hopes will bring in good profits so that he can purchase fertilizer and other treatments. Daniel is a quiet person who does not participate in all the microfinance institute’s activities; however, he makes his payments on time. This is his fifth loan with MFP, with which he is very grateful because the loans allow him to work. The money that he is requesting will be used to purchase fungicide so that he can combat the yellow leaves in his banana plants and, if he has enough money, he will also purchase fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fungicide and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado D. Chijichaya, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 54 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (segundo D. primaria). 
Ella es socia nueva con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos tiene un negocio D. compra y venta D. chuño y tunta, con este D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo pagará en 03 cuotas mensuales; podrá incrementar su mercadería y convertirse en distribuidora mayorista D. este producto. Sus ganancias las piensa invertir en incrementar su capital y ayudar en la educación D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Basilia is an associate of Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” (White City) of the village Chijichaya, in the key district Provincia Del Collao, in the State of Puno. She is 54 years old, married, has 4 children, and is educated until her second year of primary school. She is a new associate with the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos.” She has a business in which she buys and sells chuño y tunta, which is a freeze dried potato dish culturally associated with the Quechua. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will pay in 3 monthly quotas, she will be able to increase the amount of merchandise she can offer, and convert to being a major distributor of this product. She thinks she will invest her earnings in increasing her capital stock and supporting the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of merchandise she may offer, and become a leading distributor of her product.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja por más de 14 años, con la que tiene dos hijos, actualmente viven en su casa propia. Por más de 24 años realiza trabajos de costura, labor que la llena de mucha satisfacción, hay épocas donde le es muy rentable y tiene mucho trabajo, pero para cubrir los momentos donde está libre decidió poner un negocio de venta de golosinas y gaseosas. Elva es experta en remendar y coser las prendas al gusto del cliente, asimismo disfruta mucho al conversar y atender a los clientes de su tienda. En el lapso de estos dos años siente que su economía está mejorando mucho, ahora quiere que su tienda de golosinas esté mejor surtida porque en este negocio se obtiene mejores ganancias y la inversión es menor. Por ejemplo, tiene la ventaja de que por cada 6 paquetes de galletas gana 1, por lo tanto los vende a precio muy cómodo, para vender más rápidos, de esa manera acumula y gira su dinero en poco tiempo, obteniendo más ganancias. Elva es una socia muy activa en su banco comunal, el ciclo antepasado tenia el cargo de secretaria, y se encargaba de redactar todos los acuerdos que se tenían en cada reunión. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita esta vez es para incrementar la mercadería de su tienda de golosinas en su afán de tenerla bien surtida. Es necesario recalcar la gratitud de Elva para MFP y con todos aquellos que hacen posible este crédito.
texts.en:
Elva is 39 years old and has lived with her significant other for 14 years. They have two children together and currently live in their own home. She has been a seamstress for over 24 years, and it gives her a lot of satisfaction. There are times when it is very profitable, and she has lots of work, but to fill in for those times that are free, she decided to open a business selling soft drinks and sweets. Elva is an expert at mending and sewing clothing to meet her customers' needs, and she also enjoys talking with and tending to her customers. She feels that her economic situation has improved quite a bit in these last two years, and now she wants to turn the business into a store that is well-stocked in sweets. Selling sweets has a low investment and the advantage of every 6 cookies earning 1 free cookie. She sells them at a good price so they sell faster. From those sales she earns more money and has a higher profit. Elva is a very active member of her communal bank. In the season before last she was the secretary and was in charge of drawing up the agreements at each meeting. This is her 5th loan with MFP, and in all of these loans she has been responsible with her payments. She is requesting money to expand her candy store according to her wish to have it better stocked to attract more customers. Elva is very thankful for MFP and all of those who make this loan possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her merchandise

loans.name: Lauro

texts.es: Lauro tiene 38 años de edad, está separado desde hace dos años, vive solo en una casa alquilada, mientras que sus 3 hijos viven con su ex esposa. El labrado de la tierra y el cuidado de la plantas es parte de su vida, desde su niñez ha realizado estos trabajos, pero el año pasado no logró sembrar como anhelaba debido a la alza de los abonos que llegaron a costar 215 soles por saco de lo que costaba 60 soles, debido a este obstáculo el dinero que tenía para esa inversión no le alcanzó; desde entonces se siente un poco mortificado. Pero ahora que ha bajado los precios de los fertilizantes a 95 soles nuevamente la alegría toca a su corazón y sus anhelos regresaron, se está proyectando para sembrar dos hectáreas de plántanos. Sus problemas conyugales a un inicio le habían afectado mucho y en ocasiones no realizaba sus trabajo como era bebido, pero ahora ya se siente más motivado, y con el tiempo espera convertirse en un gran agricultor. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha colaborado en todas las actividades que realiza su banco comunal, y más aun en sus compromisos de pagos siempre cumplió de acuerdo a sus cronogramas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de plantitas de plátanos, ya que sembrará 2 hectáreas y para ello necesita dos mil plantas.
texts.en:
Lauro is 38 years old and has been separated for two years. He lives alone in a rental house. His three children live with his ex-wife. Working the soil and caring for plants is part of his life. Since his childhood he has carried out these jobs, but last year he wasn't able to do the planting he wanted because of an increase in fertilizer prices. The price rose to 215 soles per sack where it had been 60 soles. Because of this difficulty, the money he had for that investment was not enough to cover the cost. Since then he has felt a little distressed. But now that the fertilizer prices are at 95 soles he his happy again, and his desire to farm has returned. He plans to plant two hectares of bananas. His marital problems affected him a lot in the beginning, and he occasionally missed work because of his drinking, but now he is feeling more motivated. In time, he hopes to become a great farmer. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he has always collaborated in all of the activities that his communal bank offered. He has always been responsible about making his payments on time. He is requesting money to buy banana seedlings. Since he is planting two hectares, he will need two thousand plants.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase banana plants

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La señora Dina es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 05 meses, ella tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, gaseosas, golosinas, etc.; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual adquirió mas mercadería para su negocio. 
Ella desea mejorar su negocio. Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles, monto que pagará en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá incrementar su capital y adquirir mas mercaderías (bebidas, abarrotes y golosinas  todo lo que requieran sus clientes), de esta manera obtendrá mejores ingresos y lo invertirá en la educación de su hijos, así como en su alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo” in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 27 years old, lives with her domestic partner, has one son, and has finished high school. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five months. She has a store where she sells groceries, sodas, candy, etc. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to purchase more merchandise for her business. She wants to improve her business. With this 800-soles loan, which she will pay in five monthly installments, she will be able to increase her capital and acquire more merchandise (drinks, groceries, and candy, everything her customers need), and in that way increase her income, which she will use for her son's education, as well as for keeping him well-fed and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her capital and acquire more merchandise (drinks, groceries, candy)

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila tiene 44 años de edad, es casada hace 23 años con el padre de su tres hijos, viven en su casa propia. Desde que se casó, junto a su esposo ha sembrado, plátanos, paltas y café. El año pasado se propusieron incrementar sus cultivos de café en aras de buscar mejores ingresos económicos,  pero no tuvieron buenos resultados debido al alza desmesurada de los fertilizantes, solo logró comprar lo suficiente para el abonado de sus plantas frutales. Este año han bajado los precios, por lo que su meta es sembrar nuevas chacras de café, porque el mercado del café en ciertas épocas es muy rentable, mientras que con sus chacras frutales obtiene ingresos para el sostenimiento de la familia y casi siempre mantienen el mismo precio. A pesar de los buenos y malos momentos Lucila se siente muy contenta con sus sembríos y sigue con la mirada en un futuro mejor. Pese a 9 Km. de distancia desde su pueblo hasta donde realizan las reuniones su banco comunal es muy puntual, en este nuevo ciclo acaba de juramentar como presidenta, donde se compromete a responder con responsabilidad en la confianza depositada. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita es para realizar una limpieza de sus campos de cultivo, asimismo comprará plantas de café y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Lucila is 44 years old and has been married to the father of her three children for 23 years. They live in their own home. She has grown bananas, avocados, and coffee with her husband since they were married. Last year they decided to increase the size of the coffee farm in the hopes of increasing their income, but they did not have good results because of the excessive rise in fertilizer prices. She was only able to buy enough to fertilize their fruit trees. This year the prices have come down, so her goal is to plant new coffee fields because the coffee market is very profitable at certain times. Her fruit trees bring in the income that sustains the family, and they almost always earn the same price. Despite the good and bad moments, Lucila is very pleased with her farm and she continues to look toward the future. Even though it is 9 km from her village to where the communal bank holds its meetings, she is very punctual. For this new season she has been sworn in as the president, and she is committed to fulfilling the role responsibly because of the confidence shown in her. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is requesting money to clean up her fields and to buy coffee plants and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el centro poblado Nueva Generación, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de secundaría completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 05 años, se dedica al engorde de animales menores (corderos; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mas ganado (ovejas de raza para engorde). 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mas ganado menor (ovejas cara negra para carne) y dedicarse también al engorde de ganado vacuno; en el futuro a ella le gustaría tener una tienda de abarrotes, por ello viene juntando sus ganancias y formando un capital extra, con todo ello, desea asegurar una fuente de ingresos permanente para su hijo y contribuir en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the "03 de Mayo" Communal Bank in Nueva Generación, Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 22 years old, in a common law marriage, has one child, and has completed her secondary education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years. She fattens small animals like lambs. With her first loan of 300 soles, she was able to acquire more livestock (breeding sheep for fattening). With this loan of 1500 soles, which she promises to repay in five monthly payments, she will be able to acquire more small livestock (black-face sheep for meat) and will also work to fatten cattle. In the future, she would like to have a grocery store so she can pull together her earnings and form extra capital. With all this, she hopes to secure a permanent source of income for her son and contribute to his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more small livestock and begin fattening cattle

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria B. is married and she has one son. For her business she rents space in the commercial space at local market number four. Mrs. B. rents units and then sublets them to other vendors who lack an appropriate place to store and protect their goods. Mrs. B. also sublets the restrooms in each of the units. Finally, she supplements her business by selling ice.

Mrs. B. began to work in this business some years ago when her father could no longer attend to it. Soon after, her father passed away, and Mrs. B. took over and continued with the business.

The purpose of the loan is to repair the roof of the business, as it is an old building and in need of maintenance. Currently even a little rain causes water to run onto the merchandise of Mrs. B.’s clients.

loans.use: Repairing the roof of the business

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino tiene 58 años, está casado hace 39 años, es padre de 6 hijos y actualmente viven en su casa propia. Se dedica a la siembra de plantas frutales, después de cada cosecha su esposa comercializa sus productos en los mercados más cercanos de su zona cada fin de semana. Cuando no se ocupa de sus cultivos realiza labores de carpintero en un pequeño espacio de su casa que se ha convertido en su taller de trabajo, Marcelino se siente muy feliz y complacido de realizar todo tipo de muebles, según el pedido de sus clientes, para ello es indispensable las herramientas que utilice, porque ellas le ahorran tiempo y esfuerzo. Desde hace 17 años que realiza este oficio y con toda la experiencia ganada ahora le pone mucha creatividad en el acabado de sus diferentes piezas, por lo que sus clientes se van muy satisfechos. Marcelino acaba de delegar su cargo de presidente en su banco comunal a otro miembro, en todo este tiempo demostró eficiencia y responsabilidad en su labor. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP pagando con puntualidad sus cuotas. Con una parte del dinero que solicita comprará de una máquina lijadora, y con el resto, fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Marcelino le tiene mucho aprecio a MFP, porque le ha posibilitado seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 58 years old, has been married for 39 years, and is the father of six children. At present the family lives in their own house. He cultivates fruit-bearing plants, and after each harvest his wife sells the produce at the nearby markets in their neighborhood each weekend. When he is not working on the cultivation, he works as a carpenter from a small space in their house that has been set up as his workshop. Marcelino is happy and pleased to build many types of custom-ordered furniture. The tools he uses in his work are indispensable because they save him time and effort. He has been involved in this business for the last 17 years and because of his experience, he is able to creatively finish the different pieces he makes, to the great satisfaction of his customers. Marcelino has recently delegated the role of president of the communal bank to another member. During his tenure he worked with efficiency and responsibility. This is the 5th loan with MFP and he has always made payments punctually. With some of the funds requested, he will buy a sander; with the remaining funds, fertilizer for the plants he cultivates. Marcelino is grateful to MFP because it has made it possible for him to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sander and fertilizer for plants.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señorita Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, no tiene hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, ella se dedica al engorde ganado menor; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual adquirió ganado para poder engordarlo y venderlo como carne en las ferias de Ilave. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir ganado menor (ovejas y porcinos); con la finalidad seguir realizando la actividad de engorde, ya que le brinda buenas ganancias, su anhelo es implementar una tienda de abarrotes y en el futuro poner una ferretería que le brindaría mas ingresos aún.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the "03 de Mayo" Communal Bank in Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 20 years old, in a common law marriage, has no children and has completed her secondary education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year, fattening small livestock. With her first loan of 500 soles, she acquired livestock to fatten and sell for meat at fairs in Llave. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she promises to pay back in five monthly payments, she will be able to acquire small livestock (sheep and pigs). She will continue fattening these animals because it brings in good earnings, and then she wishes to establish a grocery store and in the future a hardware store that with bring her still more income.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small livestock (sheep and pigs)

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el Jr. Mollendo, Urb. Carmen; distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 06 hijos y posee estudios de primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01año; se dedica al engorde de ganado menor y la venta de bebidas (gaseosas); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual incremento adquirirlo mas bebidas (gaseosas)
Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; con ello piensa comprar ganado menor para engorde (ovejas de raza para carne), de esta manera obtendrá ingresos mayores por la venta de carne en las ferias y mercados locales, con lo cual podrá ayudar a sus hijos en sus educación básica y superior.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "03 de Mayo" Communal Bank in Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, has 6 children and a fifth-grade education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year, fattening small livestock and selling soft drinks. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to increase her beverage stock. With this loan of 1500 soles, which she promises to repay in five monthly payments, she will buy more small livestock to fatten (breeding sheep for meat). By selling meat at local fairs and markets, she will obtain a better income, with which she will support her children in their elementary and higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small livestock to fatten (breeding sheep for meat)

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el Jr. Amazonas, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada,  tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios de primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años; se dedica al engorde de ganado menor y a la artesanía de bayeta; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir ganado menor para engórdalo y venderlo como carne en las fiestas de la candelaria. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir ganado (toros para engorde) y materiales para hacer sus tejidos en bayeta (tela bayeta, hilo, etc.), ello a fin de continuar generado ganancias lo que le permitirá ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios; asimismo ella desea construir sus casa  puesto que ya cuenta con un terreno que pudo adquirir con sus ganancias anteriormente.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the "03 de Mayo" Communal Bank in Jr. Amazonas, Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 39 years old, married, has five children and a fifth-grade education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years, fattening small livestock and making cloth handicrafts. With her first loan of 300 soles, she was able to buy small livestock for fattening and sell the meat at Candlemas festivities. With this loan of 2000 soles, which she promises to repay in five monthly payments, she will be able to purchase livestock (bulls for fattening) and materials for weaving (fabric, thread, etc.). The money she generates will allow her to support her children in their studies. She also wishes to build a house, as she was able to buy land with her previous earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock (bulls for fattening) and materials for weaving (fabric, thread, etc.)

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal “03 D. Mayo”, del centro poblado Santa Bárbara, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 53 años D. edad, es madre soltera con 03 hijos a su cargo y posee estudios D. primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa; su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mas mercadería (ropa) para venderlo en las ferias locales D. Ilave. 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mas mercadería (ropa al por mayor) para continuar ampliando su negocio y llevar a las ferias D. Puno y Juliaca; su anhelo es tener una tienda D. abarrotes donD. pueda estar mas tranquila, sus ganancias las ha ido invirtiendo en la educación y alimentación D. sus hijos. 
Ella agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado y se siente comprometida con su grupo.
texts.en:
Josefa is a member of the "03 D. Mayo" Communal Bank in the town of Santa Bárbara, in the district of Llave, in the province of El Collao, in the Puno area. She is 53 years old and a single mother in charge of 3 children and she completed her elementary school studies. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years. She buys and sells clothes. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to acquire more merchandise (clothing) to sell at important local fairs. With this loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she agrees to commit to paying in 5 monthly payments. She will be able to acquire more merchandise (mostly clothes) in order to continue growing her business and take her goods to the fairs in Puno and Juliaca. Her wish is to have a grocery store where she work at a less hectic pace. She has invested her earnings in education and food for her children. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support given and she feels committed to her group.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (mostly clothes) in order to continue growing her business and take her goods to the Puno and Juliaca fairs; her wish is to have a grocery store where she can take it easier; she has invested her earnings in education and food for her children.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brígida es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, de Crusani, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 45 años de edad, es madre viuda con 04 hijos y posee estudios de tercero de secundaría (incompleta). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 años, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas y pan por las tardes; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (golosinas variadas). 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales; podrá mejorar su negocio y adquirir mercadería surtida al por mayor y de esta manera surtir aun mas su negocio.  Su anhelo es ver a sus hijos profesionales, por ello viene ahorrando sus dinero, con ello garantizará el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Brígida is a member of the "03 de Mayo" Communal Bank, from Crusani, the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao in the Puno area. She is a 45-year-old widow with 4 children and completed three years of high school. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years. She sells sweets, soft drinks and bread in the afternoons. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, with which she acquired merchandise for her business (assorted sweets). With this loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she agrees to commit to paying in 5 monthly payments. She will be able to improve her business and acquire assorted merchandise wholesale and in this way diversify her business even more. Her wish is to see her children become professionals, and for that she is saving her money and will guarantee her children's future.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her business and acquire assorted merchandise wholesale and in this way diversify her business even more. Her wish is to see her children become professionals, and for that she is saving her money and will guarantee her children's future.

loans.name: Teresa Inés

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de stado civil conviviente, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de secundaría completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de calzados, carne y abarrotes al por menor; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (abarrotes: azúcar, arroz, etc.). 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá ampliar su tienda de abarrotes y adquirir mas mercadería, puesto que su sueño es tener en el futuro una bodega distribuidora con diversos productos; asimismo desea que sus hijos sean profesionales, por ello viene ahorrando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the “03 de Mayo” Communal Bank, in the Ilave district, province of El Collao, in the Puno area. She is 30 years old and has a common law marriage. She has 3 children and completed her secondary school studies. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years. She buys and sells wholesale footwear, meat and groceries. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, with which she acquired merchandise for her business (groceries such as sugar, rice, etc.). With this loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she agrees to commit to paying in 5 monthly payments. She will be able to expand her grocery store and acquire more merchandise, since her dream is to have a distribution shop in the future with diverse products; likewise, she wants her children to become professionals, and for that she has been saving her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and expand her grocery store, since her dream is to have a distribution shop in the future with diverse products; likewise, she wants her children to become professionals, and for that she has been saving her earnings.

loans.name: Ernestina Lydia

texts.es:
La señora Lydia es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el barrio Porvenir – Miraflores, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 06 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercer grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 meses; se dedica a la venta de productos ocasionales (ollas, utensilios de cocina, verduras, pan, etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual incremento su capital y pudo adquirir mercadería (ollas y verduras). 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1300.00 nuevos soles, monto que pagará en 5 cuotas por mes; podrá incrementar su capital aun mas, e invertir en la compra de accesorios de cocina y frutas (sandía, uvas y papayas), con las ganancias espera ayudar a sus hijos en su educación y poder construir su casa en la ciudad de Puno; para sus hijos.
Ella esta agradecida a Manuela Ramos por brindarle este apoyo en bien de su negocio.
texts.en:
Lydia is a member of the "03 de Mayo” Communal Bank, in the Porvenir-Miraflores neighborhood, district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the Puno area. She is 47-years-old and in a common law marriage. She has 6 children and finished three years of secondary school studies. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 months. She sells occasional products (pots, kitchen utensils, vegetables, bread, etc.). Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, with which she grew her capital and was able to acquire merchandise (pots and vegetables). With this loan of 1300 nuevos soles, she agrees that she will pay in 5 monthly payments. She will be able to increase her capital even more and invest in the purchase of kitchen accessories and fruits (watermelon, grapes and papayas). With the earnings, she hopes to help her children with their education and be able to build a house in the city of Puno for her children. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her support to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen accessories and fruits (watermelon, grapes and papayas), with the earnings she hopes to help her children with their education and be able to build her house in the city of Puno for her children.

loans.name: Las Rosadas 3 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Marie and Angeline are group coordinators for the Las Rosadas bank. Angeline is an entrepreneur who sells clothing, bedding supplies, and miscellaneous beauty products. She has been running her own business for the last four years. As a immigrant from Haiti, she has few other economic opportunities available to her. Angeline works to support four children, and puts her profits towards food for the family, school fees, and maintaining her home.

Marie is an entrepreneur also involved in clothing and bedding sales, and other miscellaneous items. She has been involved in her micro-business for 2 years. She uses her profits to send her children to school. Regarding how she makes ends meet, Marie says "you can't just sit around and do nothing! Come up with something to do!"

These women describe their neighborhood as "forgotten." Their community, they say feels an economic "crisis" at hand. As Haitian immigrants, these women say they are very aware of the limited opportunities available to them. For many in their situation, university education will remain out of reach. Marie reflects that through microlending, she has achieved some important gains in her life. In particular, she was able to save money to visit her family in Haiti for the first time in nine years. This, she says, is very important to her.

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Cabañas Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of seventeen women who work in the Cabañas neighborhood of the city of Caacupé. The women do a number of different types of work, but this does not affect the high level of coordination within the group. At this time, the women have reached their eleventh loan cycle with the Women Entrepreneurs program at Fundacion Paraguaya, and they maintain a line of credit of 740,000 Guaranís (about US$ 150) per member.

The group was formed during early meetings at the home of Mrs. Ninfa V., who learned about the idea from a cousin who is involved with another group. With this information, the women began to organize themselves and soon afterward, they had the initial fifteen members that are necessary to form a group.

Mrs. Ada A., president of the group, acknowledges that during the committee's first cycles, it was somewhat difficult for the group to come to a consensus as there were always many disparate opinions. Nevertheless, as time passed, the group was strengthened and today it is characterized by harmony and a mutual respect among all the members. The members believe that there is a simple factor that allows a committee to be successful: each member should stay committed to the objectives they set, individually and as a member of the group.

loans.use: purchase of milk, sugar, starch, cheese, drinks, and men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “03 D. Mayo”, en el barrio Progreso, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno; tiene 68 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 07 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (primero D. primaria).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años; tiene un negocio D. venta D. abarrotes y golosinas al menudeo; su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (golosinas). 

Con este préstamo D. S/ 400.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá complementar su negocio y comprar mas mercadería (arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.), con lo cual podrá ofrecer a sus clientes todo lo que necesiten, ella piensa sostenerse así misma en cuanto a su salud y alimentación, y ayudar en algo a sus hijos puesto que ellos están lejos y tienen su propia familia.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the communal bank "The Third of May" located in the neighborhood named Progress, in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, and in the department of Puno. She is 68 years old, is married and has 7 children. She was unable to complete primary school.

She has worked in the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 2 years. She has a business where she sells groceries and candy. Her first loan was for 300 Soles, which she used to buy candy to sell.

With this new loan of 400 Soles she will be able to help her store by buying more merchandise like rice, sugar, pasta, milk, etc. She plans to repay the loan in 5 monthly quotes. With the new merchandise she will be able to offer her customers everything they need. She works hard to be able to take care of herself and her family. Her children are grown and have their own families, but she would like to be able to help them if they ever need it.

(Translated by Ally and Thatcher of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise like rice, sugar, pasta, milk, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Con Proposito Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres Unidas Con Proposito” (or Women United with Purpose) is a group of ten entrepreneurs seeking their third loan from Esperanza International. The group’s past two loans have been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize a third loan for further business expansion. Eladia is one of the coordinators of the group in Santiago.

Eladia is the mother of three married children aged 19, 28, and 31. Her business is selling undergarments. Daily she travels the streets of Santiago with her garments to sell to local women. She declares business is good and she is able to sell inventory daily.

Eladia's past two loans have been used to purchase additional undergarment pieces to sell; because of the success of her business and the customer base she has developed, she plans to start food sales from her home. Her third loan will be used to purchase rice, beans, oil, and other needed Dominican food and cooking staples. Because of her loyal customer base she is able to sell her products on credit, something that local grocery stores cannot offer.

Other member’s of Eladia’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial operations, including small grocery stands, beauty salons, and vegetable and clothing sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, oil, and other cooking staples

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto cuenta con 41 años de edad, vive cerca de 10 años con la madre de sus dos hijos, en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas, sus chacras están distantes a la ciudad, cerca de 2 horas caminando. Pero Roberto vive cerca a su chacra, y lo que siembra mayormente es achote y café que según la temporada es rentable, una vez que pasa la cosecha de café se dedica a sus cultivos de achote y maíz morocho para alimento de las aves de corral.  En la siembra del achote y maíz no invierte mucho, y tampoco es mucho esfuerzo, solo la siembra, renovar los cultivos y abonar la tierra. Se cosecha antes de que maduren bien para que no pierda nada, en seguida procede a secar el maíz y luego a desgranar cada mazorca que vende por kilos. Roberto trata de acumular una cantidad mayor para luego vender por sacos a 45 soles cada uno, lo bueno es que siempre tiene tiempo para cuidar de cada una de sus chacras, y está muy contento con el trabajo que realiza. Roberto es un cliente muy inquieto y bromista con los demás integrantes del banco comunal; este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser un cliente muy responsable y asiste puntualmente a todas las reuniones. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para el abonado correspondiente de sus chacras de cítricos, café y maíz.
texts.en:
Roberto is 41-years-old and has lived in his own house with his mother and two children for nearly 10 years. Since he was very young he has made his living as a farmer. His fields are far from the city, close to two hours' walk. But Roberto lives near his farm, on which he plants primarily achote (annato, a spice) and coffee, which are profitable, depending on the season. Once the coffee harvest is over, Roberto works on planting his achote, as well as morocho (white) corn to feed his poultry. Planting achote and corn doesn't require too much effort, and Roberto doesn't invest much in it, except for sowing, replanting, and fertilizing. He harvests them before they get too ripe so he doesn't lose any. He dries the corn right away, then threshes each cob, and sells it by the kilo. Roberto tries to accumulate a large quantity of corn, which he can then sell for 45 soles per sack. The good thing is that he always has time to tend each one of his fields, and is very happy with his work. Roberto is a lively client, and loves to joke around with the other members of the village bank. This will be his 5th loan with MFP; he has always proven to be a very a responsible client, and he attends every meeting on time. He intends to use his loan to buy fertilizers for his citrus, coffee and corn fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida Y. is a young entrepreneur. She is the owner of a business dedicated to the sale and activation of cell phones. Aida was able to obtain the necessary startup capital for her business from her parents who still advise her on her enterprise.  

The business is located in the center of the city of Tobatí, and Aida manages its affairs personally. She comments that in the cell phone market there is a lot of competition and to stay ahead, one must take good care of the business and above all, one must fulfill the requests of potential customers as quickly as possible.  

Aida will invest the funds she receives from Fundación Paraguaya in the purchase of cell phone cards and accessories. This will allow her to keep her business well-stocked and thus, she will be able to offer the wide variety of products and services that are associated with cellphones in today’s market.  

Aida says that in the future she plans to open a branch of her business near the Church of Tobatí because, as it is the most frequently visited place in the city, the possibility of increased sales is higher there than it is anywhere else.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cell phone cards and accessories, etc.

loans.name: Lidia Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el Barrio Ramón Castilla, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios de secundaría completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, se dedica a la comercialización de artículos de plástico (baldes, platos, juguetes, etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para la época. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 2500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mercadería variada para su negocio (baldes de plástico, cubiertos,  platos, accesorios de plástico para cocina, etc.), lo que venderá en las ferias de Ilave y Puno,  su deseo es edificar su casa y brindarles una adecuada educación a sus hijos.
Ella se muestra muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por el poyo brindado hasta la fecha.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the communal bank "The Third of May" located in the neighborhood of Ramon Castilla, in the district of Ilave, in the povince of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and she has two children. She completed her high school education.

She has worked in the Manuela Ramos movement for the past 4 years. She makes a living by selling plastic products like buckets, plates, toys, etc. Her first loan was for 300 Soles and she used it to purchase new merchandise.

With this new loan of 2,500 Soles she will purchase additional merchandise for her business like plastic buckets, eating utensils, kitchen accessories, etc. She will sell this merchandise at the market places of Ilave and Puno. Her goal is to work hard so that she can earn enough to build her own house and to give her children a good education.

She feels very grateful for all of the support that Manuela Ramos has given her.

(Translated by Jian of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise for her business like, plastic buckets, eating utensils, kitchen accessories, etc.

loans.name: Milagros Del Pilar

texts.es:
MILAGROS DEL PILAR P. VÁSQUEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” ubicado en el Jr. Los Naranjos N° 851 – San Fernando del Distrito de Manantay, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 27 años de edad, 02 hijos, su esposo vende pollos y gallinas.

Su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró pollos para criar en su casa: 10 gallinas criollas, para vender en el mercado de Bellavista.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, implementó en su negocio ubicado en el Mercado de Bellavista la compra de pollos, patos, gallinas, tiene muchos clientes es muy hábil para viscerar las aves.

Ella está muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por la confianza a pesar de su edad, espera ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
MILAGROS DEL PILAR P. VÁSQUEZ belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Solidarias" (Women's Solidarity), located at 851 Jr. Los Naranjos, in San Fernando, in the district of Manantay, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 27 years old, has 2 children and her son sells chickens and chicks.

Her first loan was for 300 Soles and she used it to buy 10 chicks to raise, which she later sold in the marketplace Bellavista.

With this new loan of 1,200 Soles, she will invest in her business by buying chicks, ducks, chickens to raise and to sell to her customers.

Milagros is very grateful for all of the support she has received through Manuela Ramos and she hopes to become a great business person.

(Translated by Tommy and Elliot of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in her business by buying chicks, ducks, chickens to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Mr. Aurelio M. is 50 years old and he is married with two children. He is the owner of a small store, Despensa San Antonio, and he has cows that produce milk that he also sells in his store. Mr. M. also makes and sells cheese.

Mr. M. has run the store for more than 25 years; sales are usually good because the store is located in the downtown area of the city of Piribebuy, where one can find a good crowd of people every day of the week.

Thanks to the loan he will receive from Fundación Paraguaya, Mr. Megarejo will keep his store well-stocked and he will be able to buy more merchandise of all sorts, especially products that are sold on a daily basis: meat, sugar, oil, eggs, noodles, etc.

Mr. M. states that he needs to buy a three-door freezer to keep drinks cold because on the weekends his drink sales are very strong. In the hot summer months, cold drinks are the products that sell most, along with chicken and beef.

loans.use: purchase of goods such as meat, milk, eggs, sugar, flour, sodas, beer, rice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
ROMELIA CÓRDOVA V. D. O., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sol Naciente” ubicado en el Jr. Jhon F. Kennedy N° 999 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 62 años D. edad, 03 hijos y hace 09 años es socia en Manuela Ramos.

El primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro utensilios, artículos D. primera necesidad para vender comida en el frontis D. su casa.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró 10 cajas D. cerveza, 10 cajas D. gaseosa, productos para la venta D. comida como: 4 pollos, 3kg D. carne del monte (venado), 5kg. D. pescado, arroz 01 saco, azúcar 16kg., aceite 01 paquete D. 01litro; con la ayuda D. sus hijos, la señora Romelia crece cada vez más en su negocio D. comida en el cual comienza a las  06:00 p.m. D. la tarD..

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su comprensión en ayudarle ya que quedó V. y no tenía medios económicos para mantener y brindarles a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Romelia Cordova V. D. Orocho belongs to the Communal Bank "Sol Naciente" located at 999 John F. Kennedy Jr., Celleria Dictrict. She is 62 years old, has three childrens and has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 9 years. The first loan of 300 New Soles bought utensils, primary necessary items to sell food in front of her house. With this loan of 2500 New Soles, she bought ten boxes of beer, 10 boxes of sodas, products for food sales, like 4 chickens, 3 kg of venisan, 5 kg of fish, 1 sack of rice, 16 kg of sugar and one 1 liter package of vinegar. With the help of her children, Romelia grows her food sale business, which starts at 6 p.m. each month. She thanks Manuela Ramos for her compassion in helping her because she is a widow and does not have the economic means to support and raise her children.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ten boxes of beer, 10 boxes of sodas, products for food sales, like 4 chickens, 3 kg of venisan, 5 kg of fish, 1 sack of rice, 16 kg of sugar and one 1 liter package of vinegar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients used to make ice cream, such as sugar, etc.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil divorciada, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios de cuarto de primaria (incompleta). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años; ella se dedica a la artesanía en bayeta (bordados); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual adquirió materiales para su negocio (lana y bayeta) 
Con este  préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que esta comprometida a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir materiales para su negocio (bayeta y lana), lo que le servirá para hacer mas tejidos y poder venderlos en los lugares turísticos de Puno e Ilave. Su anhelo es ver a sus hijos profesionales, por ello viene invirtiendo en su educación.
texts.en:
Graciela is an associate of the Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo” (the 3rd of may,” in the key district, Provincia de El Collao, in the state of Puno. She is 53 years old, divorced, and has 2 children. She is educated until the fourth grade of primary school. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. Graciela is works as an embroidery artisan. Her first loan was of 300 new soles, which she used to acquire materials for her business, cloth and wool. With this loan of 500 new soles, which is set up to be paid in 5 monthly quotas, she will be able to acquire more wool and cloth for her business, which will serve to make more fabrics, and enable her to sell them in tourist locations of Puno and the district. Her longing is to see her children become professionals, and so she continues to invest in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire supplies for her business (cloth and wool) so that she may sell in tourist areas of Puno.

loans.name: Umc Primary School, Makeni Group

texts.en:
Pictured is the faculty of the United Methodist Church (UMC) Primary School, Makeni. It was founded in 1969 by the United Methodist Church to educate the children of the community and to support the church. It is one the oldest schools in town. UMC currently has an enrollment of 917 pupils and a staff of twenty-five dedicated teachers.

Because of the dedication of its teachers, UMC Primary students achieve outstanding results in the National Primary School Examination (NPSE). Almost always, 99% of UMC Primary pupils pass the examination to enter secondary school. The children also participate in extracurricular activities, such as football (soccer), other athletic games, and  social events organized for all primary schools in Makeni.

Teaching is a rewarding profession, but it is not well paid. Government salaries for teachers are usually small, so teachers often have to supplement their incomes. But with this loan, they will be able to invest in something meaningful and gradually repay the loan within a ten-month period from their monthly salaries.Some of the teachers will use their portion of the loan to pay school fees for themselves or their children. Other will invest their portion in businesses or farming. And others will use their portion to buy furniture or improve their homes. This is the first loan UMC Primary school is seeking from SMT. They were inspired by UMC Secondary school to apply for a loan from SMT.

Sallamatu B. (3rd from Left) is the head teacher of this school. Sallamatu was born in Yoni Banna, a small town in the Tonkolili district. She is thirty-six years old. She is married to the principal of UMC Secondary School, Makeni, and the couple has two children. She has been teaching for the past fourteen years. She has always found it necessary to take on extra work, such as selling foodstuffs, to supplement her monthly salary. She would use her portion of this loan to buy palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) in bulk for resale. She would use the profits to pay school fees for her eldest son, who is in class four.

loans.use: Buy palm oil for resale

loans.name: Los Laureles 2 Group

texts.en:
Group 2 of the Los Laureles Bank of Hope is on its first loan cycle with Esperanza International. This group of small entrepreneurs has five members, with businesses in the sales and food fields. Several of the members, including Maria J., the group coordinator, have food stands. Others sell different products in small shops or at their own homes.

Maria has four children. She hopes to provide for them a better education so they can have a brighter future and better job opportunities. This is why she is taking this loan with Esperanza. She is looking for a fresh capital injection that will revitalize her business, allowing her to have more merchandise available for her customers and, in consequence, increase her sales.

These ladies are looking forward to the future, and know that their hard work will pay off. On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting this loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a food stand.

loans.name: Rosalino

texts.es: Rosalino tiene 34 años, vive hace 5 años con su pareja con la que tiene tres hijos, actualmente viven en su casa propia. Él y su esposa se han propuesto sembrar chacras de café y plantas de diversas frutas, en algunos casos espera 3 largos años para la cosecha, en otros es cada 15 días, por ello está muy contento porque esta actividad le permite cubrir la alimentación y el bienestar de su familia, además le llena de alegría en trabajar junto a su esposa e hijos que le apoyan en sus chacras. Su anhelo es comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, para que no sigan sembrando en tierras alquiladas, y de ese modo mejoren sus ingresos económicos, los que le permitan cubrir la educación de sus hijos que pronto necesitarán mayores recursos para que estudien. Rosalino acaba de juramentar como vocal de su banco comunal, donde ha hecho compromisos de cumplir sus funciones debidamente. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo a pagado con mucha responsabilidad todas su cuotas sin caer en morosidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas para contrarrestar las plagas que asechan a sus plantas frutales.
texts.en:
Rosalino is 34 years old and has lived for 5 years with his partner with whom he has three children. At present they live in their own house. He and its wife have planted small gardens with coffee and a variety fruit plants. In some cases it will take 3 long years for the first harvest, in others it will be every 15 days. He is very pleased because this enterprise enables him to cover the cost of food and promote his family’s welfare, and it also makes him happy to be working with his wife and children who support him in tending their small gardens. He yearns to buy his own agricultural land so that they do not have to continue sowing rented land. This would improve their income, allowing him to provide an education for his children who will soon require greater resources to be able to study. Rosalino has just been sworn in as the director of the communal bank, where has made the commitment to comply with his duties and responsibilities. This is the 5th loan with MFP, and Rosalino has always been responsible for making all payments in a timely manner. The funds requested will be used to buy fertilizer and insecticide to combat plagues that attack his fruit-bearing plants.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia tiene 56 años de edad, hace 22 años vive con su pareja, es madre de 6 hijos y actualmente viven en su casa propia. Años atrás se dedicaba junto a su esposo a las labores del campo, pero desde que la cantidad de hijos creció decidió quedarse en casa para cuidar de ellos. Es así que decide iniciar un negocio de venta de comida aprovechando la deliciosa sazón con la que nació. Negocio que se está volviendo muy rentable a medida que va captando más clientela. Para tener listo el desayuno se levanta a las 4.00am, empezando a realizar la limpieza de su local y después a preparar los desayunos para sus comensales que en su mayoría son agricultores, a eso de la 7.00am sirve el desayuno mientras que cada uno de sus clientes le proporcionan sus vasijas para que le sirva el almuerzo que llevarán hasta sus chacras. Madrugar es cansado, pero Felicia está feliz porque esta actividad le permite cubrir los gastos de sus hijos, mientras que su esposo se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas. Felicia acaba de juramentar como fiscal de su banco comunal, está agradecida por la confianza que le han depositado los demás integrantes, y hace promesas de cumplir con sus pagos responsablemente a MFP, este es su 5to préstamo. El dinero que solicita en este crédito es para la compra de víveres para el preparado del menú diario.
texts.en:
Felicia is 56 years old and has lived with her partner for 22 years. She is the mother of 6 children and at present they live in their own house. Years ago she worked in the fields with her husband, but once she had several children they decided she should remain at home to care for them. It was at this point she decided to begin a food sale business, taking advantage of her ability to prepare deliciously seasoned food. Her business is becoming very profitable since she is gaining more customers. To have breakfast ready, she wakes at 4:00a.m., begins by cleaning her establishment, and then prepares breakfast for her customers who are mostly farm workers. Around 7:00 a.m. she serves breakfast and while her customers eat, she packs the lunches they will consume at the farms where they work. Although it is tiring to get up so early, Felicia is happy to do so because it allows her to cover her children’s basic expenses while her husband continues to work in agriculture. Felicia has just been sworn in as fiscal officer of her communal bank, and she is grateful for the confidence placed in her by the other members. This is her 5th loan and she promises to be responsible in making payments to MFP. The funds requested will be used to purchase supplies to prepare the daily menu.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to prepare the daily menu.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 40 años, vive hace 25 años con su pareja y es madre de sus cinco hijos. Junto a su esposo, se dedica a sembrar varias hectáreas de cultivos frutales, y en menor cantidad de café, de enero a marzo es la época de bonanza, donde trata de acumular todas las ganancias para que le sirvan de capital para sus próximos cultivos. Margarita inicia sus labores a las 6.00am, cumpliendo sus funciones de ama de casa, después, eso de las 10.00am alista sus viandas y lleva el almuerzo de su esposo y ella. En esta época los cítricos tienen mucha demanda, por ser verano en la capital, y en tiempos de inviernos dejan de lado los cítricos y  comienza con la cosecha de plátanos y paltas. A Margarita le gusta su actividad agrícola por ser muy rentable en ciertas épocas, que les ha permitido cubrir la educación de sus hijos y demás gastos de adicionales de la familia. Margarita es muy activa en su banco comunal, el ciclo pasado tenia el cargo de fiscal, se encargaba de ver los procedimientos y manejos  de los demás integrantes en el grupo. Este es su 5to préstamo con  MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas responsablemente. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas para la buena producción de sus frutas.
texts.en:
Margarita is 40; she has been living with her life partner for 25 years and she has 5 children. With her partner, she tends several hectares of fruit trees and a smaller area under coffee; January to March is the harvest season, and they try to earn as much as possible as capital for their next crop.

Margarita gets up at 6.00 a.m. to attend to the house. Then, around 10.00, she prepares lunch for her partner and herself. This is the time of the citrus harvest and there is a lot of demand since it is summertime in the capital city; winter is the time of the banana and avocado harvests.

Margarita likes farming as it is very profitable at certain times of year, enabling them to pay for their children's education and cover other household expenses. Margarita is very active in her community bank; in the last period she acted as controller, overseeing the procedures and management by the other group members.

This is her fifth loan from MFP; she has always repaid her loans promptly. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer and insecticide to enhance the fruit crop.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: National Library Board, Kabala Group

texts.en:
These gentlemen work for the National Library Board, Kabala. They are requesting a loan of 1,800,000 leones to supplement their monthly salaries. With this loan, they will be able to do something great for their families and gradually make repayment out of their monthly salaries.

Andrew P. K. (left) is the Librarian in charge and the leader of this group of two. Andrew was born in Kabala in 1965. He is married and has two children. One of his children is in primary school and the other has dropped out of school as a result of teenage pregnancy.

Andrew already has a plot of land he inherited from his dad. With this loan, he will buy bags of cement, sand and iron rods to start building a house. He will share the loan with his fellow group member, Sabian.

loans.use: To invest in a house building project.

loans.name: Antonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Antonia pertenece al banco comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo” vive en Jr. La merced primera cuadra, distrito de Juanjui, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 27 años y es madre de 2 niños. Es conviviente, su pareja trabaja como vigilante. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente vende refrigerios en un local de un familiar, prepara jugos, además de tamalitos, juanes, sándwich, etc. Esto le genera un ingreso diario para el pago puntual de las cuotas del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/ 2,000 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará mesitas, sillas, y alquilara un kiosco en el colegio para vender cuando comience las clases, además de los productos que necesita para su preparación.

Antonia manifiesta estar contenta de pertenecer al banco, y agradece el apoyo que le brinda.
texts.en:
Antonia belongs to the communal bank “Honestidad y Trabajo.” She lives on Jr. La Merced, first block, in the district of Juanjui, in the state of San Martín. She is 27 years old and is the mother of 2 children. She lives with a partner, who works as a watch guard. With her first loan of 300 soles she decided to invest in the sale of clothing. She has been working for 2 weeks with the bank. She actually sells refrigerated goods in a business of a family member. She prepares juices, and little tamales, juanes, sandwiches, etc. This generates a daily income that enables her to pay her bank quotas punctually. With this loan of 2000 soles, that will be paid in 6 months, she will buy little tables and chairs, and she will also rent a kiosk at the local high school to sell food when classes start. Furthermore, the loan will also be used to buy the products she needs for the preparation of her merchandise. Antonia expresses her content with belonging to the bank, and appreciates the support that it grants her.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs, and to rent a kiosk so that she may sell her merchandise at the high school when classes start.

loans.name: Bertha Luz

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y trabajo”, vive en Jr. Triunfo Nº 401, Distrito D. Juanjui, departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 46 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, 2 mayores D. edad  y 2 que dependen aún D. ella. Es casada, su esposo esta muy delicado D. salud. Con el primer prestamo recibido D. S/ 300.00 deciD. invertir en su negocio D. sastrería. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente continua con el mismo negocio, ubicado en un lugar acondicionado D. su casa, oficio que le permite un ingreso diario propicio para el pago mensual D. las cuotas con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 3,000 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará telas en rollos  D. diferentes colores sobre todo para uniformes por que ya empieza la época D.  campaña escolar lo que quiere aprovechar al máximo.

Bertha esta contenta con lo logrado y agradece al banco por el apoyo que brinda a las mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Ms. Bertha Luz belongs to the communal bank "Honesty and Work", an affiliate of Kiva. She lives in Jr.Triumph Nº 401, District of Juanjui, department of San Martin. She is 46 years old and is a mother of four children, two of legal age, and two who still depend on her. She is married, although her husband is in delicate health. With the first loan of $300 that she received, she decided to invest in her business of tailoring. She has been working with the bank for for five years. At the present, she is continuing with her business, located near her house, in a favorable position which insures her daily income and the exact punctuality of her monthly repayment of her loans. With this loan of 3000 nuevos soles that will be repaid in six months, she will buy fabrics in rolls of different colors for uniforms, because she wants to take advantage of back to school shopping. Bertha is content with what she has achieved and is thankful to the bank for the support that it offers hard-working women.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth in rolls of different colors to make uniforms for back to school shopping.

loans.name: Cadith

texts.es:
La señora Cadith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en prolongación Grau Nº 160, distrito y provincia de Juanjui, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 39 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 1 es mayor de edad y 2 aun dependen de ella. Es conviviente, su pareja se dedica a la venta de madera. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en golosinas, para venderlos en su casa. Tiene 7 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente cuenta con una pequeña bodega y cabinas de Internet, esto le permite un ingreso diario, con lo que paga las cuotas mensuales del banco puntualmente.

Con este prestamo de S/ 3,000 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara papel higiénico en paquetes, arroz, azúcar en sacos, algunas verduras, y además con una parte pagara el mantenimiento de las maquinas del Internet. 

Cadith, esta muy agradecida con el banco comunal por el apoyo que recibe ya que esto le permite crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Cadith belongs to the communal bank "Honesty and Work", an affiliate of Kiva. She lives in the neighborhood of Grau Nº 160, in the province of Juanjui, and the department of San Martin. She is 39 years old and is a mother of 3 children. One of children is of legal age, and two still depend on her. Her spouse works selling wood. With the first loan she recieved of $300, she decided to invest in delicacies, which she sold from her house. She has been working with the bank for seven years. With this loan of 3000 nuevos soles that will be repaid in six months, she will buy toilet paper in packages, rice, sugar in bags, some vegetables, and additionally a part will pay the maintenance for her computers. At the present she depends on a small grocery store and Internet cafe for her daily income, with which she repays her loan payments promptly. Cadith is very thankful for the communal bank for the support that she receives and that has permitted her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toilet paper in packets, rice, suger in sacks, various vegetables, and pay for the maintenance of her Internet cafe.

loans.name: Dory

texts.es:
La señora Dory pertenece al banco comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en  Jr. Loreto Nº s/n, Provincia de Juanjui, departamento de Mariscal Cáceres. Tiene 45 años y es madre de 2 hijos los cuales dependen aun de ella. Es conviviente, su pareja trabaja como transportista en un motokar. Dory  con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en la compra de verduras regionales para venderlos en el mercado. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente cuenta con dos puestos en el mercado central de su ciudad, además de un motokar propio que le permite ingresos diarios para poder pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1,900.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara 10 sacos de yuca, hojas en cantidad, 20 racimos de plátano, naranjas y otras frutas en cientos, etc.

Dory esta muy agradecida con el Banco por el apoyo brindado por haberle permitido sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
