Ms. Dory belongs to the communal bank "Honesty and Work", an affiliate of Kiva, and lives in Jr. Loreto Nº, in the province of Juanjui, department of Marshal Cáceres. She is 45 years old and is a mother of two children who depend on her. Her spouse works as a trucker. Dory used her first loan of $300 to invest in the purchase of regional vegetables, in order to sell them in the market. She has worked with the bank for eight years. At the moment she has two stalls in the central market of the city, in addition to owning her own motokar, which allows her a daily income in order to be able to repay the loan promptly. With this loan of 1,900 nuevos soles that will be repaid in six months, she will buy 10 bags of yucca, leaves in bulk, 20 bunches of bananas, oranges and other fruits by the hundreds, and numerous other goods. Dory is very thankful for the Bank for the support they have offered which has permitted her to move ahead with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of yucca, leaves in bulk, 20 bunches of bananas, oranges, and other fruits.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 28 años de edad, hace más de 10 años vive con su pareja y es madre de dos hijos. Sus cultivos son muy distantes de su casa, caminando llega en 1 hora a más, pese a esta distancia Elsa y su esposo han alquilado chacras y están sembrando plátanos y café.  Hace tres años ha sembrado madarinas y tanyelos, y durante estos meses realizaba sus cosechas para que cada viernes envíe sus productos al mercado. Una vez que pasa la época de los cítricos empieza la de paltas y plátanos que realizara cada quincena del mes. En cada cosecha que lleva la mercado regresa con una ganancia  de 200 soles aprox. por ello que se siente muy animada y con anhelos de seguir sembrando. Su deseo es poder comprar sus propias tierras de cultivo para dejar de pagar alquileres. Elsa es muy activa en su banco comunal, pese a no tener ningún cargo, siempre trata de colaborar con la junta directiva, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de plantas para incrementar sus cultivos frutales, cabe recalcar que Elsa está agradecida con el crédito facilitado que le permiten seguir trabajando en bien de su progreso.
texts.en:
Elsa is 28; she has been living with her life partner for 10 years; she has 2 children. Her fields are quite far from her house; it takes her over an hour to walk there. Nevertheless, she and her partner have rented fields and are planting bananas and coffee.

Three years ago, she planted mandarin and tangelo trees and in the last few months she has been harvesting to ship the produce to market each Friday. Once the citrus harvest is over, she will begin with avocados and bananas, which are shipped every two weeks. Each harvest that she takes to market provides about 200 sol, so she is very enthusiastic and wants to expand her plantations. Her ambition is to buy her own land and stop paying rent to others.

Elsa is a very active member of the community bank, although she has no official position; she always tries to help the committee and she has always been punctual with her payments. The loan is to buy plants to expand her fruit orchards; Elsa is very grateful for the credit, which has enabled her to continue working and improving her situation.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plants to expand production

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 346, provincia de Juanjui, departamento de Mariscal Cáceres. Tiene 47 años y es madre de 2 hijos, 1 es mayor de edad y 1 todavía depende de ella. Es conviviente, su pareja administra el Instituto que hace años fundaron juntos. Como una oportunidad de crecer ingresa al banco hace 4 años, con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en un cafetín dentro del instituto.

Actualmente sigue con el mismo negocio, y además cuenta con una fotocopiadora con el que trabaja diariamente permitiéndole un ingreso diario para poder pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/ 3,000 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara un terreno mas grande para el cafetín.

Isabel manifiesta su alegría de pertenecer a Manuela Ramos por haberle permitido crecer como mujer y empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Isabel belongs to the communal bank "Honesty and Work", an affiliate of Kiva, and lives in the Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 346, province of Juanjui, department of Marshal Cáceres. She is 47 years old and is the mother of 2 children, 1 of legal age and one of which who still depends on her. Her spouse administers the Institute that years ago they founded together. As an opportunity to grow, she joined the bank four years ago. With her first loan of $300 dollars she decided to invest in a small cafe inside the Institute. At present, she continues with her business, in addition to counting on a daily income from a a photocopier, with which she will be able to repay her loan promptly. With this loan of 3,000 nuevos soles that will be repaid in six months, she will buy a larger plot of land for her cafe. Isabel is very happy to belong to Manuelo Ramos, which has permitted her to grow as a woman and a business person.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger plot of land for her cafe.

loans.name: Lider

texts.es:
La señora Lider pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II”, vive en el jr. Napoleón Chu Ríos Nº 490 – Brisas del shilcayo- sector EMAPA, distrito D. Tarapoto, departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 55 años y es madre D. 8 hijos, 5 mayores D. edad y 3 que aun dependen D. ella, es conviviente, su pareja se dedica a la construcción (maestro constructor). Con su primer prestamo D. S/. 300 deciD. vender frutas en el mercado. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad, además D. venta D. frutas se dedica a la venta D. juanes, tamales, empanadas D. yuca, en un paradero D. motocarristas, lo que genera ingresos para el pago mensual del prestamo.

Con este prestamo D. S/ 2,000 que será pagado en 4 meses,  comprara, 2 mesas, banquitos para que sus clientes puedan comer con comodidad,  además utensilios para transportar sus productos como baldes, bandejas, también 1 docena D. platos, vasos, etc.

Lider esta muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que le brinda a las mujeres como ella.
texts.en:
Ms. Lider belongs to the communal bank "Women for the Future II", an affiliate of Kiva, and lives in the Jr. Napoleon Chu Rivers Nº 490 – Breezes of the Shilcayo- sector EMAPA, district of Tarapoto, department of San Martin. She is 55 years old and is the mother of 8 children, 5 of legal age and three that still depend on her. Her spouse works in construction. With her first loan of $300, she decided to sell fruits in the market. She has been working with the bank for two years. Currently, besides selling fruit she sells tamales and yucca empanadas near a roadway,which provides her income with which to repay her loan monthly. With her loan of 2000 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 2 tables so that her clients can eat in in comfort, in addition to utensils to transport her products such as buckets, trays, and 1 dozen dishes, glasses, etc. Lider is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for the support that they offer to women like her.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 2 tables so that her clients can eat in in comfort, in addition to utensils to transport her products such as buckets, trays, and 1 dozen dishes, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Loicith

texts.es:
La señora Loicith pertenece al banco comunal “Honestidad y trabajo” vive en prolongación Mariscal Cáceres Nº 155, distrito de Juanjui, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 6 hijos, 1 mayor de edad y 5 todavía dependen de ella. Es casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en la venta de anticuchos en el patio de su casa. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio de venta de anticuchos y además cuenta con un motokar que trabaja diariamente, el cual le permite un ingreso diario con lo que paga sus cuotas puntualmente. 

Con este prestamo de S/ 3,000 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara otro motokar, con el que transportara sus cosas para el negocio y trabajara por las mañanas.

Loicith refiere estar agradecida por el apoyo que brinda Manuela Ramos a las mujeres que desean trabajar.
texts.en:
Ms. Loicith belongs to the communal bank "Honesty and Work", an affiliate of Kiva, and lives in Marshal Cáceres Nº 155, district of Juanjui, department of San Martin. She is 42 years old and is a mother of 6 children, 1 of legal age and 5 still depending on her. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture. With her first loan of $300 she decided to invest in selling kabobs in the patio of her house. She has been working with the bank for three years. She is currently in the business of selling kabobs, and also counts on a motokar that works daily, which provides a daily income with which to repay her loans promptly. With this loan of 3000 nuevos soles that she will repay in six months. she will buy another motokar, with which she will transport her things to her buisness and work in the mornings. Loicith is thankful for the support that Manuela Ramos offers women like herself who wish to work.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy another motokar, with which to transport her business things, and for transportation to work in the mornings.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora Rosmery pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II”, vive en Jr Bolognesi Nº 835 del distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 36 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos ellos dependen de ella. Es conviviente, su pareja cuenta con un motokar que es su herramienta de trabajo lo que genera ingresos para la familia. Rosmery con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide vender frutas y carbón. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

 En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de refrescos en una esquina muy transitada de la ciudad,  trabajo que decide realizar por las pocas ganancias que le dejaba la venta de frutas y carbón.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1,000 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara baldes, vasos, una mesa, sillas, para mejorar la apariencia del negocio y atraer mas a la clientela.

Rosmery esta muy contenta con el Banco Comunal por la oportunidad que le brinda de salir adelante y sentirse útil como mujer.
texts.en:
Rosmery belongs to Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II,” she lives on Jr. Bolognesi Nº 835 of the district Tarapoto, in the state of San Martín. She is 36 years old and is a mother of 3 children, all of whom are dependent on her. She lives with a partner, who has a car that he uses as working capital that generates income for the family. With the first loan of 300 soles, Rosmery decided to sell fruits and carbonated beverages. She has 2 worked with the bank for 2 years. Currently, Rosmery sells refreshments on a heavily trafficked corner of the city, which she decided to realize by using the little earnings she had from selling fruits and carbonated beverages. With this loan of 1000 soles, which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy buckets, glasses, a table, and chairs, to improve the appearance of her business and to attract her clientele more. Rosmery is very happy with el Banco Comunal and the opportunity they grant her to progress and feel like a useful woman.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buckets, glasses, a table, and chairs, so that she may improve the appearance of her business.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta  tiene 58 años y vive con su esposo en su propia casa. VenD. artesanías a base a lana, las elabora en su casa todos los días y utiliza el telar, que es el principal instrumento D. trabajo que tiene para producir grandes cantidades, ya que ella es abastecedora D. estos productos artesanales, una vez que termina D. elaborar sus productos las reparte en las principales ferias turísticas y comerciales D. su zona. A un inicio realizaba sola estos productos, pero actualmente sus hijos y algunas personas que contrató realizan este trabajo para cubrir la creciente demanda D. sus productos, lo cual es un indicador  D. que su negocio tiene un futuro promisorio. Es la primera vez que Antonieta está solicitando un préstamo en MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte D. su banco comunal por ser  una mujer  empresaria y trabajadora, la cual es garantía  para las integrantes D. su  grupo. El dinero que solicita es para comprar los materiales necesarios para la elaboración D. sus artículos, comprará lana D. oveja y también yute, el paquete D. cada uno se estima en 500 soles por lo que comprará uno D. cada tipo.
texts.en:
Antonieta is 58 and lives with her husband in their own house. She sells handcrafts maD. of wool, which she weaves on a daily basis on a loom, her main item of equipment, which enables her to produce large amounts; she is a major supplier of handcrafts, which she delivers to the tourist markets and stores in the area.

She initially produced the handcrafts alone but, because of growing demand (an indication of a promising future for her business), her children and some hired employees are also involved.

This is Antonieta's first loan application to MFP; she was invited to join the community bank because she is hard-working enterprising women, which is a guarantee for the members of her group.

The loan is to buy new raw materials, namely wool and jute, which are estimated to cost 500 sol per bale, so she will buy one bale of each.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make handcrafts

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma pertenece al banco comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en Jr. la Merced 6ta cuadra, distrito de Juanjui, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 46 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Es viuda. Vilma con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en zapatos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

 En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, compra zapatos de Trujillo y los vende a sus amigos, compañeros de trabajo, vecinos y personas que la conocen, esto le permite un ingreso mensual para el pago puntual de sus  cuotas.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1.500 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara zapatos de diferentes tallas y modelos  para mujeres, caballeros y niños.

Vilma manifiesta estar agradecida con el banco por permitirle crecer como mujer y empresaria.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to el Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo.” She lives on Jr. La Merced Block 6, in the district of Juanjui, in the state of San Martín. She is 46 years old and is the mother of 3 children, all adults. She is a widow. With her first loan of 300 soles, Vilma decided to invest in shoes. She has been working with the bank for 2 years. Currently she continues with the same business, in which she buys shoes from Trujillo and sells them to her friends, coworkers, neighbors, and other people she knows. This allows her to have a monthly income so that she may punctually make the payments on her loan. With this loan of 1,500 soles, that will be paid in 6 months, she will buy shoes of different sizes and models for women, men, and children. Vilma expresses her gratitude with the bank because it helps her grow as a woman and an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes of different sizes and models for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora tiene 55 años, vive con una de sus hijas mayores. Hace unos meses instaló una tiene en su misma casa, donde atiende todos los días incluyendo los fines de semana y durante casi todo el día ofreciendo productos de primera necesidad a sus vecinos que son sus principales consumidores. Aurora atiende con mucha calidez a sus clientes lo cual dio como resultado la creciente demanda en el consumo de los productos que vende en su bodega que son verduras, víveres,  dulces, bebidas entre otras, para ello Aurora se abastece casi todos los días de la mercadería necesaria  y sus proveedores acuden hasta su tienda para ofrecerles esa mercadería que necesita y lo mas conveniente para ella son las ofertas y promociones que le ofrecen al vender un nuevo producto. Ahora no solo desea seguir vendiendo productos de primera necesidad sino que además implementará para los próximos meses la venta de artículos de regalo, detalles y útiles de escritorio. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella  fue invitada para ser una integrante más que apoye el buen desarrollo de su banco comunal. La cantidad que está solicitando es para la compra de nueva mercadería de gaseosas y útiles de escritorio.
texts.en:
Aurora is 55; she lives with one of her older daughters. Some months ago, she installed a shop in her house, which is open practically all day, seven days a week. She sells staple items to her neighbors, who are her main customers.

Because Aurora provides a very good service to her customers, demand has grown for the merchandise she sells, including vegetables, groceries, candy and drinks. She receives deliveries of merchandise practically every day. The promotions that suppliers offer to sell a new product are particularly beneficial to her.

Now she wants not only to continue selling staple items but to expand in the next few months to sell gifts items, stationery and writing supplies. This her first loan application to MFP; she was invited to join the community bank and support its development. The loan will be used to buy soft drinks and writing materials for sale.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Betsabeth

texts.es: Betsabeth tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de comestibles y otros artículos más en su pequeña tienda que ha implementado desde hace un año, ella atiende en su establecimiento todo el día de lunes a sábados, para Betsabeth tener este negocio le fue más factible porque  le permite estar en casa con sus hijos y a la vez  generarse  de ingresos económicos. Los planes que tiene para su futuro es de mejorar su negocio y de implementarlo con una sección de  útiles escolares,  ya que su casa está ubicada cerca de un centro educativo, estas oportunidades no las desaprovechará por lo que ahora Betsabeth está  con toda la disposición de concretar sus planes. Es la cuarta vez que Betsabeth tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal y un ejemplo para todas de puntualidad. El dinero que solicita es para invertir en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda, además de  implementarla con útiles escolares.
texts.en:
Betsabeth is 32; she lives with her husband and their 2 children in a house which they own. She sells food and other merchandise in a small store which she set up a year ago.

The store is open all day from Monday to Saturday. Having the store enables Betsabeth to be at home with her children while earning income. Her future plans are to expand the store to include school supplies, since she lives near a school. Betsabeth is ready to take this step as she doesn't want to let the opportunity slip by.

This is the fourth time Betsabeth has applied for a loan from MFP. She is one of the most active members of her community bank and is an example to all for her punctuality. She wants the loan to buy more merchandise for her store, and to expand it to sell school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more stock

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María Elsa Rodríguez tiene la edad de 56 años, su estado civil es casado, Doña María tiene 4 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 39 años trabaja como biólogo su otra hija de 36 años labora de enfermera su otra hija de 33 años trabaja como secretaria y su hijo menor de 25 años cursa el 4 año de su carrera, su compañero de vida labora como operario en una camaronera, sus propósitos son de mantener su clientela ya que en estos días es muy difícil la conservación de los clientes por lo tanto ella pretende movilizarse de manera que sus clientes puedan comprar su producto, los sueños de Doña María son de establecer un negocio propio de la venta de especies en donde ella pueda ofrecer este producto favorablemente en su vivienda y además da gracias a Dios por que fue su trabajo quien le permitió lograr que sus hijos fueran unos profesionales y se desarrollaran en la carrera que ellos estudiaron, sus deseos son de darle mejoras a su vivienda y ahorrar dinero para que cuando ya no pueda realizar ningún tipo de trabajo por la edad o las circunstancias ella pueda vivir junto a su esposo una vejez tranquila y satisfactoria.

La actividad económica a la que Doña María se dedica es la venta de especies como: salsa de tomate, achiote, anilina, manzanilla, algodón, romero, quina, clavos de olor entre otros, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años, Doña María labora de manera ambulante recorriendo las diferentes calles por la mañana y por la tarde se ubica en cualquier parte del mercado, ella da inicio a este negocio con fondos propios como alternativa de ingresos para su hogar con este negocio Doña María logro financiar los estudios de sus hijos y mantenerlos hasta que ya se valían por si mismos, y aunque ella ya no debe de mantener a sus hijos Doña María sigue laborando por que ella ha sido trabajadora y no le gusta estar desocupada, además necesita suplir sus necesidades personales como sus gastos de salud, pago de energía, agua, teléfono, y otros gastos que le atribuyen seguir trabajando para hacer frente a las dificultades y la pobreza que se esta atravesando en el país, el financiamiento lo va ocupar en capital de trabajo, comprando mas especies que le permitan sobrevivir y continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
María Elsa Rodríguez is 56 years old and married. María has 4 children. Her oldest son is 39 years old and works as a biologist. Her 36-year-old daughter works as a nurse, and her other daughter, who is 33, works as a secretary. Her youngest son is 25 and is in his 4th year of school. Her spouse works on a shrimp boat. Her plan is to maintain her customer base since it is very difficult to keep them these days. She is organizing things so that her customers can buy her products. María hopes to establish her own business selling various products that can be offered from her home. She thanks God for the work that allowed her children to become professionals and move forward in the careers they studied. She hopes to improve her home and save money so that when she cannot go to work because of her age or other life circumstances, she can live a peaceful and satisfactory life with her husband. María sells salsa, annatto, aniline, chamomile, cotton, rosemary, and cloves, among other things. She has had her business for 20 years. María is a street vendor and travels along various streets in the morning. In the afternoon she sets up in some part of the market. She started this business with her own funds instead of investing them in her house. Because of this business, María was able to pay for her children's education and support them until they were able to do so themselves. Even though she does not have to support her children, María keeps working because she has always done so, and she does not like to be idle. She also needs to take care of her personal needs such as health care, energy, water, and telephone bills, and other expenses that allow her to keep working and face the difficulties and poverty that are sweeping across the country. She will use the loan as working capital, purchasing more products that allow her to survive and continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 50 años, vive con su hijo menor de 8 años en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de bebidas; gaseosas y cervezas desde hace 15 años en su misma casa, por eso separó un ambiente para su negocio, ella tiende todo el día y los fines de semana vende la cerveza en los eventos sociales y para evitar problemas vende solo a personas  conocidas de su barrio. Este negocio le permite obtener ganancias considerables por lo que está planeando a futuro tener mayor capital para abastecerse y ser distribuidora al por mayor. Otro de los negocios alternativos de Isabel es la venta de cintas para el cabello para escolares que reparte al por mayor pero esto solo se da a inicios del año escolar. Es la primera vez que Isabel tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser muy puntual en sus pagos y a apoyar activamente por el bienestar de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de cajas de cerveza, y listones para el cabello.
texts.en:
Isabel is 50-years-old and lives in her own house with her youngest child, who is 8. For 15 years she has made her living selling drinks, including soft drinks and beer; she has a separate area in her house for her business. She spends all day and the weekends selling beer at social events; to avoid problems she sells only to people she knows from her neighborhood. The business provides Isabel with considerable income, so for the future she's planning to increase capital to stock up and become a wholesale distributor. She also has a side business selling hair ribbons wholesale for school children, but only at the beginning of the school year. This is the first loan Isabel is requesting from MFP and she promises to be very punctual with her payments and to actively support the well being of her village bank. She plans to use her loan to buy cases of beer, and hair ribbons.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Rommel David

texts.es:
El Señor Rommel David M. B. tiene la edad de 33 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Rommel tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 12 años y cursa el 1 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 5 años cursa el 1 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora en una empresa con el cargo de atención al cliente, los propósitos de Don Rommel son de ofrecerle al cliente calidad en sus productos, sus sueños son de aumentar su negocio para así generar mas producción en sus productos ya que muchas veces sus clientes le realizan pedidos que implican mucho tiempo elaborarlos, sus deseos son de construir su propia vivienda pues este ha sido uno de los deseos mas grande desde que formo su familia, le gustaría darle las condiciones apropiadas en las que su familia  se  pueda desarrollar en ambiente confortable además le gustaría que sus hijo logren aprender este oficio que les beneficiara en un futuro ya que el piensa que este negocio ofrece altos ingresos.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y reparación de joyas, la ubicación de su negocio es un puesto de venta en el mercado central, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 6 años, Don Rommel inicia este negocio con fondos propios y con la necesidad de obtener ingresos que ayudaran en el soporte familiar primeramente el hacia trabajos en su vivienda pero al tener cierto reconocimiento con sus cliente decidió establecerse en el mercado central ya que este es uno de los mercados mas frecuentados por lo que aquí sus clientes pueden apreciar mejor la calidad de su trabajo y realizar sus encargos de manera rápida no solo a cierta cantidad de clientes sino a cualquier tipo de personas que soliciten de sus servicios, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que consiste en la compra de oro bruto en gramos para elaborar y diseñar otro tipo de joyas que sean diferentes en estilo por lo que esto es lo que mas atrae a sus clientes y necesita invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rommel David M. B. is 33 years old and married. Rommel has two children. His oldest son is 12 and is in his first year of secondary school, and his youngest son is 5 and in the first grade. His wife works for a company in customer service. Rommel likes to offer high-quality products to his customers. He hopes to expand his business so he can make more products since many times his customers put in special orders with him that take a lot of time to fill. He wants to build his own home. It has been one of his biggest dreams since he started his family because he would like to give them a comfortable place to live. He would also like for his sons to learn his business. He feels it would be good for their future since he thinks this type of business brings in a high income. Rommel sells and repairs jewelry. His business is located in the central market. He has had this business for 6 years. Rommel started it with his own money because he had to to support his family. At first he worked from home, but after gaining some recognition with his customers, he decided to establish himself in the central market since it is one of the most frequented markets. There his customers can better appreciate the quality of his work, and he can complete his tasks rapidly, and not only for a certain number of customers, but for anyone who needs his services. The loan is for working capital to purchase grams of raw gold to make and design other types of jewelry that are of a different style because that is what attracts his customers the most and why he needs to invest in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es: Jovanna tiene 25 años,  vive con su esposo en una casa arrendada. Se dedica a atender su restaurante desde hace un año y medio, empezó vendiendo primero comidas al paso, en la calle y hoy ya tiene establecido su negocio en una de las principales calles de su localidad, la atención que ofrece es todo el día, vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, y por las tardes generalmente vende jugos de frutas en su mismo establecimiento. Jovanna quiere implementar mucho más su negocio  por lo que recientemente empezó a vender gaseosas y así notó que su negocio se hizo más rentable, lo que le da más a ánimos a perseverar. Es la segunda vez que Jovanna tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es muy disciplinada en el pago de sus cuentas y una vez más renueva su compromiso de un trabajo decidido para mejorar su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos no perecibles por sacos y de esta  manera abastecerse para la preparación de los platos que ofrece en su restaurante, con otra parte comprará artículos para decorar su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Jovanna is 25 and lives in a rented house with her husband. For the past year-and-a-half she has earned her living running a restaurant. She started out selling takeout food on the street, and now she has a business on one of her area's main streets. She works all day, selling breakfasts, lunches, and dinners, and in the afternoon she typically sells fruit juices right from her restaurant. Jovanna wants to do a lot more with her business, so she recently started selling soft drinks and found that her business became more profitable, motivating her even more to keep it going. This will be Jovanna's second loan with MFP. She is extremely disciplined with her payments and is committing herself once again to work hard to improve her village bank. She plans to invest her loan in sacks of non-perishable ingredients to use in the meals she sells. She'll use the remainder to buy decorations for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for preparing her meals

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo y sus  hijos en su propia casa. Se dedica a cocinar a gran escala para cubrir sus pedidos D. comida para grandes banquetes y eventos sociales, ella prepara alimentos que serán utilizados en bodas y diversas ceremonias. En promedio cocina para 300 personas a más, según las porciones que prepara. Recuerda que los inicios D. su negocio, hace más D. 6 años, vendía D. manera ambulante y fue recomendada por unas amistades para cubrir pequeños banquetes que estuvieron satisfechos por el grato servicio que recibieron y así la recomendaron para mayores cantidades D. pedidos. Hoy tiene mucha demanda y esto garantiza las entradas económicas D. su familia, eso a María la anima a seguir trabajando duro para seguir generando esos recursos. Es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una D. las integrantes D. su banco comunal que siempre trabaja D. manera comprometida para que  todos sus integrantes sean favorecidos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra D. mayores cantidades D. condimentos y demás ingredientes básicos para la preparación D. su comida, D. esa manera abastecer con eficiencia los pedidos que hacen.
texts.en:
María is 59 and lives in her own house with her husband and children. She earns her living cooking on a grand scale for banquets and social events, like weddings and all manner of ceremonies. She cooks for 300 people or more, on average, depending on the number of servings. She recalls starting out more than 6 years ago, traveling around selling her food. She was recommended by some friends to do small banquets. People were satisfied by her pleasant service so they recommended her for others. Nowadays María is in high demand, guaranteeing income for her family, so she's motivated to keep working and earning the money. This will be María's fourth loan with MFP. She is a committed member of her village bank, always working for the benefit of all the members. She plans to use her loan to buy more condiments and any other ingredients she needs to prepare her food, so she can do her job more efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for preparing her meals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marylin

texts.es: Marylin tiene 21 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos, en una casa que es propia de su familia. Ella tiene su propio restaurante que decidió implementar para poder sostener sus estudios universitarios, con los ahorros que tenía arrendó un local que hasta ahora ocupa para su restaurante, y ahora que es vacaciones le da todo el día de su tiempo en la atención, pero en época de clases atiende medio día y sus padres la apoyan en la otra mitad del día. Para Marylin  esta es una de las mejores opciones que ha elegido porque es rentable, ya que la comida es una necesidad primordial y esto asegura la demanda de su restaurante, cuya ubicación está cercana a un terminal terrestre de su ciudad. Marylin tiene planes de mejorar su restaurante en cuanto su decoración y los platos que ofrece. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada por su banco comunal por  ser unja joven emprendedora que es responsable  y tiene muchas ideas de emprender un  trabajo en su grupo. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de vidrios que colocará sobre sus mesas como parte de la decoración, también comprará centros de mesa, cuadros, entre otros detalles que servirán para  decorar su restaurante, demás mandará a hacer un bonito letrero para la fachada.
texts.en:
Marylin is 21 and lives with her parents and brothers in her family's own house. She used her savings to rent space to open a restaurant so she could support her college education. Now that school's out she devotes all of her attention to the restaurant. But during the school year she'll work for half a day and her parents will support her for the other half. Marylin chose this business because it's profitable, and it's one of the best things she can do; food is a basic need, assuring popularity for her restaurant, which is located near the city transit station. She has plans for improving her restaurant with better decorations and meals. This will be Marylin's first loan with MFP. Her village bank invited her in because she is an enterprising and responsible young woman who has a lot of ideas for getting things done in her group. She'll use her loan to buy decorative glasses for her tables, as well as centerpieces, pictures, and other adornments for her restaurant. She'll also order an attractive sign for out front.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Decor for her resaurant

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 29 años, vive  con su hijo de 10 años en casa de su madre. Se dedica a la venta de truchas que vende en la ciudad capital de su país desde hace 2 años, viaja todos los fines de semana, y dos días antes de viajar se abastece de todo lo necesario para sus ventas, ya que esa es su única forma de generase ingresos. A futuro desea ser una gran distribuidora de productos alimenticios nativos de su localidad, por la cual ahora está planeando aumentar su capital de trabajo que es el motor que impulsa sus ingresos económicos. Esta es la primera vez que Luisa tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las fundadoras de su banco comunal y ha recomendación de su hermana tuvo una experiencia positiva de trabajar de manera solidaria. El dinero que solicita es para aumentar la cantidad de pescado que vende. Comprará a 6 soles el kilo de trucha, es por ello que adquirirá grandes cantidades, todo lo que alcance de su préstamo, aproximadamente 100 kilos.
texts.en:
Luisa is 29 years old, and lives in her mother's house with her 10-year-old son. She has been selling trout in the her country's capital city for two years. She travels there every weekend, and two days before her trip she gathers everything she needs for her business, since it's the only income she has. In the future she would like to be a large distributor of local foods, so she is planning to invest more capital in her business, which is the engine that drives her financial earnings. This is the first time Luisa has gotten a loan from MFP. She is one of the founders of her banco comunal (communal bank) and on her sister's recommendation has had a positive experience working together with the other members. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more fish to sell. She will buy the trout at 6 soles per kilo, and will buy a large quantity, as much as her loan will cover -- about 100 kilos.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 30 años, vive en la casa de sus suegros junto a su esposo y su hija. Ella viene trabajando  en la venta de cosmeticos hace 9 años, tiempo en que inició como  ayudante de ventas, pero con el tiempo logró administrar su propio negocio y ahora está empezando con un trabajo independiente y espera pueda tener la misma acogidacon sus clientes quienes la estiman demasiado por su simpatia y carisma. Con el trascurso del tiempo desea instalar un bazar dentro de un centro comercial para incrementar sus ventas y no tener que  recorrer las calles de su ciudad en busca de clientes sino esperar a su clientela en su stand de ventas en donde pueda ofrecer diversos productos como; calzado, ropa y carteras que son utilizados para resaltar la belleza de las mujeres. Lourdes inició su préstamo con MFP hace 4 años, lo que le ayudó a surtir sus productos y a coseguir amistades en su localidad con quienes trabajan conjuntamente, este es su séptimo crédito. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá para adquirir mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, aprovechando las ofertas para luego venderlos a mejores precios.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 30 years old, and lives with her husband and daughter in her husband's parents' house. She has been selling cosmetics for nine years. She started out as a sales assistant, but over time has come to manage a business on her own. She is now starting an independent business, and hopes that it will be well received by her clients, who are very fond of her because of her kindness and charisma. In time she hopes to set up a store in a shopping center to increase her sales. She would no longer have to look for customers on the streets of her city, but could wait for her customers in her shop, where she could offer a variety of products such as shoes, clothing, and purses, which are used to enhance women's beauty. Lourdes first got a loan with MFP four years ago, which helped her stock more cosmetics and make friends locally with whom she collaborates. This is her seventh loan. She will invest the money requested in purchasing more beauty products, taking advantage of discounts so she can later sell them at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock of beauty products

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Mrs. Tita A. hails from Pandan, Antique. She is blessed with one child. Her husband is always in the vegetable plantation helping with chores out there, showing that he supports her in her business. Mrs. A. is engaged in plantation growing and vegetable vending. She is very fortunate that her husband had knowledge in agriculture, and that’s why she had confidence to establish this kind of business.

Mrs. Tita A. sells to people in her neighborhood and in the market. Her plantation is planted with different vegetables. She rents the land for 1,500 pesos a month. She also sells fish every morning for additional income.

Mrs. Tita A. will use the 5,000 peso loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and gardening tools. She dreams that someday she will be able to buy the land so that her profits will go into her savings. She believes that this will provide a better way for her business to progress. She also dreams that her child will finish her study and have a good future.

Through ASHI she has achieved self-confidence and her social life has become much more relaxed.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her vegetable plantation.

loans.name: Nila

texts.es: Nila tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la casa que lograron adquirir hace un par de meses. Ella se dedica  a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace 10 años, y su principal actividad es salir a distribuir sus pedidos de casa en casa, para lo cual se toma 8 horas y lo realiza en las mañanas, esto no le desagrada pues gracias a este negocio pudo relacionarse con las demas personas de su localidad y entrelazar lazos de amistad con sus vecinas. Ella tiene el anhelo de tener con el tiempo un local, pues su gran cantidad de productos no puede venderlos con comodidad porque no tiene un lugar propicio para ello, pero instalando un bazar dentro de su hogar podría incrementar sus ventas y generar más ingresos económicos, pues la venta de cosmeticos es muy rentable ya que la moda y el buen vestir atrae a las señoritas y señoras del lugar. Ella está trabajando con MFP PRISMA hace varios años, este es su séptimo crédito, los cuales le ayudan a mejorar su negocio y tiene en su grupo un espacio de socialización. El dinero que solicita es para comprar una vitrina para poder exhibir sus productos, en lo cual invertirá 2500 soles.
texts.en:
Nila is 51 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in a house they acquired a few months ago. She has been selling cosmetics for 10 years, and her main activity is going out to distribute orders door to door, which takes eight hours every morning. She doesn't mind it because thanks to this business she has been able to meet other people in her community and form bonds of friendship with her neighbors. She longs to eventually have a shop, since she can't sell her large quantity of products comfortably because she doesn't have an appropriate place for them. But by setting up a shop in her home, she could increase her sales and generate more income. Cosmetic sales are very profitable because style and fashion appeal to women young and old in her town. She has been working with MFP PRISMA for several years, and this is her seventh loan. They have helped her improve her business, and the group provides her with a place to socialize. The money she has requested is to purchase a display case in which to display her products, which will cost 2500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a display case for her products

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo U. owns a rice farm. He learned to grow rice from his parents. Now that he has his own family, he works his best to increase his yield to support the needs of his child well. He is 48 years old and has only 1 child. He wants to send his child to school. His harvest is what he depends on for the future of his family. Almost all of his harvest is saved for family consumption, while the remainders are sold to some rice traders in their village.

He is requesting a loan from CEVI (Kiva's Field Partner) for Php 12, 000. He will use the loan to buy the necessary fertilizers, herbicides and other chemicals for his farm. His loan will truly give Eduardo better harvest. In this way, he will have more to give to his family.

CEVI is helping people to start and grow their businesses. By joining in the CEVI program, more people accessed the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage that CEVI gives to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides and molluscide

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn B. is a mother of 4 children. She is a farmer, and rice is her main crop. Her husband, Carlito, is the one who manages their small farm. Because of hard work, they were able to send their children to school near their village. Jerlyn started her rice farm business using her 4 hectares of land. In her experience as a farmer, her farm produces an average of 418 sacks per harvest. From her harvest, she has enough food for the family and is able to sell more rice in the village and to some of the rice traders.

She is asking a loan of Php 11,000 from CEVI (Kiva's Field Partner). Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers and herbicides. She believes that her loan will bring her more harvest. For her, fertilizers will definitely increase her yield. Aside from farming, she also considers looking for some other possible income areas to help her address the needs of her family.

CEVI helps Jerlyn grow her farm. Now she enjoys availing herself the credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage CEVI gives to its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and molluscides

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie M. grows rice in her farm. She is 25 years old and has only one child. Jimry M., her husband, is also a farmer. Together, they till the land, which they inherited from their parents. They do not mind the labor but happily touch the loam, wet soil, feel the heat of the sun to ensure that there is enough food to share on their table.

Rosalie is requesting a loan from CEVI of 9,000 pesos. Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers and herbicides. She believes that her loan will bring her more harvest. For her, fertilizers will definitely increase her yield. Aside from farming, she is also considering seeking some other line of business to help her address the needs of her family.

CEVI provides their clients not just the credit assistance that they need, but also training in their businesses and insurance coverage to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la casa que adquirieron hace tres años. Ella y su familia tienen una fábrica de zapatos donde elaboran los más bellos calzados hechos  base de cuero, vendiéndolos a diferentes comerciantes al por mayor, pues su producción es en grandes cantidades sobre todo en la temporada escolar donde elaboran zapatos que son enviados a otras provincias y vendidos a mayores costos. Dentro de todo este proceso de producción Gladys está encargada de las ventas y lleva los productos al centro de la capital para distribuirlos y si hay oportunidad, los vende personalmente, lo cual le agrada mucho y lo realiza los días viernes y sábados que son días muy buenos para el comercio, el resto de días se ocupa de la administración de la fábrica y sobre todo del personal, pues sus estudios como administradora le ayudan a poder desenvolverse en esta área. Con el tiempo desea mejorar su comercalizacion y está tramitando algunos papeles para negociar con entidades gubernamentales que están solicitando grandes cantidades de mercadería para los colegios más pobres del país, y ella desea ser parte de este proyecto. Gladys es una de las clientes más antiguas de MFP, este es su séptimo préstamo. Nos cuenta que el tiempo que logró tener con la institucion le ayudo a mejorar su fábrica y sus relaciones interpersonales. Los 1500 soles de su crédito los invertirá en la producción de zapatos para aprovechar la temporada escolar y tener mayores ingresos para hacer crecer el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Gladys is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house they bought three years ago. She and her family have a shoe factory where they make beautiful leather shoes, selling them wholesale to a number of retailers. They manufacture large quantities of shoes, especially during the school year, when they make shoes and send them to other provinces where they sell at higher prices. Within the production process, Gladys is in charge of sales and takes products to the capital to distribute them and, if she has the opportunity, even to sell them to individuals. She enjoys the work and does it every Friday and Saturday, which are very good days for business. The rest of the week, she takes care of running the factory and managing the staff, since her education in administration helps her in that area. She hopes eventually to improve her marketing, and is submitting paperwork to negotiate with governmental bodies that have requested large quantities of merchandise for the poorest schools in the country. She would like to be part of that project. Gladys is one of MFP's oldest clients, and this is her seventh loan. She tells us that her time working with our institution has helped her improve her factory and her interpersonal relations. The 1500 soles from her loan will be used to manufacture more shoes, in order to take advantage of the school year and increase profits so they can make the family business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ramp up shoe manufacturing

loans.name: José Cruz

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Cruz G. le está haciendo falta un cuarto para sus hijos, ya  que están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio. 
  Don José Cruz está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de material ya que el y un hijo  se dedican  a la construcción de casa y en horas adicionales a su trabajo, realizara la mejora que desea y así sus niños tendrán su recamara para que estén cómodos y felices.
texts.en:
The home of Mr. José Cruz G. is missing a room for his children now that they are growing and need their own space. Mr. José Cruz is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials given that he and one of his sons are carrying out construction on the house during hours outside of work. He will accomplish the home improvements that he hopes for and this way his children will have a bedroom so that they can be comfortable and happy.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for the construction of a room.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. grows rice for a living. She has been a farmer since she was just a kid, Her parents taught her everything she knows about growing rice from planting to harvest. She is 40 years old and has five lovely children. She wanted to send all of them to school so that when they are old they will find better ways of living to support their future families. Her husband, Warlito B., is very much supportive of her and is the one managing their small farm.

Evelyn is requesting a CEVI loan of 5,000 pesos to purchase fertilizers like urea and ammonium. She will also buy insecticides to avoid insects infesting her rice seedlings. She will also need diesel gasoline for the tractor she uses in plowing the field. Evelyn is also looking for some other income generating activities to raise the bar of their living.

CEVI helps their clients expand their businesses. They are provided with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is a rice grower. She is 38 years old. She lives in Agusan Del Sur, a province engaged in agriculture and forestry. Rice, corn and fruits are among the major agricultural crops and Victoria, a CEVI client, is one of those farmers who continuously produces rice. She has four children and all of them are attending their classes. She learned about farming from her parents. Now, she uses her harvest to support well her family.

Victoria is asking for a loan of 5,000 pesos. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides. Part of her loan will also be used to buy seeds for her farm. In this way, she will have more harvest and augment her income.

CEVI helps Victoria sustain her business. CEVI provides her with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to help her small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en:
Leonilo A. is a dried fish vendor. He buys fish from his friends who are fishermen and sells all his fish in the streets. From his business, he is able to buy food for his family, pay all their family expenditures and save a little amount for their future use. Now, as he is already 42, he wants to expand his business so he can send all his four children to college, an educational attainment that he and his wife were not able to have when they were young. Aside from dried fish, Leonilo is raising livestock. In this way, he has more sources of income for his growing family.

Leonilo is requesting a loan of 18,000 pesos from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy more dried fish and part of the loan is intended to buy more livestock to sell.

Leonilo has been a CEVI client for more than three years. He enjoys credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that the CEVI credit program gives.

loans.use: To buy dried fish and livestock for sale.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van C., 71, is a widow with four children: two sons and two daughters. Even though she is in her early seventies she is still strong enough to work. Three of her children were married and live outside the family home and one daughter is a housekeeper in Phnom Penh. She also has one grandchild who is living with her in a small village across Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Van has been a silk weaver for 50 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Koemsrean

texts.en:
Mr. Koemsrean Y., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Sophea Kong, 24, were married in 2008 and have no children. The couple lives with their parents and brothers and sisters in a small village across Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Koemsrean and his wife have been raising pigs for three months. Beside raising pigs they also produce rice wine and grow rice. Koemsrean is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase feed for raising pigs and growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase feed for raising pigs.

loans.name: Samai

texts.en:
Mrs. Samai M., 38, and her husband, Mr. Leang Sok, 46, live in a small village suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  They were married in 1990 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Four of their children are in school and another one stays at home. 

Samai has been an instant noodles factory worker for three years. Now she wants to quit her job and create her own business by make buddhist materials (see the photo) that people use for buddhism ceremonry for selling. Her husband has been a motor-taxi driver for over ten years. Her husband’s motorbike is very old, it has broken very often, and they lack enough money to change it for a new one. So, Samai is requesting her first loan of $300 to make the replacement and some part of the money to run her new business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike and some part run her new business.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarann C., 52, and her husband, Mr. Thul Poeng, 54, live on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  They were married in 1982 and have three children: two sons and one daughter who was married and weaves silk at home. One of their sons is a chef at a restaurant.
 
Sarann has been a silk weaver since 1992, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Mr. Thul Poeng is a mason and he also assists his wife in spinning thread when he has free time. 

Sarann is requesting a loan of $500 to install one more loom for her daughter to weave silk to get additional income.

loans.use: To acquire a silk loom.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Mrs. Eng S., 52, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Long, 49, who live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  They were married in 1982 and have three children: two sons and one daughter who is married but lives inside the family home. One of their sons works in a decoration company and another has full-time employment. Besides her children, Eng also has one sister living with her.
 
Eng has been a silk weaver for 14 years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes her work to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Eng sells grocery items at her home as well. Her husband has been a construction worker and fisherman since 1979. Eng is requesting her second loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina R. owns a fish pond. She raises fish (tilapia) and sells all of them to restaurant owners to serve for their dishes. She also sells to middlemen who retail her fish in the market. Tilapia is a fresh water fish which earns popularity in the Philippines.

Saturnina is 48 years old and has three children. She worked before in the municipal building in her town as a casual employee. She was not happy about her previous job and decided to have a business. She started her business in 2008, the same year CEVI started its operations. Her profits from her fish pond business help her send her children to school.

Saturnina is requesting a loan of 6,000 pesos from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for the fish. She believes that her loan will bring her more fish to sell. When that happens, she will no longer worry where to get the money to spend for their needs.

CEVI is an organization that helps its members start and expand their businesses. CEVI provides its clients not just with credit but also with training for their business and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the fish in her pond.

loans.name: Khaiy

texts.en:
Khaiy S. is 50 years old. She lives with her husband in Bait district, Takeo province. She is a local teacher at state school and sometimes she buys and sells silk scarves to market-wholesaler at Phnom Penh city. On average, she makes a combined income around US$6 per day, while her husband earns about US$7 a day by working as construction foreman. This couple has six children, two of whom are employed and four who are in school.

Mrs. Khaiy is asking for a loan to purchase more scarves to sell at Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase more scarves to sell.

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en:
Nheb S., 29, pictured here with her husband, has two young children. She raises pigs and works as a weaver from her home and is able to earn about US$3 per day. Her husband stays at home and has a business grinding rice crops. On average, he makes US$16 every day. Two of their children are too young to attend the school.

Mrs. Nheb S. is asking for a loan to purchase rice. She will purchase rice and take off rice husk with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um S. is a 43 year old woman who resides with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province. She and her husband are local doctors and are able to make a combined income of around $17 per day. They have opened a pharmacy from their home selling various kinds of medicines. This couple has four children, all of them are students.

Mrs. Um is asking for a loan to operate another business selling firewood. This additional business will provide the family with extra income to help improve the standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase and sell wood.

loans.name: Arth

texts.en:
Arth R., 59, is married and lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$1 each day and are supported by one child working in the garment factory.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Arth R. included. To help generate more income to support the family, Mrs. Arth R. has an idea to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her son to operate a moto-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom M. is 57 years old and lives with his wife in Bati district, Takeo province. He has been operating a moto-taxi business to earn a living and is able to make US$10 in revenue every day. His wife has a business selling Khmer cakes and makes US$12 in revenue per day. This couple has two children, one who is a construction worker.

Mr. Mom M. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike to continue running his moto-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Thou C., 63, has two children and lives in Takeo province with her husband, Long Aun. They work together as farmers, and they make around US$1 each day. They also receive support from their two sons. One is a construction worker, and the other is a musician. Thou C. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike that her sons could use to commute to work. The motorbike will help her sons reduce their daily transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S. is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Bati district, Takeo province. He is a taxi driver and makes US$5 of profit per day. His wife sells various kinds of vegetables at Phnom Penh market and earns approximately US$40 in revenue every day. Kong and his wife have four children; two are construction workers and one is in school. This couple has requested a loan to purchase vegetables to sell at the Phnom Penh market.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Tung

texts.en: Tung K., 24, is married and lives with her husband in the Bati district, Takeo province. She has been a professional seamstress since 2000 and is able to make US$3 every day. Her husband earns US$3 per day by working as a construction worker building houses. This couple wants to start another business to help generate more income. They would use this loan to open a grocery store.

loans.use: To open a grocery store.

loans.name: Nguyen's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Tuyết Phương sinh năm 1973 ( mã số: 010117090028 ). Chị có cửa hang nhỏ bán đồ đông lạnh ( thịt, cá, tôm hải sản,…). Chồng chị cũng phụ giúp chị đi lấy hang về bán phục vụ bà con trong thôn xóm. Gia đình chị vẫn làm nông nghiệp, chăn nuôi lợn. Hai con chị còn nhỏ, đang độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 300.000 vnđ/ tuần. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 5.450.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở rộng cửa hàng. Cùng vay với chị còn có:
 Nguyễn Thị Độ sinh năm 1963. ( mã số: 010117090034 ) Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. Hàng ngày, chị nấu rượu, nuôi lợn, chồng đóng than bán cho người dân. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 250.000 vnđ/tuần. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 5.450.000 vnđ để mua thức ăn cho vật nuôi.
 Đỗ T. Hà sinh năm 1970. ( mã số: 010117090032) Gia đình có trang trại chăn  nuôi, cả cá. Hai con còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 250.000 vnđ/ tuần.
 Nguyễn Thị Hồng sinh năm 1976. ( mã số: 010117090029 ) Chồng chị là lái xe, hai con đang đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 300.000 vnđ/ tuần. Chị vay mức vốn: 5.450.000 vnđ để phát triển chăn nuôi và đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ.
 Nguyễn Thị Nhạn sinh năm 1960 ( mã số: 010117090031 )bán hang quán tại nhà( thực phẩm, hàng khô,…). chồng là cán bộ hưu trí có thu nhập ổn định. Chị vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng.
 Cao Thị Tớm sinh năm 1956, ( mã số: 010117090030 ) làm nghề bán hang khô, một con đã đi làm giúp đỡ gia đình. Chị vay mức vốn: 5.450.000 vnđ để mua thức ăn chăn nuôi.
 Nguyễn Văn Trường sinh năm 1974( mã số: 010117090033 ) làm nghề kinh doanh cửa hang ăn uống. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 300.000 vnđ/tuần.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen T. T. P. (born in 1973, ID: 010117090028) is the owner of small shop selling frozen food such as meat and seafood. Her husband assists her in managing the shop by taking the inventories from the suppliers. In addition to running the small shop, Mrs. P. is also a farmer and currently raising pigs at home. She and her husband have two small, school-aged kids. Her family’s weekly income is about 300.000 VND. In the next round of loan, she would like to borrow 5.450.000 VND to expand her shop. Other members in her group include: - Mrs. Nguyen T. D. (born in 1963, ID: 010117090034) is a farmer. She also makes wines and raises pigs. Her husband sells coal. The family’s weekly income is about 250.000 VND. She would like to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy food the pigs. - Mrs. D. T. H., (born in 1970, ID: 010117090032) raises poultry and fishes. She has two kids, both of whom are in the school age. The family’s weekly income is 250.000 VND. - Mrs. Nguyen T. H. (born in 1976, ID: 010117090029) would like to borrow 5.450.000 VND to raise poultry and invest in her small shop. Her husband is a driver, and her two kids are still in school. Her family’s weekly income is about 300.000 VND. - Mrs. Cao T. T. (born in 1956, ID: 010117090030) sells dry food in her town. One of her children is now working to assist the family. She would like to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy more dry food for her shop. - Mr. Nguyen V. Tuong (born in 1974, ID: 010117090033) runs a small restaurant. His family’s weekly income is about 300.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buôn bán nhỏ

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S., 65, is a widow who lives with her daughter in the Bati district, Takeo province. She and her daughter are weavers who work from their home and make US$7 of profit every day. They use silk to weave clothes and scarves and then sell them in the Phnom Penh market. The silk dress is a Khmer traditional dress and people wear it during the Water Festival, P’chum Ben and on Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive. Most of the people prefer handmade dresses over machine made. Mrs. Sam S. is asking for a loan to purchase supplies of silk to weave more clothes.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of silk for weaving.

loans.name: Ghullam Sediq

texts.en: Ghullam Sediq K. is 46 years old, married and the father of five children. He is from the Nangarhar province. He is an uneducated man but he is hard working and full of experience in agriculture.  Sediq has been involved in this  business for more than 20 years but now he wants to enlarge his business. Sediq has requested a loan  for 30000 Afganis to buy more seeds for planting that will allow him to  enlarge his business. He is very happy about this process of small loans  and thanks all lenders, Kiva and AFSG in Jalalabad Afghanistan.

loans.use: Buying some seeds and necessary things for his land

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch T. is 36 years old and lives with his wife in the Bati district, Takeo province. He is a dealer who purchases and sells motorbikes in the village. He earns approximately US$20 in revenue every day. His wife makes US$2.5 of profit a day by selling roasted beef and cow stomachs. This couple has three young children and one is in school. Mr. Touch T. is asking for a loan to purchase motorbikes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for resale.

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: Mok S. is 25 years old and lives with her mother in the Bati district of Takeo province. She weaves scarves and makes about $3 of profit per day. Her mother also works as a weaver and earns around $3 per day as well. Mok S. is a single woman who has two brothers. She would like to take out a loan of $800 to purchase silk dresses and resell them to the market-wholesaler in Phnom Penh city.

loans.use: To purchase silk dress

loans.name: Peit

texts.en: Peit S., 27, is pictured here with her husband. They have two young children. Peit sells groceries in the Bati district of Takeo province. On average, she typically makes USD $2.50 of profit every day. Her husband earns about USD $5 a day by working as a driver. Currently, he purchases grocery items in bulk and transports them to the province market, but since this business make very little income, he has decided to change his truck into a tourist truck. He wants to transport passengers from place to place instead of delivering goods.

loans.use: To change the truck

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch O., 53, is married and lives with her husband (pictured here) in the Bati district of Takeo province, Cambodia. She makes and sells rice noodles. Rice noodles are used to make “Nom Banchok,” one of the favorite foods among Cambodian people. Rice noodles are served with many kinds of vegetables such as mints, banana blossoms, string beans, English cucumbers, and mung bean sprouts. Rice noodles are also used in two types of soup: green soup  and red soup. Green soup is cooked with boneless fish and is called “Nom Banchok Samlah Khmer.” Red soup is cooked with pork or chicken and called “Nom Banchok Namya.” O. average, she makes $2.50 profit per day. 

Her husband drives a motor-taxi and makes $2 per day. This couple has six children, two of whom are employed and three are in school. Mrs. Touch O. is asking for a loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate as a motor-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Umarboy

texts.ru: Умарбой мужчина который кридитуется уже пятый год в Микроинвесте, займ берёт для поддержки бизнеса купли продажи скота.Умарбой сам закупает скот и откормив его продаёт на рынке.С помощью чего и ведёт свою жизнь.У него большая семья.Семеро детей,из которых двое уже семейные , имеют свои семьи.А пятеро ещё на иждивении Умарбоя.По уходу за скотом ему помогает его жена.Очередной кредит Умар хочет получить для увеличения численности своих баранов.
texts.en:
Umarboy is a man who has been taking out loans at MicroInvest for five years. He takes a loan to support his business of buying and selling cattle. Umarboy buys the cattle and then resells it on the market after feeding and growing it. He lives with the help of this business. He has a large family of seven children two of which are already married and have their own families. Other five are still his dependents. Umarboy's wife helps him look after the livestock. This next loan Umarboy wants to use to increase the headcount of his sheep.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To incrase headcount of sheep

loans.name: Hanro

texts.ru: Хамро женщина в возрасте 52 лет , мать двоих детей , муж на заработках в России.Сама Хамро работает в районом детсаду воспитательницей.Свободное время уделяет уходу за скотом.Откормив скот на продажу на рынок  выводит её сын, ему 20 лет.Так как оплата труда воспитателей очень мизирная то Хамро длагодаря бизнесу животноводства увеличила свой оборотный капитал и улучшила семейную жизнь.
texts.en:
Hamro A. is a 52 year old woman, she is the mother of two children and her husband is away earning money in Russia. Hamro is a daycare teacher at the local daycare. In her free time she tends livestock. After fattening livestock, her son takes it to the market to sell; he is 20 years old. Since daycare teacher salaries are tiny, thanks to her livestock business Hamro increased her working capital and improved the life of her family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle Feed

loans.name: Inobad

texts.ru:
Джураева Инобад 1958 года рождения. Она замужем и у нее 2 детей. Инобат занимается шитьем национальной одежды.  Она у себя дома шьет национальные платья,  штаны, халаты, детские одежды. А также по заказы вышивает. В сезон свадеб очень много заказов на вышивание наволочек, простыней, и религиозных одежд для детей. Сырье, некоторые комплектующие ее продукта, и некоторые готовые изделия в качестве ассортимента Инобад покупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Партнерами по бизнесу является ее дочери. Они тоже хорошие мастера.  
Хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев для увеличения оборотного капитала.
texts.en:
Inobad J. was born in 1958. She is married and has 2 children. Inobad sews traditional clothing. At her home she sews traditional dresses, trousers, robes, and children’s clothing. She also embroiders orders. During wedding season she has a lot of orders for embroidery of pillowcases, sheets and religious clothing for children. Inobad purchases materials, some of which serve as components for her products and some of which are already finished and serve to compliment her products, at the wholesale market “Korvon” in Dushanbe. Her daughters are her business partners. They are also talented tradeswomen. Inobad would like to take out a loan for $825 (3000 somoni) for 6 months in order to increase her working capital.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Abdulakim

texts.ru: Абдулаким мужчина в возрасте63 лет отец троих взрослых сыновей,которые на заработках в России.Абдулаким вместе с женой занимаются бизнесом животноводства.Все три сына имеют свои отдельные семьи и поэтому не помогают своим родителям.Поэтому Абдулаким не смотря на свои годы очень энергичный и продвижной мужчина который хорошо разбирается в этом бизнесе.Абдулаким хочет купить пару коров чтоб его жена занималась в дальнейшем продажей домашнего молока, благодаря чему они смогут улучшить свою жизнь.
texts.en:
Abdulakim is a 63 year old man. He is the father of three adult sons who are away working in Russia. Abdulakim together with his wife has a livestock business. The three sons have their own families and therefore do not help their parents. That is why Abdulakim despite his age is a very energetic and motivated man who understands this business well. Abdulakim would like to purchase a pair of cows so that his wife can sell milk in the future, thanks to this they will be able to improve their lives.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two cows

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru:
Каримова Нилуфар, 1986 года рождения. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она начала в 2002 году. Она шьет национальные платья и штаны. У них семейный бизнес и партнером  по бизнесу является ее мать, которая очень хорошо знает эту профессию. У них много клиентов. В сезон они шьют по заказу, а зимой покупают отрезы, шьют платья и штаны, которых закупают продавцы с рынка «Корвон» для перепродажи. Нилуфар шьет платья из разных материалов и разных фасонов (кувшин, цветок, хлопок, сердце).
В сезон свадебных мероприятий увеличивается спрос на шитье разнообразных национальных платьев. В такие моменты клиенту необходимы дополнительные средства. для приобретения материалов и фурнитуры. Для этого она хочет получить займ в сумме 1500 сомони и погасить его в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nilufar K. was born in 1986. She started her entrepreneurial venture in 2002. She sews traditional dresses and trousers. They have a family business and her business partner is her mother who knows this profession very well. They have many clients. In season they sew to order and in the winter they purchase fabric pieces and sew dresses and trousers, which are purchased by sellers from the “Korvon” market for resale. Nilufar sews dresses from different fabrics and in different styles (pitcher, flower, cotton, heart). During wedding season demand increases for a variety of traditional dresses. At these times the client needs additional resources to purchase fabric and accessories. She would like to borrow $425 (1500 somoni) for this purpose and will pay the loan back over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Mobin

texts.en:
This is Mobin A. who is 45 years old, marred and the father of five children. He lives in Behsood in Nangarhar province. Mobin is an educated man but he is working as a farmer on his own land. He has been involved in this business more than 10 years but now he wants to enlarge his business. For that he needs for money (loans).
Therefore Mobin has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis with a term of 20 months to enlarge his business  and buy more seeds for the income season. He wants to be a good farmer in the future.

Mobin is happy about this process of small loans in Jalalabad Afghanistan.  He wants to say that without this loan would be impossible to get his business to be its best. Mobin thanks all lenders, Kiva and AFSG in Jalalabad Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more seeds to help enlarge his business

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Маматова Дилбар родилась 1955 года, замужем и имеет 3 детей. С  2002 года она  занимается предпринимательской деятельности. В оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе торгует  женскими одеждами. Ее ассортимент состоит из женских национальных платьев, халатов и штанов с различными вышивками и тесьмою ручной работы, которые она сама шьет дома. А также отрезы с готовой набивкой для национальных платьев, и штаны.  
С помощью программы Кива Дилбар хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони для увеличения ассортиментов.
texts.en:
Dilbar M. was born in 1955. She is married and has 3 children. Since 2002, she has been an entrepreneur. She sells women’s clothing at the wholesale market “Korvon” in Dushanbe.
